org.eclipse.ui.internal.e4.compatibility.CompatibilityPart.create(CompatibilityPart.java:313) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.e4.core.internal.di.MethodRequestor.execute(MethodRequestor.java:56) ... 92 more
The .jucm project is attached.
Could you please advice how to resolve the issue? By the way, on Eclipse Juno SR1, jUCMNav work fine.
Thanks in advance, Nikita Voinov
Looking at the error stack, Eclipse appears to have deprecated code used by jUCMNav concerning context menus. I have filed a bug in our tracker with these details and other investigation.

The entire Action framework in Eclipse has been deprecated for a while (was replace with a command structure), see http://help.eclipse.org/juno/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.platform.doc.isv%2Freference%2Fextension-points%2Forg_eclipse_ui_popupMenus.html
I just hope this is not what is breaking down, as we still rely heavily on actions throughout the code base.
Fixed in version 5.5, now compatible with Eclipse 4.x

bug.short_desc: jucmnav seems to be unable to load in eclipse 3.1.1/gef 3.1.1

long_desc.thetext:
I have seen the app on one of my student's computer and after debugging with the newest version for 5min to no avail, we must investigate the version problems with the newest version of eclipse.
As seen on Etienne's computer, Eclipse 3.1.1 doesn't support jucmnav 1.1 ... we must publish a new version of jucmnav that works under 3.1.1 with an official name (1.1.1 or 1.2?)

I tried eclipse 3.1.1, gef 3.1.1, emf 2.1.1 and it works fine.
I tried eclipse 3.1.1, gef 3.1.0, emf 2.1.0 and it works fine.
Seing the logs, assuming user errors. (jar renamed to zip by browser)

bug.short_desc: scenarios: implement traversal algorithm

long_desc.thetext: read up on proper algorithmns to make sure we don't run into problems down the line.
don't forget to check: - start point preconditions - end point postconditions - fork conditions
Saying this bug is complete. Other bugs fill what is missing.

bug.short_desc: Component delete breaks component definition

long_desc.thetext:
The following line in ComponentRefEditPart: installEditPolicy(EditPolicy.COMPONENT_ROLE, new ComponentRefEditPolicy());
if commented: delete doesn't work if uncommented: new components refs don't have component def and therefore do not have colors, etc.
was a copy paste error. had set the component definition to null in the execute () instead of redo() (sigh)

might have a dependency that we don't know. regardless, Daniel's new computer loads it.

Must prepare project proposal for Dr. Peyton.

bug.short_desc: loops

long_desc.thetext: Est-ce qu

Jason Kealey wrote:
> Est-ce qu
"Il serait aussi ill

can still make a
start --> loop --> end
can then delete start&&end and end up with a loop because the fork/joins were downgraded into emptypoints instead of being deleted.
should not be able to make a loop that has only entry points or exit points on it.
fixed; awaiting feedback.
daniel evaluated and found okay.

bug.short_desc: Should support multiple UCM per file. (one UCM per editor)

long_desc.thetext: As specified early in the design process.
top level element is now URNSpec
done. Approx time to completion of bugs 134+135 (all except junit tests): 10-15h
don't know why this was closed.
fixed. 20+h of work.

the graphical editor should display when scenario is traversed with a red highlight and a tooltip indicating the number of times the element has been traversed.
hook this up with the scenario/strategy view.

bug.short_desc: Metadata indication symbol no longer shows up

long_desc.thetext:
The metadata indicator symbol (Â¶) no longer shows next to the label/name of model elements (definitions or references) that have metadata.
Not sure whether this was caused by a recent refactoring of the label editor, or by an issue related to the preferences (GeneralPreferencePage.ShowMetadataIndicator)
Fixed. Now uses u00B6 as a character in Metadata.java (the one there was invisible)

bug.short_desc: LinkRef bendpoint

long_desc.thetext: In GRL diagram, the move bendpoint command doesn't always put the bendpoint at the right place in the diagram and we should close and reopen the file.

bug.short_desc: stub bindings: prevent binding circular relationship

long_desc.thetext: stub should not be able to be bound to its containing map nor any map that contains it indirectly.
fixed

bug.short_desc: deletion of multiple maps causes errors.

long_desc.thetext:
null pointer exception on deletion of many diagrams simultaneously from outline.
sometimes undo/redo causes the error to popup.
error on save as well.

bug.short_desc: join path bug

long_desc.thetext: if start/end is bound to componentref and drag&drop on stub/fork/join, start/end binding with parent componentref isn't broken. save and see it crash.
problem is widespread in our commands
upgrade test suite to find these automatically.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: variables should be used by code editors

long_desc.thetext:
right now UcmEnvironment is a fake.
UcmEnvironment should be cached in multipage editor so that we don't have to regenerate it all the time.
It should cache the parse trees for expressions as well.

bug.short_desc: not possible to save jucmnav file with save button or file menu item

long_desc.thetext:
i was able to reproduce the following bug:
1) create a ucm map with a couple of stubs 2) double click the stubs and create a new ucm map with this dialog, then exit the dialog 3) go to the new map and change the name of the map 4) try saving with save button (does not work, * is still shown for the jucmnav file) 5) try saving with the file menu item (same thing) 6) when closing the file, a dialog pops up asking whether the file needs to be saved (this works)
i am using the eclipse 3.2 setup and downloaded jucmnav from the update site on sep 24.

fixed.
file was saving bug UI was just not refreshing properly.

bug.short_desc: problem with no more handles

long_desc.thetext: Inforce had found issues with us not managing our images properly and this was confirmed by Gunter's large work file. It could not be opened more than three times without crashing.

bug.short_desc: grl: tool hangs on multi-select

long_desc.thetext: sometimes, when you select multiple grl intentional elements, the tool hangs for a few seconds (say 60). must be stuck in some loop somewhere.
could not repro at home, only happens at school.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: the same start point in a plug-in should be reusable in multiple bindings

long_desc.thetext: Plug-in bindings: the same start point in a plug-in should be reusable in multiple bindings (bound to many IN segments).

bug.short_desc: preferences set in new jUCM wizard can crash MSC export

long_desc.thetext:
... and probably the UCEd import.
Find all locations in the code where a new URNspec is created. Make sure all assumptions on the existence of UCM/GRL are clear. Probably create a ModelCreaitonFactory.getUrnSpec(bool ucm, bool grl) method.

fixed.

Can't repro. Will re-open if we have a specific scenario or file.

bug.short_desc: conditions: restrict where they can be added

long_desc.thetext:
condition labels should only be available on node connections that follow: - or fork - timer
all other commands that manipulate paths must correctly manage conditions - deletenodecommand should keep the preceeding node connection instead of the succeeding one, so that node connections don't get deleted by accident. - all other commands have to be tested for correct behaviour.
also, the add or fork command (and all others that create or forks) should create conditions automatically.
convention: timers succ #1 (index==1) is the timeout path.
transmogrify orfork to and fork should remove conditions
same for addbranch, forkpathscommand.
fixed all those. hoping none left. asked for help with testing.

bug.short_desc: import grl catalog: The imported elements always has an index in the name

long_desc.thetext: An index should be added to the element name only if there is already an element with the same name. Looked in URNNamingHelper class.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: bug with waitingplace/timer path conditions

long_desc.thetext:
Gabriel Craig Lanoix discovered this in his project. See attachment.
Scenario SessionTimeout, Map collect application, Waiting place waits on ApplyDeadline, which does become true but the waiting place is frozen.
See line 304 in DefaultScenarioTraversal. Was a known issue that we weren't sure how to replicate.
Created attachment 7 bug

bug.short_desc: connect serialization bug

long_desc.thetext: repro steps: - create a new jucm - create one component in middle - create two paths. - add timer on one path - move timer to inside component - move end point of send path to timer (to connect) - move the connect inside the component - disconnect - save - reload -> exception is thrown!

bug.short_desc: undo does not work for blank nodes or responsibilities

long_desc.thetext: repro: add a path insert nodes or responsibilities on the path. undo.
Forgot to remove relations to newLinks on surrounding nodes.

bug.short_desc: divide freeform layer into three layers.

long_desc.thetext:
Currently, there are two layers: the connection layer which is behind the primary layer.
We want three layers: - Components (bottom) - Connection (middle) - Path elements (top)

Took a lot of work in MapAndPathGraphEditPart. Rewrited refreshChildren function and a lot of other function to make the figure hiearchy update to put the components in there own layer. This afected the hiearchy of the figures wich had to be refreshed etc...

bug.short_desc: scenarios: scenario in treeview should have children

long_desc.thetext: as specified in UI mockups.

bug.short_desc: stub bindings missing properties

long_desc.thetext: - Condition for plug-ins in a binding are still missing (but you know this) - Could allow creating a submap from stub (probably on the bugzilla DB)
should remove update button and make it save it automatically.

bug.short_desc: msc export bug when no components

long_desc.thetext: if the path always stays in the environment and never crosses another component, the msc export removes (in error) the environment from the list of instances even though there are elements associated to it.

bug.short_desc: Label Commands do not follow recommendations in DevDocCommands
scenarios: plugin binding condition must use editor

long_desc.thetext: right now it is a simple text field. should use the condition editor.

long_desc.thetext:
double click on problems view - undefined variable name causes an error
daniel: if you have the stack trace please paste here.
can't repro. may be related to bug already correct last week.

bug.short_desc: import wizard filename

long_desc.thetext:
When importing a file, the old filename is prefilled by default. If you change this filename and import a new file, the jucm file that is created should have the same prefix as the imported file, however, it currently has the old filename prefix.
blame: jfroy :)

bug.short_desc: export ucm is broken

long_desc.thetext: I got an "invalid filename" message which only disappeared after trying export URN. Probably the new field is required in the export UCM even if it is not used there. It is probably initialized to an empty string, but the first time the export URN is loaded, it is replaced with the current urn name.
same problem happens if i run the export wizard again... so it doesn't have anything to do with the preference store.
Fixed

bug.short_desc: localization problem

long_desc.thetext:
Hello,
I found a problem that prevents people from outside English-speaking countries to use jUCMNav.
As I am located in Germany, my default locale is de_DE. When I start Eclipse without any additional options and try to create a new Use Case Map (new -> other -> jUCMNav/Use Case Map) I get the following error: Message box "Problem opening Wizard: The selected wizard could not be started. Reason: java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerErrror" You can try it yourself with the option -nl de_DE.
When I start Eclipse with the following option everything works fine: eclipse -nl en_US
Best Regards Maximilian Albring

bug.short_desc: UCM component bindings must be supported

long_desc.thetext: UCM component bindings must be supported as defined in Z.151 (section 8.4.5). The jUCMNav metamodel already supports this but might be revised to reflect the latest Z.151 status.

bug.short_desc: Allow transforming AND-join to OR-join and vice-versa
Allow transforming AND-fork to OR-fork and vice-versa
ReqComp

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNav SHALL support the creation, deletion, naming, editing, resizing, and moving of UCM components.

- can now add components - can resize components - can move components - cannot move/resize components that have the fixed property set to true.
remaining: - delete component - show feedback that can't resize/move if fixed. - we're creating componentrefs right now, no components are created - should be able to color components (line/fill) - reorder creation order creating the smallest (area) last so they aren't hidden by other components.

bug 133 - shows feedback that can't resize/move if fixed. - we're creating componentrefs and components now - can color components (line/fill) - reorder creation order creating the smallest (area) last so they aren't hidden by other components. - property view improved to handle colors/references - can return to default color by using the "return to default" button
bugs / todo: - components should be under paths, which are under pathnodes - must add property dialog to pick from existing components - should refactor the property page creator so that it works with responsibilities as well. - default fill color is 0,0,0; current property doesn't refresh if we explicitely choose it; must find workaround.

- components should be under paths, which are under pathnodes moved to bug 179
- must add property dialog to pick from existing components moved to bug 180
- should refactor the property page creator so that it works with responsibilities as well. moved to bug 181
- default fill color is 0,0,0; current property doesn't refresh if we explicitely choose it; must find workaround moved to bug 182.
added: Component Kind are not set, bug 183.
closing this high level bug.

bug.short_desc: support meta-information

long_desc.thetext:
support meta information associated to all urnmodelements.
metamodel is already up to date.
Done by Ali and Pengfei.

bug.short_desc: ReqElemStaticStub && ReqElemDynamicStub

long_desc.thetext:
jUCMNav SHALL support the creation, naming, editing, and moving of UCM static stubs.
This bug is for the normal path element behaviour, not the complex binding of plugins in stubs.
should be able to connect more in/outs.

bug.short_desc: ReqLabels - PathNodes

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNAV SHALL support labels anchored to elements and positioned via X-Y deltas.
- should also be able to remove a label. - add edit in place.
- label should move with pathnode.

bug.short_desc: Install through update site KO

long_desc.thetext:
Hello, I failed to install today the jucmnav 4.2.1 on a clean Eclipse (classic) 3.5.2: After adding the update site, selecting usecasemaps.org packages for install, validating licences agreements it turns out the installation fails with the following message:
Cannot complete the install because one or more required items could not be found. Software currently installed: jUCMNav: URN Editor (UCM and GRL) 4.2.1 (seg.jUCMNav.feature.group 4.2.1) Missing requirement: UCEd Import plugin for jUCMNav 1.0.2 (seg.jUCMNav.UCEd 1.0.2) requires 'bundle org.eclipse.emf.common.ui 0.0.0' but it could not be found Cannot satisfy dependency: From: jUCMNav: URN Editor (UCM and GRL) 4.2.1 (seg.jUCMNav.feature.group 4.2.1) To: seg.jUCMNav.UCEd [1.0.2]
Dorin Petriu reported that installing jUCMNav 4.2.1 on Eclipse 3.5.1 (<<Java EE + BIRT>> distribution) did not work either. Smells like a missing dependency...
Related to Bug 700 as well. Let's remove the UCEd import and dependencies altogether.

Agreed with removing UCEd plugin, but for future reference, I just did a clean install of Eclipse 3.7.1 (for Java developers) and the plug-in installed out of the box. It found all of its dependencies without issue.
I wouldn't be surprised that some people are installing it from means other than the update site.

I think it depends on the initial Eclipse distribution used. In any case, the UCEd import is not usable any more and has become a burden. To be removed until resurrected properly (might take more than 3 days...)!
Fixed along with bug 700...

bug.short_desc: Save Failed

long_desc.thetext: I got "Save Failed Widget Disposed" with no more details. jUCMnav couldn't save or provide information on the cause of problem. I had to quit without saving changes which lead to loss of all the recent works on the model.
I fixed a widget disposed issue in the metadata editor recently which could ahve been the cause of this. Without a stack trace, I cannot do much more analysis.
This problem of save failure happened again. No detail is being provided in the detail section of error message . Please let me know if I can provide you with extra details to solve the problem.
Please look at the Eclipse error view itself. You msy need to addmit to your perspective.

Sorry for the poor spelling on my previous comment - was on a mobile device. In any case: Window -> Show View -> General -> Error Log
You should see the stack trace there. Please paste here.
Thanks! Jason

bug.short_desc: Export individual UCM/GRL diagrams do not work

long_desc.thetext: When selecting "Export", nothing happens! It only works for the whole model as a URN!
There was a String manipulation issue in ExportWizardMapSelectionPage.java when the default diagram names were used. Now fixed.

bug.short_desc: 3.1: properties that have default value are represented twice

long_desc.thetext:
Probable cause: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/porting/3. 1/incompatibilities.html?rev=1.15
11. Changes to isPropertySet(boolean) in IPropertySource and IPropertySource2 What is affected: Plug-ins that implement org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.IPropertySource or IPropertySource2.
Description: In Eclipse 3.0, the specification for the method org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.IPropertySource.isPropertySet(boolean) was incorrectly changed to specify that true should be returned if the specified property did not have a meaningful default value. In previous versions, it specified that false should be returned in this case. This was an inadvertent breaking API change, although the implementation worked the same as before if the property source implemented IPropertySource and not IPropertySource2. This has been corrected in 3.1, with IPropertySource.isPropertySet(boolean) being reverted back to its earlier specification (that false should be returned in this case), and IPropertySource2.isPropertySet(boolean) overriding this to specify that true should be returned in this case. For more details, see bug 21756.
Action required: Any classes implementing IPropertySource or IPropertySource2, where some of the properties do not have meaningful default values, should be checked to ensure that they return the appropriate value for isPropertySource (boolean). Clients should check that the Restore Default Value button in the Properties view works as expected for their property source.

we were adding the color picker twice.
has nothing to do with the platform changes;

bug.short_desc: connection router sometimes crashes

long_desc.thetext:
while testing the cut path command on some files, I have ended up with some problems as discussed with JP.
basically, sometimes when trying to undo a cut path command on certain situations, the connection router is navigating through the graph and ends up finding a node with a connection, but no other path node at the end.
i am not sure why this happens, it may be because the connection router tries to route paths when a command has been partially executed.
in any case, I have studied the cut path command over and over and haven't found anything conclusive in there. i think the connection router's code should be strengthened so that it doesn't crash on such an occasion.
I have given JP an example file with the repro steps and exact location of the thrown exception in the code. he is supposed to attach these to this bug report.
i have recently also encountered this problem in other locations and I do think the problem resides in the connection router.
added quick fix.

bug.short_desc: JUnit Test Cases Failed when Assert is Enabled.

long_desc.thetext:
When we are enabling asserts (with the -ea in the VM arguments), 12 test cases are failing (in JUCMNavGRLCommandTests and KPICommandTests).
These test cases should be fix, and asserts should be enable in the automated build scripts (run by cruisecontrol).

bug.short_desc: Refactor EvaluationStrategyManager

long_desc.thetext:
Refactor EvaluationStrategyManager as it has become very hard to maintain.
Code quality issues: 1) The file includes almost 2000 lines of code 2) It has many responsibilities, which are scattered across the file.
However, the main reason for the refactoring is this: 3) It doesn't properly execute changes to certain elements. For example, instead of using commands for everything, it manually adjusts the evaluation/KPI values and then runs a command that add the evaluation to the model (and does nothing if it is already there). Undo-redo breaks down.
This refactor is non trivial (8+ hours).

bug.short_desc: Undo does not work for delete all in UCM

long_desc.thetext:
- Go to the attached UCM model - Select All - Delete - Undo (nothing happens!).
If I delete the Start Point or the End Point, then the UCM path disappears (as expected), and then I can Undo. This does not work for Select All.
This is a symptom of what I see in larger UCM models as well (delete all no longer deletes everything on a map, and Undo is broken).
Created attachment 25 URN model where Deleting All elements in the UCM breaks the Undo
Bug with deleting definition during same command as deleting reference.

attachment.desc: URN model where Deleting All elements in the UCM breaks the Undo

bug.short_desc: Can set a GRL strategy of one model based on elements of another model

long_desc.thetext: Open two URN models with GRL diagrams and strategies. One can edit the strategy of model A by selecting intentional elements of model B! This must be prevented as this eventually makes jUCMNav crash.

We failed at replicating this bug. Can we get more details on a reproduction scenario?
We tried: 1) Take a GRL diagram with a strategy and copy it into another file. 2) Activate a strategy. 3) Edit the starting values of one file and it will impact another.
Off the top of my head, I thought the issue was storing the current active strategy inside a static variable (re-used across all open models), but this doesn't seem to be the case (or, at least, this bug was fixed later on).
Thanks.

I was able to replicate the bug under 3.7.1 (based on the jUCMNav plug-in 4.3.0). Haven't tested with the new code yet.
I have two URN files with strategies - Open both files - Highlight a strategy in both - Start modifying locations and strategy values while going back and forth between the two URN models - Eventually, I set a value to an IE in a strategy that does not seem to be stored anywhere (or worse, in the strategy of the other model!).
Might have something to do with the way the Scenario & Strategy view keeps collapsing the Strategies folder (and hence the focus on a specifically selected strategy is lost).

Fixed. Daniel: Feel free to do additional testing.
(As I thought, this was a global singleton - now made it a singleton per UCMNavMultiPageEditor)

bug.short_desc: unix: Export Graphics does not build paths properly

long_desc.thetext:
Export Graphics does not check for some invalid characters in the name, and has a hard-coded "add \" in the code. Directory character separation should be added accordingly with the platform.
(Eclipse probably has a variable for this!)
JP: fixed by using an Eclipse standard IPath.

bug.short_desc: GRL: Access to KPI fields in KPI aggregation formulas

long_desc.thetext: Allowing KPIs to access both the satisfaction values and the current values
Should allow KPIs to access any field (including target, threshold, worst, current, unit, etc). We actually need to change the formula language substantially to enable this.

For (my) future reference, this is how you utilize formulas: 1 - Create an element (ex: softgoal named Profit) 2 - Create KPIs (Ex: Revenue and Cost) 3 - Enter the KPI value/target/threshold etc. 4 - Link the KPI to the element using a contribution. Nothing else works. 5 - Name the contribution with a name, typically the name of the element it points to for simplicity (Revenue and Cost). Nothing else works. 6 - Edit the metadata on the softgoal. Create an element named "Formula". 7 - The formulas utilize the contribution names. (Ex: Revenue - Cost) but can also just be mathematical formulas (Ex: sin(45) + 25) 8 - You must refresh the strategy to refresh the evaluations with the new formula.
In the formula variables, added support for these: ContributionName_target ContributionName_worst ContributionName_threshold
Did not add unit because I had no idea how a mathematical formula would use this string.
I believe you also want the math evaluator to be replaced with something else, but I am unsure with what, so I have left it alone for now. If needed, re-open with clarifications.

bug.short_desc: Unhandled exception and exit

long_desc.thetext:
I had a simple UCM. I had an AND-join fed with a thread with a time on it. I placed a AND-Fork between the AND-join and the timer. I went to link the hanging exit of the AND-fork to the start place on the other side of the timer from the ANDjoin and got an unhandled exception and jUCM exited.
When I restarted the UCM was displayed with end and start places as orphans. See attached screen dump.

Created attachment 53 Screen dump of UCM post restart from unhandled exception
Note the path draw as orphan in top left of canvas. End and start point orphaned. missing path between timer and startpoint171.
PS Once broken, I cannot delete the ucm from the parent model.
PS I can delete other UCM from the parent model, just not the one containing the broken elements.

Created attachment 54 Second dump
Turns out I could not delete some elements but could delete others. The remaining elements are the ones that would not delete. They happily are moved around the canvas. I can add meta-data to them. I added a responsibility to path off sp1252??? although the loose path in top left corner was not accepting focus. Paths would not drop onto canvas until after the responsibilty was added to the broken path attached to path off sp1252. I was able to delete the responsibility added to path off sp1252.
Over to you red rover.

Created attachment 55 Ah ha!
It is repeatable. Drop a path on a blank canvas. Drop an AND join on path. Drop a timer on one path. Drop a AND fork between timer and AND join. Take end-point of AND fork and try to link it to StartPoint on thread with timer.
KAPUT!

Example of broken UCM:
<specDiagrams xsi:type="ucm.map:UCMmap" name="junked" id="1080"> <nodes xsi:type="ucm.map:StartPoint" name="StartPoint1171" id="1171" x="475" y="248"> <label/> <precondition deltaX="40" deltaY="-17" label="" expression="true"/> </nodes> <nodes xsi:type="ucm.map:EndPoint" name="EndPoint1236" id="1236" x="810" y="307"> <metadata name="fsad" value="aasfd"/> <label/> <postcondition deltaX="-40" deltaY="-20" label="" expression="true"/> </nodes> <nodes xsi:type="ucm.map:DirectionArrow" name="DirectionArrow1239" id="1239" x="622" y="157" succ="//@urndef/@specDiagrams.6/@connections.2" pred="//@urndef/@specDiagrams.6/@connections.1"/> <nodes xsi:type="ucm.map:EndPoint" name="EndPoint1253" id="1253" x="258" y="127" pred="//@urndef/@specDiagrams.6/@connections.0"> <label/> <postcondition deltaX="-40" deltaY="-20" label="" expression="true"/> </nodes> <nodes xsi:type="ucm.map:StartPoint" name="StartPoint1252" id="1252" x="613" y="261" succ="//@urndef/@specDiagrams.6/@connections.1"> <label/> <precondition deltaX="40" deltaY="-17" label="" expression="true"/> </nodes> <connections xsi:type="ucm.map:NodeConnection" target="1253"/> <connections xsi:type="ucm.map:NodeConnection" source="1252" target="1239"/> <connections xsi:type="ucm.map:NodeConnection" source="1239"/> </specDiagrams>

bug.short_desc: Deleting a node should delete the PluginBindings

long_desc.thetext: Right now the delete doesn't handle the PluginBindings.

Hi Jason, This save error unlike the other one does not have a stack trace. got rid of UI refresh error that occurred when parent was null. can't repro anything else.
Must have been fixed earlier this year.

bug.short_desc: Deleting the last diagram (UCM or GRL) in a URN model causes many errors in jUCMNav

long_desc.thetext: Changed GRLGraphComponentEditPolicy and MapComponentEditPolicy to prevent deleting the last diagram in a URN model.

bug.short_desc: GRL catalogue import is broken

long_desc.thetext: Importing GRL catalogues in a URN model no longer works.
That seems to work for me, unless I am missing the point, please provide how I can reproduce and I will look into it.
1) Create a small GR diagram and export it to a GRL catalogue (should work) 2) Create a new URN model, import the above catalogue. Generates an "Invalid thread access" exception.
Seems to work well now for some reason... Can't reproduce problem.

bug.short_desc: GRL qualitative contributions are inverted in contextual menu

long_desc.thetext: If I select Help, SomePositive is used instead. Same issue with several other combinations.

bug.short_desc: Cutting and Pasting intentions remove the links and is not undo-able

long_desc.thetext: Cutting and Pasting intentions remove the links and is not undo-able. It becomes very difficult when one uses ctrl-x to cut part of an intention name just to find out it cuts the intention and all the links and is not undo-able

The undo works for me. It must have been solved in another commit.
The ctrl-x operating on the edit part instead of the text is another bug already, so closing this one.

bug.short_desc: Export to CSV from GRL strategies is broken

long_desc.thetext: When exporting a URN model that contains GRL strategies to a CSV file (for Excel), then an Invalid thread access error is generated.
This seems to happen only when we are not in strategy evaluation/execution mode. If we are already evaluating a strategy, then the export seems to work fine!
This bug was recently fixed by Andrew as a side-effect to other changes.

bug.short_desc: new elements: support for failure start point, abort start point and failure point.

long_desc.thetext: Support notation for failure start point, abort start point, and failure point

bug.short_desc: MSC diagrams need to be more compact

long_desc.thetext: At the moment, there is a lot of white space in the MSC diagrams in the viewer (instance head size, space between instances, space between elements on an instance, font size, etc). They need to be more compact to be useful for better visualization and for insertion in documents.

MSC diagrams now much more compact. - Default font is 10 points - Inter-lifeline spacing reduced - Inter-element spacing reduced - Narrower timer set/reset/timeout symbols - Labels for start/end/timer now on the right instead of the left (resulting in narrower lifelines)
Also fixed a font management issue and improved the length of the bottom of lifelines.

bug.short_desc: Trends depend on order of strategies

long_desc.thetext: If the name of a strategy is changed, which in turn causes the order of the strategies to change (because now the updated name is in a different position in the alphabetically sorted list of strategies), then the trend is not shown anymore. Instead of showing + or -, only = is shown.
maybe the order should be determined by something else than the name of the strategy

bug.short_desc: UCM Connect element not properly bound

long_desc.thetext:
When connecting an End/Empty Point to a WP/Timer, the invisible Connect element inserted in between is not properly bound to the including component, if any. Asking the component to bind all contained elements does not solve the issue.
The only way to solve it is to move the WP/Timer elsewhere in the component, and then the binding occurs.
Detected by my new OCL static verification rules :-)
I think that's by design because connects are special cases - but agree that it could be improved.
Still not bound properly when, in a component, we select Bind enclosed elements.
I cannot repro since my earlier fix. Can you give an specific scenario and/or file?

- Create a component - Create a path with a timer, in the component - Create another path with end point connected to timer - Component -> Unbind all enclosed elements - Component -> Bind all enclosed elements
When running the following rule (UCM Consistency Completeness -> UCMconnectBindings), you will see that one of the 3 (timer, end or connect) is not bound to the component.

bug.short_desc: Duplicate strategy does not work pre-3.1.0 .jucm files

long_desc.thetext: In 3.1.0, we updated the metamodel. There was a new attribute added in strategies (qualitativeEvaluation, in class Evaluation) that is probably not handled properly when trying to duplicate a strategy. This happens only for files created with a version prior to 3.1.0 and for a duplication in 3.1.0 or 3.2.0.
Fixed. There was an issue with the handling of KPI value sets.

bug.short_desc: turning highlighting on/off does not work

long_desc.thetext: - create a UCM with only a simple path (the one created by the path tool by default) - create a scenario and add the start point to it (i.e., the scenario is selected) - click on the "switch to execution view" icon - highlight does not happen - need to click on the scenario again to activate the highlighting - click on "switch to design view" icon - only the nodes are de-highlighted, the paths remain highlighted - switch back to excecution view - again, does not work! the scenario needs to be selected again

this is by design since 5.0.0 due to being unable to have another way to de-select a strategy context. we standardized the auto-disabling of the scenario, strategy and strategy context when going back to design view.

ok. i understand now why a scenario/strategy is deselected automatically.
however, it is by design that the path remains red in the UCM when switching to the design view?
path that remains red: never noticed, but will re-open this bug and force a refresh.
made red path vanish + unselected the line items so that it is clear you need to click it again.

bug.short_desc: Concern view icon duplicated in Outline view

long_desc.thetext:
In the Outline view, click on the filter icon. Each time, a concern button is added between the definition icon and the graphical outline icon!
See attached file.
Created attachment 28 Concerned about concerns...
was re-adding without checking if there.

bug.short_desc: [invalid bug... spam]

bug.short_desc: Import URN Wizard: The Into Folder textfield should be the selected project by default

long_desc.thetext: The current text in the field is not the selected folder by default

bug.short_desc: There's no way to open/close an editor in the multipage editor

long_desc.thetext: I think we should take a look at the network editor from the network editor of the redbook. I think they did have buttons arround the editing area (not in the palette). Maybe we could put a close button there on each of our editors to control our tabs in our multipage editor.
Should look into the possibilities of deleting and creating Maps from the outline contextual menus.
editors are now opened/closed when you add or delete maps.
problems subsist with files without any maps.

bug.short_desc: renaming conflicts with name auto-completion

long_desc.thetext:
it is not possible to rename lower-case to upper-case or vice versa because the name is automatically reverted to the original name.
there are also problems with shortening the name because the name is always auto-completed to the full name.

This is a duplicate of 787.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 787 ***

bug.short_desc: Conditions: Can't delete conditions

long_desc.thetext: NullPointerException thrown in calculateConditionPosition by a call to getViewer (which calls getRoot which throws exception)

bug.short_desc: Metadata Tags for GRL resources won't show up.

long_desc.thetext: I'm not sure if this is on purpose or not. My first thought was that it would be nice to see the tags for resources similar to intentions.
The same for Actors.
I thisnk this is a more generic problem, as expressed in Bug 901
Solved with bug 901.

bug.short_desc: The size of the output image

long_desc.thetext: The size of the output image is limited. When there is a big URN model, and we use Copy/Paste the model, part of the model can be copied. May be the image buffer size need to be increased
The image gets cropped for what show at positions < 0 on the X and Y axes.
Confirmed. The image is cropped for copy paste, but not for exporting to disk.

bug.short_desc: The value of Contribution association

long_desc.thetext: The tool sometimes does not allow changing the value of the numerical contribution
It would be good to provide a sample model or some sequence of steps to replicate this problem.

Created attachment 34 The pictures describes the steps of changing the value of the numerical contribution
When you right click on a contribution element, and select "select numerical contribution" to change the old value with a new one. It won't change. Some times you need to close Eclipse and open it again to do the previous change. The worst case, which may occurs occasionally, when you need to remove the contribution element and the other connected elements and add them again to the model in order to be able to change the numerical contribution value.
this also happens with any other menu. an indication of this bug is that the icons in the menu are not shown anymore.

This is actually bug 769.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 769 ***

attachment.desc: The pictures describes the steps of changing the value of the numerical contribution

bug.short_desc: Copy/cut & paste for UCM paths in the same model

long_desc.thetext:
Add support for Copy/cut & paste for UCM paths in the same model.
if is easy, support copy-paste across models.
now supports pasting bindings. completes this bug.

bug.short_desc: MSC export does not generate all scenarios

long_desc.thetext: In the following example, I have been able to export scenario for #2482, 2501, 2506 and 2512, but not for 2357 (Base), 2493 (CreateAccount) and Form not valid (3728). jUCMNav does not report any issue in the Problems View for any of these scenarios.
Created attachment 10 Example where 3 scenarios do not generate problems but are not exported to MSCs

attachment.desc: Example where 3 scenarios do not generate problems but are not exported to MSCs

bug.short_desc: problem with dependency evaluation

long_desc.thetext:
this problem only occurs for the qualitative evaluation algorithm.
see attached jucm file: Softgoal12 is evaluated to None even though all AND-decomposed tasks are Satisfied and the dependency is also Satisfied. if the dependency is removed, Softgoal12 is evaluated correctly as Satisfied.
Created attachment 47 jucm file with dependency problem

bug.short_desc: Stub binding window does not allow setting the replicationFactor

long_desc.thetext: Should be with the probability/transaction sub window.

bug.short_desc: Incorrect warning message pops up when naming a Responsibility item with null

long_desc.thetext: In UCM drawing, when name a Responsibility with a existed name, a warning message will pop up to inform the user to change the name. But when name the Responsibility with null, the warning message will still pop up to inform the user the name has been already used. A proper warning for blank naming should be set here instead of the same one. Please refer to the attached screen-shot for the details. Version?6.0.0

bug.short_desc: export overwrites existing file without warning

long_desc.thetext: - export scenario to jucm file and choose a filename that exists in the chosen destination directory - existing file is overwritten without warning

bug.short_desc: Copy/paste does not preserve responsibility-to-component bindings

long_desc.thetext: It does not preserve any bindings other than the top level PluginBinding - not yet implemented.
fixed in recent commit.

Nope... Still does not work.
Also, it seems Crtl-C, Ctrl-X and Ctrl-V do not work anymore.

misread this. you meant pathnode/component to component bindings. now done.
ctrl keys sometimes don't work on first attempt (I assumed platform issue)

bug.short_desc: UCM Diagram FillColor

long_desc.thetext: UCM Diagram FillColor the objects don't fill colour. Instead it targets the fillline method and remain constant white fill for the fillcolor.

bug.short_desc: UCMNavMultiPageEditor needs refactoring

long_desc.thetext: UCMNavMultiPageEditor needs to get refactored to eliminate redundant code with UCMEditor. Maybe this should be done by someone else than Jason to have different eyes look at the code.
1200 lines in this file -> 600 lines in this file. made many new files.

bug.short_desc: Enumeration types should allow for elements with mixed cases

long_desc.thetext: At this moment, jUCMNav forces enumeration types to have elements in uppercase only (and I am not sure why). Thomas says this is creating problems in his models when he is transforming URN models. We should likely allow mixed cases, as allowed by the standard.

bug.short_desc: searching should be optionally restricted to the current file or all opened files

long_desc.thetext: Tried using the Eclipse built-in scope but was very complex. Ended up with a simple drop-down with three options: everything currently open editors current editor (with focus)

bug.short_desc: DirectEdit for conditions doesn't change model

long_desc.thetext: need to create a command for changing the label in the Condition

bug.short_desc: Satisfaction of an actor becomes hidden after "Delete Initial Evaluation"

long_desc.thetext: once deleting the initial evaluation from the context menu, satisfaction of actor won't appear on the diagram. It is calculated and can be seen in the metadata though.

bug.short_desc: hide some feature by default (for novices; kpi, aspects, performance)

long_desc.thetext:
- Hide KPI - Hide Performance Analysis - Hide Aspect-Oriented elements.
At a high level, we would have preference settings that enable/disable these. The actions would simply not appear in pop-ups, and certain tabs would not appear in the properties page. The metamodel would remain the same, however, as one could enable these at any time.
The Concern button in the Outline does not seem to come back from the advanced mode...

bug.short_desc: MSC Viewer caanot open file name with spaces

long_desc.thetext: If the .jucmscenarios file name contains a space character, the MSC Viewer will not display anything.

bug.short_desc: investigate undo bug in grl

bug.short_desc: "Save failed Widget is disposed"

long_desc.thetext: After creating a relatively simple UCM diagram the tool started raising the error in the title. At one point the tool kept raising the error and would not let me shut down eclipse. I managed to delete the UCM and start scribbling again. The error started to reappear. It doesn't appear to stop saving per se. If I exit the tool and re-enter the file appears to be saved. I did note that when trying to set the probability of a path it also raise the error and it wasn't apparent the probability was set correctly because it always displayed 1.0 in Property view. If I closed tool and reopen the probability appears to have been set. Closing tool seems to clear the problem in the previous session but once it occurs again it persists until the tool is closed and reopened. I am running in Luna 4.4.0 Build ID 20140612-0600 of the eclipse modelling tools.

bug.short_desc: UI: X-Y scroll delta not taken into consideration when inserting a node or responsibility

long_desc.thetext: When inserting a new node (or a new responsibility) on an existing path, the X-Y coordinate of the new node is incorrect if the scroll bars are not at the top-left corner. The X-Y deltas from the scrolled view do not seem to be taken into consideration. This actually gets worse when we also start playing with the zoom factor.
I tested this and

Ok, this is resolved and committed. I had a similar bug before when creating nodes on the diagram while I was zooming. But I didn't do the same thing for creating node on connections. You have to adjust the coordinates of your figure when creating it, but not when you move it (weird)...
Seems to be working well now.

bug.short_desc: GRL variables not recognized even though they exist in the list of variables in the condition editor

long_desc.thetext: - turn off GRL variables in the preferences - create a GRL graph with one task and a UCM with one OR-fork - turn on GRL variables in the preferences - go to the condition editor for one branch of the OR-fork - replace the existing condition with the GRL variable - error: variable not defined - close/open file and try again, works!
Maybe this should be a property of the model, not just a preference.

bug.short_desc: unique names no longer checked in properties

long_desc.thetext:
for some reason, unique names are no longer checked in properties (both advanced and tabbed views):
responsibilities components intentional elements kpi information elements
from the editor, these constraints are enforced.
I am pretty sure this was not allowed via the properties previously.
also: grl actors

bug.short_desc: The import/export of GRL catalogues, export of CSM/CSV, and HTML reports do not handle escape characters

long_desc.thetext: Quotes (") and likely other types of escape characters in XML are not handled properly when exporting (and probably importing) GRL catalogues.
This is also the case when exporting to CSM and CSV. Same issue for HTML reports.
Fixed for HTML reports, GRL catalogues import/export, CSM export. CSV, DXL, and MSC remain to be checked. No issue noticed for PDF, RTF, and Z.151.

Fixed CSV & DXL. MSC was fine.
DXL was also crashing due to strategy refreshing (same as CSV previously had). Ported over the fix.

bug.short_desc: translation of concern into French

long_desc.thetext: should be: prÃ©occupation
Fixed (pr\u00e9occupation)

bug.short_desc: conditions: property page

long_desc.thetext: when clicked on, conditions should show the node connection properties. when clicked on, node connections should show the condition properties.

bug.short_desc: undo doesn't bring back condition labels

long_desc.thetext: - Or-fork with a labelled branches (conditions): If such a branch is deleted, it is converted to a path with a start point (which is file). However, undoing this operation does not bring back the condition label.

also seems we've reintroduced a bug where deleted conditions get reinserted on the wrong paths.
increasing priority.
the bug mentioned initially seems to be with deletestartncend.
the new bug involves delete multicommand.
finally was just with deletemultinodecommand

bug.short_desc: Add support for feature model description and analysis.

long_desc.thetext: 1. Add support for feature model description and analysis. a. Based on the current graphical editor in jUCMNav, add feature model diagram support for users. Create a feature diagram A user should be able to draw feature model diagrams by using the feature elements and dependency links provided in the palette. A user should be able to change the attributes of each feature, for example changing the featureÂs name, marking the feature as selected or not selected, adding constraints and etc. A user should be able to change the type of links. Links can be the followings: [graph] b. Add feature model evaluation mechanism (a new evaluation mechanism that can be selected like the existing ones). The feature model should be able to be evaluated by forward propagation, with the leaf node features being initialized by users. After the evaluation, a valid feature should have color green, while invalid features should have color red. So users can be clearly indicated what makes the feature invalid.

bug.short_desc: MSC of start point with condition created incorrectly

long_desc.thetext: create a model with a parent map and a plug-in map. the plug-in map contains a waiting place. the waiting path and continuation path are connected to the stub on the parent map, while the trigger path is local (its start point is not connected to the stub). if the local start point has a precondition that is set to true by a responsibility on the waiting path just before the waiting place, then the generated MSC shows the condition and local start point before the responsibility instead of afterwards.
Created attachment 13 UCM model
Created attachment 14 MSCs generated from UCM model

bug.short_desc: UCM execution path not "lighting up"

long_desc.thetext:
I am running in Luna 4.4.0 Build ID 20140612-0600 of the eclipse modelling tools.
When switching to scenario execution view the UCM thread is not lit. I had a stub graph so I switch to that and the change of context appeared to incite the lighting of the thread. However, random segment of the thread lit only. The responsibilities along the path did light after the context switch so not all is lost however, this is on a simple experiment with a couple of forks.

bug.short_desc: BSplineConnectionRouter doesn't support forks

long_desc.thetext: Right now the structure is there to support forks but the code doesn't work in BSplineConnectionRouter. After fork support is added to the diagram, this could be interesting to work on.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 136 ***

bug.short_desc: Remove the Default GRL evaluation algorithm

long_desc.thetext:
This is the mechanism created by J-F Roy in his thesis in 2006. It uses deprecated attributes (priority/criticality) and it has essentially been replaced by the Mixed evaluation algorithm.
Time to phase it out (so we don't have to maintain it any longer).

bug.short_desc: Synchronizing and Blocking stubs are not properly exported to Z.151

long_desc.thetext: The export seems broken when they are used.
I mistakenly removed the statement to set ID for InBinding, LinkRef, NodeConnection, OutBinding, PluginBinding, URNlink, grl.BeliefLink and LinkRef. And I have added them back. It works fine now.

bug.short_desc: import/export icons

long_desc.thetext: Need to provide icons for import/export of diagrams in contextual menus.

bug.short_desc: labels should be created automatically for the following elements.

long_desc.thetext: ComponentRef RespRef Start End Stub WaitingPlace Timer
Code added in modelcreationfactory. They need to be positioned properly by the figure. passing work to jordan to finish up.

bug.short_desc: Dragging and Dropping more than one intention from outline bar

long_desc.thetext: It is not possible to drag and drop more than one intention from the list of definitions from the tree list on outline bar.

bug.short_desc: problem with include order of scenarios

long_desc.thetext:
- open the attached file - go to the scenario called Combination and include "One" - two other scenarios are shown in grey because they are indirectly included (all ok)
- now, also include "Two" - the scenario "Init Two" is not shown in grey even though it is indirectly included by "Two" - it is not possible to move "One" anymore but it is possible to move "Init Two"
- now, move up "Two" - only "One" is not shown grey even though two scenarios are still included directly
Created attachment 33 contains problem case
Also fixed some refresh issues (but not all of them in odd fringe case scenarios).

bug.short_desc: condition: editpart display

long_desc.thetext: the condition edit part should now be displayed if the label string is empty.
jordan did it.

bug.short_desc: 2. Support Object Constraint Language (OCL) in feature modeling.

long_desc.thetext: a. Types of constraints can be supported: [2] Invariant: An invariant is a constraint to all features. All features must satisfy such constraints to be valid. Precondition: A precondition to a feature needs to be satisfied before the feature can be evaluated to valid. Guard: A guard is a constraint to a link. A link is valid or working only if the guard of this link is satisfied. b. Add interface for users. So constraints of different features can be specified during the time when a feature model is created. This can be done by either adding constraint attributes to feature elements and dependency links or adding special symbols in the feature model diagram. c. Feature model evaluation should be able to handle the situation with constraints.

bug.short_desc: Cannot generate MSC (.jucmnavscenario) file

long_desc.thetext:
Reported by carl.sonnen@ca.pwc.com:
"1) Checked that com.site.UCMScenarioViewer_1.2.0 is present (it is). After verifying the preferences are as you specify --and as per online help, I tried to save the file to the desktop, but it still won't save. My colleague has the same issue on his laptop. I tried to see if there are any eclipse or JUCMNav log files anywhere and also looked at the windows event logs. I didn't see anything. However when I tried to open your sample .jucmscenarios file in Eclipse I got the following stack trace--see attached. [...] I tried saving the jucmscenarios file both inside my workspace and outside of it. [...] All files are on my system disk which is a solid state drive-and not on a network. My laptop is a company machine and all data on the drive gets encrypted. My O/S is windows 7. It is a very new machine with highly customized security settings particular to my employer. There is my colleague however who had the same issue on an entirely different machine."
Notes: - The .jucmnavscenario files (generated elsewhere) can be visualized. - Daniel was able to generate the .jucmnavscenario file from his install (with the latest beta version) - The problem occurred on Windows, with Eclipse Indigo SR1 (distribution: IDE for Java Developers). Maybe a missing dependency issue? - Maybe a filename issue (fixed since 4.3.0)?
Created attachment 35 Stack content after MSC export bug

You cannot use File -> Open to open a *.jucmscenarios file; please use File -> Import -> File System instead.
Added a pop-up message to help guide people.

attachment.desc: Stack content after MSC export bug

bug.short_desc: warning required when deleting scenario that is included somewhere

long_desc.thetext: When deleting a scenario definition that is included by another one, then a warning shall be displayed and a confirmation required.

bug.short_desc: GRL editor problems with focus

long_desc.thetext:
I am running in Luna 4.4.0 Build ID 20140612-0600 of the eclipse modelling tools.
When dropping GRL elements on canvas they often are not drawn with focus "locked" in text field for element name. Random clicking around canvas appears to eventually sort it but is a pain if you are trying to work fast. The problem often occurs also when moving elements. Looks like bugs in application of widget focus.

bug.short_desc: RespRef in diagram should be linked to Responsibilities

long_desc.thetext: (As with ComponentsRefs and ComponentElements)
remaining: property source needs to behave like components.
fixed.

bug.short_desc: Performance issue with large URN models

long_desc.thetext: In the attached model, if we select an element (in GRL or UCM) in a diagram, there is a lag before the tool reacts (and actually, this can be several seconds on slower machines!). Once selected, we can move the element very quickly many times. But the first selection really takes a while.
Created attachment 29 Large URN file (100+ diagrams), where selection is very slow
What version of jUCMNav did you see this in? We've made significant performance improvements in the latest build. This file seems fast in the latest build.

Was using 4.1.0, not the latest built... apparently some users think they can get the latest built from Eclipse's update option. Maybe we should be clearer in our instructions.
Updated and apparently it now works like a charm.

attachment.desc: Large URN file (100+ diagrams), where selection is very slow

bug.short_desc: Export to .dot for Graphvis produces 0 length file

long_desc.thetext: When exporting a GRL map to .dot file for GraphVis it produces a 0 length file. Exporting to jpeg or other graphics format works ok. jUCM = V4.2.1 Eclipse = V
Eclipse Modeling Tools Build id: 20100218-1602
*** Bug 685 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: Copying and Pasting Changes the coordinates of labels

long_desc.thetext: When a GRL diagram is copied and pasted, the locations of labels are not the same as the original ones.

bug.short_desc: multiline input for responsibilities / stubs

long_desc.thetext: when metadata is used, the names of responsibilities and stubs may end up being very long. it'd be good if long names can be spread over multiple lines.

Originally, this was investigated in the context of this Eclipse bug. See my comment from 2005: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=25356
Seems that they haven't closed the bug, but they have made it possible for us to support multiple lines within the editor.
AutocompleteTextCellEditor (call super(parent, SWT.MULTI) instead of super(parent)) and it becomes a multi-line editor, in the editor only. (With this change, all label editors become multi-line, not just stubs & responsibilities).
This causes a few problems: 1 - The autocomplete doesn't work that well anymore (hitting enter adds new lines instead of selecting the element/closing the auto-complete editor). 2 - Clicking elsewhere sometimes doesn't close the editor - and I doubt people will understand that CTRL-ENTER is what they need to hit to close it. 3 - The properties view don't support this unless we explicitly change them to use a text area editor instead of a text editor. (They actually work, but don't show the carriage returns) 4 - This also doesn't seem to have anything to do with the metadata - unless I am missing something.
I might be able to inverse the ENTER vs CTRL-ENTER behaviour. Do you think this would be desirable?

Mhhh. Feature interactions again!
Enter should indeed close the editing. If we could have Shift-Enter for carriage returns, this would be more intuitive I think.

A quick (15min) attempt reveals that it isn't as easy as I would have hoped to switch the enter behaviour with, say shift-enter, as you suggest. This behaviour is deep within the Text class, not just the TextCellEditor.
Not sure what the next steps should be.
Instead, I could make the "name" field, in the properties view, multi-line. (Just like the description). For the rare cases where you want to actually set the field to multi-line, you would thus use the properties view. The editing via the editor would show it as a single line, but it would be displayed on screen as multi-line.
Thoughts?
It was discussed to make it possible to have multiple lines for names inside the properties page only.

The multiline editor for names is annoying for several other types of elements (e.g., I just had an issue with the CSV import/export feature, because a strategy name had a carriage return at the end that confused the CSV file quite a bit).
Suggestion: 1) after editing, if a name finishes with a carriage return, then delete that carriage return. 2) maybe: for names that are not meant to be multiline (e.g., everything in the Scenarios and Strategies view, including groups, scenarios, strategies, variables, enumerations, etc.), make sure that carriage returns within a name are converted (to space?)

1. Trailing newlines are removed. 2. Restricted to responsibility, resp and stub as per the bug. Augment the whitelist if desired by going to seg.jUCMNav.views.property.tabbed.sections.NamePropertySection.java - getFeatureValue.
Preferred whitelist to blacklist, but maybe you'll want me to inverse.

Ok for white list.
When trailing CRs are removed (e.g., for start points), they seem to be transformed into trailing spaces at the moment. I would rather not have extra spaces in that case.
Removed trailing on all cases.

bug.short_desc: Fix broken links in HTML report

long_desc.thetext: The link to the jUCMNav project web page (on the HTML report title page) is broken . This link should be updated.

bug.short_desc: Remove "Report prefix" option in the Report Gen. Wizard for HTML reports

long_desc.thetext: Since the report prefix (specified in the Report Generation Wizard) is not used (and not necessary) when a report is generated in HTML, this feature should be removed/disabled when this type of report is selected.

bug.short_desc: Cannot rename groups rules/metrics, and exporting does not ask confirmation

long_desc.thetext: Rules can be renamed (although the tree is not refreshed), but groups cannot.

Cannot rename rule groups, which is annoying when importing. Also, exporting does not ask confirmation when file exists.
Now fixed.

bug.short_desc: Reporting does not include meta data or user defined links

long_desc.thetext:
I am running in Luna 4.4.0 Build ID 20140612-0600 of the eclipse modelling tools.
When I export a model, I am expecting meta-data attached to UCM and GRL to be exported with the model. I am also expecting user defined linkages between elements to be reported.
Neither appear to be exported.

In particular I have meta-data on "Failure points" in a UCM that I wanted to be exported but is not exported. Meta-data on Components is not exported. Meta-data seems to come out for responsibilities.
All checkboxes in preferences under "Report Generation Preferences" are checked.

Created attachment 51 pdf report with UCM but with missing meta-data and links in report
As discussed. The "failure points" are not reported in the report. Therefore neither is the meta-data reported. The links, apart from their graphical glyphs on the diagram, are not reported. As mention I am using default export options so most all things are checked.

Created attachment 52 Export settings
I guess it isn't a bug per se. I note that there are no options for pumping out "Failure points". Problematic for what I am proposing in my Dissertation as all links and meta-data go towards rationale capture and any missing data in reports means reports cannot be used as Engineering Assurance record.

attachment.desc: pdf report with UCM but with missing meta-data and links in report

bug.short_desc: Cut and Paste Incorrect message (UCM)

long_desc.thetext: After cutting part of a UCM (i.e. a separate path which used to be connected to the main path but not connected anymore), when pasting this one receives massages about all deleting those responsibilities in the original map which were not part of the cut and paste. Of course it doesn't delete them but the message doesn't make sense.

bug.short_desc: Belief box doesn't adjust

long_desc.thetext: using the belief as "note" causes using a lengthy description and the box can't get big enough for the description.
Comment boxes, which are rectangular, multiline and resizable, should be used for lengthy descriptions (they are now available in the latest release). Belief text should not have to be that lengthy.

bug.short_desc: Rules should be categorizable as errors or warnings, with appropriate icons

long_desc.thetext: Some rules should generate errors, others warnings. This should be settable in the preferences, and visualized with SWT icons in the preferences and in the Problems View.
Fixed. Updated icons for the metrics as well. Also updated the import/export mechanism (backward compatible with old rules in XML).

bug.short_desc: Documentation on the jUCMNav TWiki
URN links can be created across models

long_desc.thetext:
URN links must be limited to a single model. Yet, I can start a link in one model and end the link in a different model (with several problems, as expected!).
I suggest remembering what model the source link is from, and use this as a guarding condition for showing the End link option(s).

An extra guard condition was added that checks whether both ends have the same URNspec. Different models will have different URNspec objects as well.
&& (this.getURNspec( fromElement ) == urnspec)

bug.short_desc: move strategy

long_desc.thetext: It should be possible to move a strategy from one group to another.
using drag and drop (this can already be done via the properties view)
fixed as same time as 631.

bug.short_desc: GRL contribution values are editable

long_desc.thetext:
I can click on a contribution value (say, 25) and start editing it! This would be a great behaviour if that worked, but it does not work and always give me an error window (Name already in use).
We should either prevent the editing, or support it correctly. The first option is simpler I think...

fixed the error bug; can still edit but does nothing. (would have expected that removing the direct edit policy would have disabled it completely, but no)
however, we can create a new bug with a feature request if desired; auto-complete may be of interest. didn't implement it today because not sure if I should have used values or names or both, for example.

bug.short_desc: Z.151: unmarshalling IE in strategy duplicates metadata

long_desc.thetext:
- Create a new file with a GRL diagram - Add a goal - Add a metadata to that goal (say, X=100) - Select a strategy and initialize this goal to 100 - Export to Z.151 format - Reimport this .z151 file into a new file. - You will see that the metadata attached to this intentional element gets duplicated (X=100 appears twice!)
This only happens to IEs that are the target of evaluations in evaluation strategies. The entire list of metadata for such IE gets duplicated. I suspect the unmarshalling in IntentionalElementUMHandler.java to cause this.
Fixed EvaluationUMHandler (from true to false when constructing the IE connected to the evaluation).

bug.short_desc: ID should be read-only in the properties view

long_desc.thetext: it is autogenerated and managed.
This is the kind of thing we should put in the general EPropertyObject class... Since every object in our model will have a read only ID.

bug.short_desc: GRL propagation does not handle dependency loops correctly

long_desc.thetext: When many dependencies are used in a GRL model, dependency loops are not handled properly (the satisfaction values of some elements are not computed). This should be minimized, and the tool should report elements not computed.

bug.short_desc: UCM waiting kinds should be supported for waiting places and timers

long_desc.thetext:
UCM waiting kinds should be supported for waiting places and timers, as described in sections 8.2.13 - 8.2.15 of Z.151.
This will impact the traversal mechanism.

bug.short_desc: Polygone figure class should be made rotatable

long_desc.thetext:
This way we could reuse this behavior with stubs, end point, and-forks and everything that needs rotation along a path.
We should probably make an interface like RotatableFigure or something like that that Polygone would implement and then in the connection router or anywhere where we want to rotate a figure, we only have to know that it`s a rotatable figure and use the interface instead of the class...
jordan programmed this as an interface.

bug.short_desc: Cannot add UCM timeout path through contextual menu

long_desc.thetext:
- Add a path with a timer - Add another path - Connect the empty point or the end point of the second path to the timer - Right-click on the timer: the list of path operations does not allow for a timeout path to be added
This bug does not appear if the timer was added after the 2nd path was created (when we click on the connected timer, it seems the timer element then has priority and hence a timeout path can be added)

bug.short_desc: Standardize date-time strings in reports

long_desc.thetext: The default timestamp format when creating/editing a URN model is MMMMM d, yyyy HH:mm:ss aaa z (i.e. it uses the full date followed by the time in the 12-hour AM/PM format, followed by the time zone). However, these time stamps are not translated when jUCMNav uses a locale other than english-US. Furthermore, the report generation date is always created using the current default locale. These timestamps should be consistent throughout the application, and therefore should be changed in the report generator. To follow standards, these timestamps should be created using the current default locale, but the time should still be in the AM/PM format.

All date and times are now displayed in the standard format, and the month is now translated in the language in which jUCMNav is running (this is done when the string corresponding to the date is formatted).

bug.short_desc: 5. Transform feature model to concern-oriented design model
Generating a report with an empty diagram generates an error.

long_desc.thetext: The tool tries to crop an image with negative height/width...

bug.short_desc: Incorrect handling of dependency in GRL qualitative algorithm

long_desc.thetext: With the GRL qualitative algo (only), the following dependency is incorrectly handled (see "Data in New Service Node", which should be Satisfied). This is likely an initialization problem related to the ordering of the evaluation.
Created attachment 15 Examples...
Created attachment 16 Sample URN file

bug.short_desc: ComponentRefEditPart should extends ModelElementEditPart

long_desc.thetext:
ComponentRefEditPart should extends ModelElementEditPart wich should delete a lot of code that was duplicated.
Don't register as an observer in constructor.
Fixed.

bug.short_desc: automatic naming of AndJoin/Fork and OrJoin/Fork

long_desc.thetext:
when an OrJoin is converted into an AndJoin or vice versa, the name of the OrJoin remains (e.g., it is OrJoin1234). the same applies to OrForks and AndForks.
this is really confusing when transforming the UCM into more detailed models as the name is used to identify the element.

Fixed. Note however:
- If the name is OrJoin123 and it's transformed, it now becomes AndJoin125 (new ID number is used). - If the name was changed to something else (manually) that does not use the fork/join type as a prefix, then the name remains unchanged. For instance, "Test123" is a name that will remain as is.

bug.short_desc: Z151 import/export bug: Can't import failure points

long_desc.thetext:
Create a new map, insert a failure point (a subclass of empty point), export, and re-import. The node connections are lost.
I suspect this is something similar to the issue we had with indicators in GRL (a subclass of IE).
This is very likely to also happen for Anything nodes (not yet in the GUI though).

This was actually a more fancy bug related to type casting (of FailurePoint/Anything into Empty). As I was not sure of the best way of solving this, I essentially left the metadata that was distinguishing these 3 types of path nodes and added a method invoked later to clean up these extra metadata. This now works quite well.

bug.short_desc: Scenarios: changing an Enumeration type causes problems

long_desc.thetext: Example: 1. Create enumeration (ONE, TWO) + variable that uses it 2. Use it in a condition 3. Change enumeration to (ONE, THREE, FOUR) 4. We can still access TWO, but we can't access THREE or FOUR.

bug.short_desc: Metadata indicator symbol no longer shows

long_desc.thetext:
Even if the Show metadata indicators preference is set, the paragraph symbol that indicates the presence of metadata is not added to the element labels. This affects both UCM and GRL model elements.
Reported by igor.nikiforov@uniquesoft.com (keep him in the loop)

bug.short_desc: highlight in/out-path of stub after double-clicking on start/end point of plug-in map

long_desc.thetext:
In addition to: - highlight in/out-path of stub after double-clicking on start/end point of plug-in map
I'd add:
- highlight start/end plugin after double-clicking on in/out-path of stub. (only if the path itself has no other causes for opening a dialog, such as a condition editor).
Ok (hopefully the second part won't become confusing).

double clicking on start/end point now also selects the parent node connection, not just the stub!
ignore my previous comment about double clicking on node connections - we're using that for opening the stub editors instead.... plus the potential confusion on the condition editor.

bug.short_desc: importance for actors - overall trade-off value

long_desc.thetext: The GRL evaluation mechanisms should support the calculation of an overall trade-off value for a strategy. The overall value is based on the actor evaluations and a new importance value for the actor. This importance value is similar to the importance value of high-level goals. The calculation of the overall trade-off value is similar to the calculation of an actor evaluation. Instead of taking the evaluation values of goals with importance, the trade-off value is calculated by taking the evaluation values of actors with importance.
Add relevant attribute to Actor in the metamodel
Added code to utilize these inside quantitative & Hao algorithms only.

bug.short_desc: Unhandled event loop exception

long_desc.thetext: Can you attach the test file?

Created attachment 26 Test URN file: Try the very first scenario
Do not select a GRL strategy when testing, and make sure the preferences are set properly.

attachment.desc: Test URN file: Try the very first scenario

bug.short_desc: shortcut for "select"

long_desc.thetext:
(from a student in joerg's class)
A few classmates and I, while working with the jUCMNav plugin for Eclipse, noticed that there is no keyboard shortcut for the Select key. Seeing as it is open source on Ohloh, I found the keyboard mapping in UcmPaletteRoot.java which marks the selection tool as the "default". However, this is the problem because after the first non-select selection, it never goes back to this default value. It would be great to have a keyboard shortcut added for this option!

bug.short_desc: Null Pointer Exceptions in tabbed properties

long_desc.thetext:
When demoing the tool, I got these 2 exceptions. I was showing GRL propagation and UCM traversal, when I realized that I needed GRL variables to be on for the UCM execution to work. I checked the appropriate box in the Preferences, and then returned to the Strategies and Scenarios view, when these exceptions occurred.
I was able to reproduce one of them: - Select a strategy and execute. - Click on the Enumerations or Variables folder in the Scenarios and Strategies view - Click back on a strategy. An NPE is generated.
The same this happens with scenarios.
Minimally, some null pointer checking seems to be required here.

Created attachment 17 this file makes the evaluation algorithm crash.

Not sure if crashes with latest build.

attachment.desc: this file makes the evaluation algorithm crash.

bug.short_desc: GRL contributions labels cause issues with delete and undo

long_desc.thetext:
Select all --> Delete does not work if there are contribution labels selected.
Also, undoing the deletion of a contribution results in labels being displayed in a different location.

bug.short_desc: Properties of components don't update when you change the component definition.

long_desc.thetext: Only the properties of the component ref are updating, not those of the component element.

bug.short_desc: default fill color of comment is shown as 0/0/0 but that's not the default color

long_desc.thetext: - create a new comment - look at the fill color in the properties (it's 0/0/0) but the fill color of the comment is not black

Fixed for all newly created comments. Won't change existing comments on load.
Note: This may have the side effect of preventing you from using the jUCMNav preferences to easily switch the colors of comments (since they are now all initialized instead of being null).

bug.short_desc: Preventing respRef to have metadata might break something in CSM.

long_desc.thetext: Current support for URN metadata now (as of 3.2.1) prevents metadata from being associated with UCM responsibility references (only definitions). This might break something in the CSM export. To be verified.

In the metadata editor, we can only associate metadata to a responsibility definition or component definition.
1) Augment the editor to have another drop-down appear beneath it if you've selected a definition. This secondary drop-down should allow you to add meta-data to a specific reference, too. (If left unselected, you're editing the meta-data on the definition).
2) Augment the properties view to show two tabs: metadata and metadata (reference).
Sounds good at first glance.
A similar issue exists on the GRL side. Preventing metadata on references to intentional elements or references to actors breaks the ability to define GRL pointcut expressions in AoURN.

When editing metadata in properties and in the wizard, if the element you are editing has also a reference, you will be able to edit its metadata. If it doesnt, the option is hidden. Also if you change the selected element in the wizard, you lose the ability to edit the reference.
