bug.short_desc: Propagation of evaluttion for GRL strategies

long_desc.thetext: sometimes changes in goal statisfaction values don't get propagated to higher levels. (closing and reopening the models can refresh the model though)

Do you mean that the refresh button (in the Scenarios and Strategies view) does not work either? Not all changes result in automatic updates (e.g., changing the algorithm). This is why there is a refresh button.

bug.short_desc: Deleting scenario variables displayed in sub-trees causes exception

long_desc.thetext: Deleting a variable when one of the scenarios that uses it has its "Initializations" sub-tree expanded generated a Null exception (most of the times, but not always) and does not delete the variable.

can't repro. however, undoing the variable deletion doesn't bring the variable back in the list of inherited variables when a scenario includes another that does include this variable. refreshing the scenario view does make them re-appear.
can you provide the stack trace?
Cannot reproduce either. I can leave with the refresh issue in the inherited variables.

bug.short_desc: bug bindings

long_desc.thetext: create file with three maps. add dynamic stub. edit bindings. check both checkboxes say ok reopen bindings. notice that you can't get anything to load in the right panel to define the bindings.

The treeview is associated with the "add binding" view. Click on a PluginBinding in the treeview and you'll be able to edit the bindings of this PluginBinding. I didn't find any way to better express the relation between the treeview selection and the add binding view... Any idea JP our UI expert?
This is not a bug... But we could improve the UI here to show the connection between the tree view and the Add Binding panel to the right...
behaviour was improved since the finding of this bug.

bug.short_desc: Maps are not filtered when generating report in PDF

long_desc.thetext: Maps are not filtered when generating a report in PDF or RTF since the implementation of the "Show UCM diagrams and descriptions" and "Show GRL diagrams and descriptions" preferences (ref. bug 876).

In the report wizard, the list containing all the maps to export are now filtered twice: - It will be filtered once to remove UCM diagrams if the "Show UCM diagrams and descriptions" preference is unchecked on the preferences page (similarly for GRL diagrams). - Once the maps to export list has been filtered, it will be filtered a second time, in order to keep only those maps that have been selected by the user in the Report Generation Wizard.

bug.short_desc: NPE when using intentional element with blank name

long_desc.thetext: If you delete the default name of an intentional element bounded to an actor, and create another intentional element and delete its default name as well, you will get NPE.

Created attachment 27 It records the steps to reproduce the problem
open with either MS Words or IE
Fixed. The pop-up window still claims the name exists, but there is no change now and no exception generated. Works for actors, responsibilities, and components as well.

attachment.desc: It records the steps to reproduce the problem

bug.short_desc: Cannot add metadata to GRL links

long_desc.thetext: Fixed. The Selection helper and the tabbed properties needed to be updated. I also completed and refactored the SelectionHelper to make it more efficient.

bug.short_desc: Deleting an unnamed start/end point creates exceptions

long_desc.thetext:
Thomas Weigert wrote: I have now found a way of reproducing this problem: 1. Create some map 2. On this map, create another path that consists of the following path elements, in this order: * Named startpoint * Stub * Unnamed endpoint, connected to * Unnamed startpoint * Responsibility * Named endpoint 3. Select this path by dragging a marquee around it 4. Press delete
I don't know which of above elements is in fact necessary to create the mess, but the above works everytime (I mean, it creates a mess everytime)....

A simpler situation is 1. Create a map 2. Create a path with an unnamed endpoint 3. Create a second path 4. Drag the named start point on the 2nd path onto the unnamed endpoint (this is a merge) 5. Kaboom.
There was a weird concurrency issue between the code for handling the color of unnamed start/end points and the refresh code, which caused start/end points to be refreshed after being removed from a map.

bug.short_desc: Exceptions raised on features when advanced tab selected

long_desc.thetext: Creating a new feature model. Built up tree with decompositions and optional relationships. Added stereotypes to some not all features. Went to go to "Advanced" properties tab and all features were bared from presenting tab due to exceptions. Properties missing in properties view.

Created attachment 56 culprit feature model
Only a small model and so disappointed tool broke on such a simple task.

Created attachment 57 Log containing exceptions
Error log from exceptions when using model attached.

bug.short_desc: Unnamed Star/End points and Stubs get named when loading the file

long_desc.thetext: AoURN (according to Gunter's style) requires the possibility of not giving names to some elements, including start/end points, stubs, and probably others. This is no longer feasible apparently. When loading a file with unnamed elements, jUCMNav now names them...

bug.short_desc: scenarios: create variable wizard

long_desc.thetext: Should have a create variable wizard (will be used to create enumerations) and from code editor.
We should probably also add a simple initialization (e.g. for a new variable) that would target multiple scenarios

bug.short_desc: Component labels don't update their reference to the component element when the component definition is changed in the component ref

long_desc.thetext: To reproduce this bug, create two components. Then select one and change it's component definition to the other component. Then change the name. The name won't refresh in the label.

bug.short_desc: responsibility definition can be deleted even if used in responsibility binding

long_desc.thetext: - create a path with responsibility r1 - create a second path with a stub - create a plug-in map with responsibility r2 - in the stub bindings, bind r1 to r2 - go to the first path and delete r1 - it should not be possible to delete the definition of r1 because it is used in the responsibility binding

I reproduced this scenario and what I noticed was that not only the responsibility definition was deleted, but also the responsibility binding within the stub.
This means the model is left in a consistent state, as the deletion is propagated properly.
However, from your message, I get the feeling that the desired behaviour is as follows: - when deleting the last reference, do not delete the definition if it is still used in a responsibility binding.
This appears to make sense since the ResponsibilityBinding is between a parent Responsibility and a child RespRef.
If I am wrong above, let us know. Otherwise, we will proceed as requested.
Agreed.
Done both regular delete & delete unreferenced definitions

bug.short_desc: GRL evaluations of dependencies with dependum or initial values

long_desc.thetext:
There should be a way to modify initialized values in a strategy when the initialized intentional element is the target of a dependency that has a lower evaluation value. This might however trigger a new evaluation (and lead to an unstable state because of potential feedback loops?)
Also, dependums should be identified and should take the value of the dependee automatically (more i*-like).

bug.short_desc: End point orientation doesn't update when you move a node

long_desc.thetext: If you move the node just before the end point the orientation changes, but if you change the position of a node before this node, the end point orientation is not changed.
had not inserted code into the appropriate location.

bug.short_desc: investigate new enumeration bug

long_desc.thetext:
Thomas: Here is roughly what I did....
Right click on Startpoint "edit code" Create new variable (enumeration) Instead of clicking "new enumeration" type the new name in the "enumeration name" box and add values. Click finish (the wizard will not go away) Click finish again. Click finish again. Click cancel Now you have three variables of the same name in the variable selection box. Cancel to close the condition editor. Now we are in a weired state. The code editor does not open again. Eventually we get a Java error. After restart things are fine.
I have not been able to reproduce yet, but I am guessing that because he changed an existing enumeration instead of creating one, he probably caused syntax conflicts within the existing elements.

I followed the exact steps and was able to reproduce it. I created a new model, a new path, and then edited the code. Created a first Variable of type EnumerationType, and then right away a new one (NewVariable, of type NewEnumerationType), where I Changed the DEFAULT to ONE,TWO,THREE.

The issue is that the second creation does not actually create a new enumeration, it changes the first one. The first variable that is created therefore is not properly initialized, since we've changed the enumeration values. This particular error was detected by the framework but wasn't handled properly - which caused various errors down the line.

bug.short_desc: view modes only work for the first map.
Add Scenario Description to Reports

long_desc.thetext: Data on existing scenarios within the URN model (variable initializations, preconditions, postconditions, etc.) should be included in jUCMNav reports (all types), in a format similar to the one used to describe use case map specifications.
A first version of the UCM Scenario Documentation feature is available in all three report types (PDF, RTF and HTML). This feature is configurable via jUCMNav's Report Generation Preferences.

bug.short_desc: Event loop exception when adding a diagram

long_desc.thetext:
Adding a GRL graph when many elements are selected often creates an event loop exception.
Solution: Allow Add GRL Graph and Add UCM only when nothing is selected. This would make better sense anyway.

bug.short_desc: Export to GraphViz .dot files not working as expected

long_desc.thetext:
I just tried to export a UCM to a .dot file. I am not sure if I misunderstood the feature, but what came out was a Graph (OK, not surprising) with some nodes that had the correct ID (but I had expected the name of the UCMmodelElement) and some nodes named following the pattern CheapTrickX :-) . That does not seem to be a feature.
Second I had expected that the graphical notation of UCM would be reproduced, but here I may have gotten wrong what the feature "Export to Graphviz DOT layout information (.dot)" actually means.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Open jUCMNav, create project, create new UCM/GRL graph 2. Create a UCM and create a simple path on it 3. In the outline view, right-click the previously edited UCM 4. Choose Export in the context menu 5. Select "Export individual diagrams" and hit the next button 6. Select .dot as file type, select the UCM to export, click the finish button
Expected outcome: A file that, when opened in Graphviz, contains graphics that look exactly the same as the exported diagram. Actual outcome: The file displays a graph that does not have URN notation, whose nodes have unexpected names, and where additional nodes seem to be added.
Best Regards, Florian
PS. You might want to add Mac OS X 10.4 to 10.9 to the list of operating systems. My OS is Mac OS X 10.8.5, so I had to choose 'other'.
Created attachment 48 screenshot of exported .dot file
PPS. I have jUCMNav version 5.4.0 installed.

Hello Florian!
Indeed, the purpose of this "export" is misleading. It is used internally by our auto-layout feature (when a .dot file is generated, Graphviz invoked to compute X-Y coordinates for the layout, and that result reimported to layout GRL/UCM diagrams). This was never meant as a stand-alone feature for exporting diagrams that look like GRL or UCM. Sorry for the confusion...
Daniel

bug.short_desc: URN Links in the context menu stops working

bug.short_desc: investigate rename bug.

long_desc.thetext:
I was trying to rename a *.jucm file in the project by using the rename right click. I got a java error which I ignored. Now I notice that there are two files somehow aliased to each other. They appear to have the same content when looking in eclipse. But they have different file size when looking at the file system.
Adding new maps to one adds it to the other also....

I have not been able to reproduce this. I tried many renaming/duplicating combinations, but was unable to generate an error (if this happens again, please open the Error Log view in Eclipse and send us the call stack that led to this problem). It should be safe to do when everything is saved.
However, one weird behaviour I found is this:
- Have a URN file Test.jucm - Do a modification to the model - Before saving, rename the file to Test2.jucm (the file is renamed in the Ouline and in the URN Editor name - Now save the change (suddenly, Test.jucm reappears in the Outline!) - As a result: Test2.jucm is a copy of the old Test.jucm, and Test.jucm contains the modified model!!!
This is not good, by I suspect this is Eclipse's fault and we can't do much about this. My advice: save all changes before renaming a file. This does not prevent one from doing a copy/paste of the file first, even when there are modifications to the model. Linking to an autosave confirmation dialog might be good too.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 346 ***

bug.short_desc: jUCMNav memory leak + heap space problem

long_desc.thetext:
When closing an editor, dangling references remain. Memory gets chewed up until application crashes.
Furthermore, when doing a large number of iterations in a loop (such as 500), jUCMNav eventually runs out of heap space.
these are currently for extreme scenarios but should be investigated.
Another easier scenario is exporting multiple images to PNG while at 400% zoom: causes a Java heap space error.
partial fix committed. not perfect, but looks good enough.
has been tested for a while. we found the bugs that were to be found during our other testing.

bug.short_desc: Reporting scenario/strategy evaluation information

long_desc.thetext: The report generator should be able to create reports on scenarios even if the user disabled the "Show UCM diagrams and descriptions" preference. Moreover, the report generator should also be able to create reports on strategy evaluations even if the user disabled the "Show GRL diagrams and descriptions" preference. In other words, scenario preferences should be independent of UCM preferences, and strategy evaluation preferences should be independent of GRL preferences.
Scenario-related preferences are now independent from UCM-related preferences, and GRL Strategy Evaluation preferences are independent from GRL-related preferences.

bug.short_desc: Exception when the outline view opens when the locale is French.

long_desc.thetext:
There is a null value send to be set as the text of a tree item of the content outline view (see trace below). After debugging, it turns out that in LabelTreeEditPart class line 178 a text value is returned. This seems to be because it is looking for an entry in the messages property file that is wrongly defined in the proeprty file. At key LabelTreeEditPart.concerns in file messages_fr.properties, the value is "Pr\u00e9occupation" and it is looking for the value with an s (Pr\u00e9occupations). Changing the value in the property file for the latter seems to fix the problem.

bug.short_desc: add support for responsibility bindings

long_desc.thetext: 1 - define how we are to implement responsibility bindings in a generic way. 2 - implement them.

Stub binding dialog: - Replication factor attribute should be present (per plug-in binding). I guess this is bug 722. - Selection box for maps should be as high as the bindings box (we have many maps in today's models! - Both boxes could be a bit wider too. Widen dialog box if necessary - Responsibility binding does not seem to work (does not add) - In component bindings, the only plug-in components that should be visible are those where Context is true (right, Gunter?) - In responsibility bindings, the only plug-in components that should be visible are those where Context is true (right, Gunter?) - I realized that if I make multiple modifications to plug-in bindings, and then try to undo, the changes are not composite (I need to do multiple undos).
Metamodel updated to handle bindings to (parent) Responsibility.

*** Bug 817 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The bug with the attachment was that the traversal error wasn't being generated due to some new code. I've easily fixed that, but I think this is a big enough issue to warrant a 4.4.1 version, but doesn't necessarily need to be released in the next week ( we can batch up other changes too).
The stack trace is related to something else, trying to show properties of an EditPart which has since been related. I've made it more robust to avoid errors while the UI refreshes.

bug.short_desc: Add/delete scenario doesn't refresh more than one level deep.

long_desc.thetext: If you delete a scenario that is included inside another scenario and then undo this operation, the scenario will be undeleted but the references to this scenario from others won't be.
The command is OK, it is a UI refresh problem.
Works for me... Do you have a sample model where this does not work?

Actually, the bug is a bit more complex than this.
Have a model like this:
ScenarioA includes ScenarioB includes ScenarioC.
- Delete ScenarioB and undo works fine. - Delete ScenarioC and undo. ScenarioB is refreshed properly but ScenarioA is not. It does not see ScenarioC as a greyed-out child.
Workaround: Hitting refresh in the view will fix the issue. It is just a refresh issue and not a command issue.
This bug also happens when you create a new ScenarioD included by ScenarioB. ScenarioA doesn't see it.
While watching ET debug, I did notice larger number of notifyChanges. At this point, I would not recommend adding more as they become complex to manage. I am not even sure if they are all removed when necessary (bug 631 memory leak?).
When faced with this issue in the past, I decided not to fix it. I wanted to avoid refreshing too often (collapsing the tree with it). However, maybe each included folder string should listen to the list of scenarios in the model.

I see (was able to reproduce).
I this is just a refresh problem, and if this only concerns situations where we have 3+ levels of included scenarios, then I would say drop this issue.

bug.short_desc: Component Elements and Responsibilities don't refresh in the outline

long_desc.thetext: If you change a property of a component element, it doesn't refresh in the outline. But the compref will...
components fixed. remaining to do: copy code from ComponentRefTreeEditPart to create a ResponsibilityRefTreeEditPart.

bug.short_desc: Cut and Paste (Ctr-X/Ctr-V) doesn't include the contributions

long_desc.thetext: Contributions are not included in the cut and paste process.

This issue is related to the fact that cut&paste first performs a deletion which may end up deleting the Link definitions, in addition to the link references. It affects all GRL links, not just Contributions.
The paste functionality should re-insert these or the cut functionality should not delete them even if we are cutting the last reference.

bug.short_desc: comment should be linked to individual element, not diagram
hide empty points in outline

long_desc.thetext: there should be a way to hide empty points and directions from the outline view.
There is an action in the outline view to view the empty point/direction arrow.

bug.short_desc: Selecting Labels should display feedback on the associated node

long_desc.thetext: When we select a Label, we should have some sort of feedback on the node/component attached to this label. This way if the label got away from its corresponding node/component, we can retreive it easily. This should be really easy to implement.
feedback added. missing a few entries in the properties. assigning to Jordan.
jkealey did it.

The "import UCEd Use Case" is still available, and henerates an exception when selected.

Is the old plugin still installed? Very odd as the plugin itself includes that functionality.

bug.short_desc: Display UCM menus properly in HTML reports when a multi-level hierarchy is present

long_desc.thetext: UCM menus in HTML reports are not shown properly when a multi-level hierarchy is present in the model (i.e. when a root map contains one/multiple plugin maps, and these maps also contain plugin maps).

bug.short_desc: Undoing a new GRL evaluation leaves it created, but with the previous value

long_desc.thetext:
In a GRL model with a selected (and running) strategy, if you select an intentional element without a "(*)" and set its evaluation value, and undo this, the (*) remains (i.e., there is still an Evaluation remaining whereas it should have been deleted altogether).
The problem seems to be with EvaluationStrategyManager.setIntentionalElementEvaluation() and EvaluationStrategyManager.setIntentionalElementQualitativeEvaluation()
Essentially, the undo() of the AddEvaluationCommand() invoked by the above is never called!

Actually, the issue is as follows: 1 - We either do a SetValueCommand or a ChangeNumericalEvaluationCommand. 2 - At some point, this calls EvaluationStrategyManager.getInstance().setIntentionalElementEvaluation(def, value); 3 - Internally, while the first command is executed, we create and execute a new AddEvaluationCommand. 4 - In the current implementation, we're doing cmd.execute() insteading of pushing it on a command stack. This means it is impossible to undo. 5 - If we replace the command with multieditor.getDelegatingCommandStack().execute(cmd); then it does go on the stack. However, setting up a new evaluation this way puts two commands on the stack. Therefore, you need to undo twice to get it removed. 6 - Even with this solution, the UI currently doesn't refresh. You have to move the node after two undoes to get the label to refresh.
I first attempted to change the way we execute the AddEvaluationCommand but I reverted this code since doing two undos is not desirable.
I think we need to review the architecture to support this properly - not a one line change as expected.

To fix this, I added a new method in EvaluationStrategyManager called removeIntentionalElementEvaluation and internally it calls the command DeleteEvaluationCommand. Then the command ChangeNumericalEvaluationCommand uses this new method to undo.

bug.short_desc: Use of OCL requires a Restore Default Settings after installing jUCMNav

long_desc.thetext: After a new installation, to use OCL semantic constraints and metrics, one needs to *Restore Default Settings* in both jUCMNav preference pages

The bug was indeed a packaging error where compilation partially failed silently, but a jar file was still produced & deployed.
I replaced the 1.2.1 file in production with the right one. People now upgrading to 4.4.0 will get the proper file. Those who already have it have to uninstall & reinstall in the short term.
I will also release a 1.2.2 (with nothing different from 1.2.1) at the end of the month with the next release of jUCMNav so that people who got the invalid 1.2.1 will be auto-upgraded.

I uninstalled again and realized the jUCMNav and MSCViewer plugin files were still in my plugin directory. I deleted them. Very odd, I did the same as you (uninstalled & re-installed) on my old Eclipse and it worked fine (numerous times). Did you uninstall the feature via Eclipse -> Help -> About?
What do you currently have in Eclipse features and plugins folders?
Managed to repro in Eclipse 3.7, but worked fine in 3.5. Will investigate.

Ok, there was a corruption issue with Eclipse under 3.7. It doesn't like to reinstall the same plug-in twice.
Procedure: - Uninstall current jUCMNav 4.4.0 (from Help -> About) - Close Eclipse - Delete manually from the eclipse/plugins directory: seg.jUCMNav_4.4.0 and the com.site.UCMScenarioViewer_1.2.0 (or com.site.UCMScenarioViewer_1.2.1) folder - Edit the /eclipse artefacts.xml and remove these 3 artifacts (the numbers might be slightly different):
<artifact classifier='osgi.bundle' id='seg.jUCMNav' version='4.4.0'> <properties size='1'> <property name='download.size' value='8216989'/> </properties> </artifact>
<artifact classifier='org.eclipse.update.feature' id='seg.jUCMNav' version='4.4.0'> <properties size='1'> <property name='download.size' value='5053'/> </properties> <repositoryProperties size='1'> <property name='artifact.folder' value='true'/> </repositoryProperties> </artifact>
<artifact classifier='osgi.bundle' id='com.site.UCMScenarioViewer' version='1.2.1'> <properties size='1'> <property name='download.size' value='31049'/> </properties> <repositoryProperties size='1'> <property name='artifact.folder' value='true'/> </repositoryProperties> </artifact>
- Start Eclipse with the -clean option - Install from the update site.
Worked for me and Jason.

The problem seems to be linked to the Advanced Tab of the Properties view for features. The Standard and Metadata tabs report no problem, but creation or even just selection of a feature causes the error below on the Advanced tab.
seg.jUCMNav.views.property.IntentionalElementPropertySource.getFeature(IntentionalElementPropertySource.java:545) is likely the culprit (as features are no longer IntentionalElements I think.
Fixed by Naveen in March 2015

bug.short_desc: Names with space at the end

long_desc.thetext: Names with space at the end of a name should not be considered as new names

bug.short_desc: Z.151 export fails for some performance annotations

long_desc.thetext: Fails with a "null" message displayed... See attached file.
Created attachment 31 Performance test that make export fail (while marchalling to file)
It seems there is no problem anymore.

attachment.desc: Performance test that make export fail (while marchalling to file)

bug.short_desc: SWT runs out of handles after a while with the outline

long_desc.thetext:
This is probably just because we have to manage the ressources ourself. Right now we use the createImage function from the ImageDescriptor class. Maybe we should release this ressource later.
If we do that in the outline, maybe we should do it in the palette too.

What I think the solution is: All classes that invoke ImageDescriptor.createFromFile() must dispose the returned Image using image.dispose() during their own disposal.
31 places to fix. ;)

I fixed this in the outline. When the element is deactivated, the image is disposed. For the palette, I think it would be useless to release the handles for the icons. No tutorials on the interweb release them...

bug.short_desc: custom-defined stubs

long_desc.thetext:
provide the ability to define a stereotype for stubs (i.e., a metadata name/value pair and a symbol for the stub's concrete syntax).
when the stub is stereotyped, then the defined symbol should be shown instead of the stub diamond.
this is useful when patterns are used, so that the patterns can be used as first class entities (e.g., see timer patterns).

bug.short_desc: hide node IDs in outline

long_desc.thetext: there should be an option that allows you to hide node IDs in the outline view.
There is an action in the outline view to show the element ids. We need to create an icon for this action.
The action have been added to all the views.

bug.short_desc: OR-JOIN loop

long_desc.thetext: Right now the action allow the creation of a OR-JOIN on the same path. This made my eclipse crash with the following exception: Unhandled event loop exception Reason: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space) *** SWT nested exception Reason: Java heap space
you want to delete an endpoint but the code hasn't yet been implemented? no problem! simple or-join it with its preceding empty point!

bug.short_desc: Outline pane sorting after changing type

long_desc.thetext: "Definitions" part of outline pane normally shows types of intentions together sorted alphabetically. For example all softgoals are listed then all the indicators are presented afterwards. However when an intention's type is changed (e.g. from softgoal to indicator), it is still listed together with softgoals even though it is correctly changed to indicator (icons and behaviors are correct).

bug.short_desc: Crash on Mac OS X Lion

long_desc.thetext:
Since upgrading to Mac OS X Lion, Eclipse frequently crashes with a stake overflow exception when working with evaluation strategies in goal models.
If I disable the "Enable the following advanced features" in the jUCMNav preferences then the problem appears to go away.

bug.short_desc: GRL evaluation label not long enough

long_desc.thetext: When using the mixed evaluation algorithm (with icon and text), initialized values often show incomplete labels with "..."
Fixed. Increased length from 50 to 60 in IntentionalElementEditPart.java

bug.short_desc: support "refactor into stub"

long_desc.thetext: 1) support for refactoring a map into two maps. ie. once we have cut and paste, select a portion of the map and hit "refactor into plug-in map". a new plug-in map is created and the portion of the map is replaced by a static stub with the proper bindings.
*** Bug 657 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: SimplifyForksAndJoinsCommand sometimes does not work during MSC generation.

long_desc.thetext:
java.lang.ClassCastException: ucm.map.impl.AndForkImpl at seg.jUCMNav.model.commands.transformations.SimplifyForksAndJoinsCommand.mergeInPathsIntoFork(SimplifyForksAndJoinsCommand.java:209) at seg.jUCMNav.model.commands.transformations.SimplifyForksAndJoinsCommand.simplifyComplexAndForks(SimplifyForksAndJoinsCommand.java:294) at seg.jUCMNav.model.commands.transformations.SimplifyForksAndJoinsCommand.<init>(SimplifyForksAndJoinsCommand.java:43) at seg.jUCMNav.model.commands.transformations.MakeWellFormedCommand.modify(MakeWellFormedCommand.java:128) at seg.jUCMNav.model.commands.transformations.MakeWellFormedCommand.execute(MakeWellFormedCommand.java:80) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CommandStack.execute(CommandStack.java:149) at seg.jUCMNav.importexport.msc.MscTraversalListener.saveModel(MscTraversalListener.java:608) at seg.jUCMNav.importexport.msc.MscTraversalListener.traversalEnded(MscTraversalListener.java:737) at seg.jUCMNav.scenarios.ScenarioTraversalListenerList.traversalEnded(ScenarioTraversalListenerList.java:295) at seg.jUCMNav.scenarios.ScenarioTraversalAlgorithm.traverse(ScenarioTraversalAlgorithm.java:200) at seg.jUCMNav.scenarios.ScenarioUtils.traverse(ScenarioUtils.java:719) at seg.jUCMNav.scenarios.ScenarioUtils.setActiveScenario(ScenarioUtils.java:681) at seg.jUCMNav.importexport.msc.ExportMSC.export(ExportMSC.java:60) at seg.jUCMNav.views.wizards.importexport.ExportWizard.ExportURN(ExportWizard.java:303) at seg.jUCMNav.views.wizards.importexport.ExportWizard.doFinish(ExportWizard.java:170) at seg.jUCMNav.views.wizards.importexport.ExportWizard.access$0(ExportWizard.java:157) at seg.jUCMNav.views.wizards.importexport.ExportWizard$1.run(ExportWizard.java:497) at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
will upload attachment that makes it crash.

Created attachment 9 bug when exporting MSC
the 3 output and-fork needs to be simplified - the command crashes.

bug.short_desc: Package ucmscenarios.ecore does not validate

long_desc.thetext:
Incidentally, the package ucmscenarios.ecore does not validate. The problem is that the class SequenceElement is contained in several classes (Sequence and ScenarioDef for example) and has a mandatory opposite reference to the parent class of type Sequence. This of course cannot be valid when SequenceElement is contained in ScenarioDef. This Ecore validation rule was not implemented in earlier versions of ecore, so this is probably why it shows up in the latest release.
Daniel likely needs to modify the metamodel (in Rose) and regenerate the ecore model.

bug.short_desc: Responsibility View not refreshing correctly between two files.

long_desc.thetext: Avec la version de 00:24 d'aujourd'hui, si j'ouvre un fichier jucm ou si je passe d'un fichier ouvert

bug.short_desc: PDF reports: strategies not sorted for trends

long_desc.thetext: There are many HashMap containing strategies and KPIs that start at index 1 rather than 0 (the latter being assumed by many methods). Trying to sort these HashMaps is causing some problems (Invalid Thread Access). At this time, the strategies are not sorted for the trends, so there is a mismatch with the trend tables.

bug.short_desc: unable to edit metadata on URNspec

long_desc.thetext:
I am unable to edit the metadata via the GUI on the URNspec because the wizards & properties assume it is a URNmodelElement.
this may be desirable (for hidden metadata); but would also be convenient during development to be able to edit it properly.

bug.short_desc: when we close Tasks window, ViewPart is still active.

long_desc.thetext: When you have an open project and we close Task view, as a result you will see that ViewPart is still active, but "Tasks" title is disappeared . Some Eclipse API also become to work wrong way, such as, "workbenchWindow.getActivePage().isPartVisible( <viewPart>)" returns wrong value.

To reproduce the bug, do the following steps: 1. Open Eclipse. 2. Close all files that are opened in Editor. 3. Create new General Project. 4. Create two *.jucm (1.jucm and 2.jucm) files inside the project and one *.txt (3.txt) file. 5. Open 1.jucm, 2.jucm and 3.txt files in editor. 6. Select 1.jucm file and then switch to Resource Perspective. 7. Restart Eclipse (after restart 1.jucm file should be active in editor). 8. Select 3.txt file and then select 2.jucm file. Result: There is exception in jUCMNav and Eclipse becomes to work strange. For example, close Task view and you will see that ViewPart is still active, but "Tasks" title is disappeared . Please, see before.png and after.png figures. Also, after this exception, some Eclipse API also become to work wrong way, for example, "workbenchWindow.getActivePage().isPartVisible( <viewPart>)" returns wrong value.
Thank you in advance!

bug.short_desc: Support for Z.151 file format

long_desc.thetext: The URN standard describes a file format currently not supported by jUCMNav. Export and import should be supported.
Everything is pretty much all supported now, thanks to Yan Gao. We'll create new bugs for remaining things, if any.

bug.short_desc: expand templating to anything that can be defined on a plug-in map

long_desc.thetext: in addition to responsibilities and components, allow other elements to be defined by the plug-in binding (e.g., names of start points, timers, variables...)

bug.short_desc: inconsistent palette tool escaping

long_desc.thetext: Inconsistency with remaining in edit mode after select-- some can be escaped (path tool), some cannot (responsibility after selecting name)
No problems reported by either Jason or Daniel. Must have fixed this while playing with the palette for the other bugs.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: code-editor for sets of conditions / responsibilities

long_desc.thetext: 2) when entering several pre or postconditions, it's a bit awkward to open the condition editor for each of the conditions. i think it would be much better if the condition editor allows browsing through all conditions (this could be extended to include the conditions for branches and the code in responsibilities too). this way, there would be a one place to go to have all the info for conditions.
this took more work than expected :)

bug.short_desc: Tab name doesn't refresh after changing the Map name of a new map.

long_desc.thetext: To reproduce this bug: Add a new map from the outline. Then select the new added map in the outline and try to change the name in the properties. The name in the tab of the editor won't refresh.

bug.short_desc: support changing the tab order

long_desc.thetext:
with large models, it would be really nice if the ordering of the UCMs/GRL graphs could be controlled (i am talking about the tabs at the bottom of the editor...)
Implement an action in UrnEditor that allows you to choose: "Move editor tab earlier in the list.", "Move editor tab later in the list". Implement a command that inverses maps in the list.
One may have to close those tabs, perform the model change, and re-open them because the tab index is important in various caching structures, if I recall correctly. However, if it ends up not being a problem, we could have features like: "Sort tabs alphabetically", "Group tabs by diagram type", etc.
We can now drag and drop tabs in the multi page editor. Drag and drop will modify the model with a command. Undo/redo is also working.

CTabFolder.setInsertMark is not implemented in SWT (it was implemented before, but now it's not for some reason). If this is implemented in the future, the code could be changed to use it to give user feedback when we drag and drop tabs around.

bug.short_desc: Element is associated with multiple parent components bug.

long_desc.thetext:
jUCMNavDemo_Final sent by daniel has a situation where we get this error.
simply put, we don't take into account whether the current map contains a particular component when building the possible parent list.

the error will no longer occur: Element is associated with multiple parent.
It was discovered that the data structure used to evaluate our context is insufficient for us to be able to throw this error or not. Our traversal context is held in a list while it should be held in a tree for us to be able to evaluate this.
Improved the parent finder to support the scenario shown in this example (ignored components) and disabled error message.

bug.short_desc: Update jUCMNav's help

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNav's help should be updated before the release of version 5.3. Before executing the getlatest script (located in the helpcontent directory), make sure the "Online Help" page on FosWiki is up to date.
The help files were updated with the contents of the Wiki's "Online Help" page (build 261).

bug.short_desc: The chart is displayed in disorder when do some "Undo" operations.

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce: 1.Create one .jucm file. 2.Draw a path with two Responsibilities and re-factor them into Stub. 3.Add a new Responsibility on the path. 4.Do "Undo" operation several times.
Actual result: The chart is displayed in disorder. Please refer to the attached screen-shot.
JumNav:6.0.0
Created attachment 49 Disorder chat

bug.short_desc: auto layout default settings not taken into account

long_desc.thetext: start eclipse with a new workspace create a UCM click on the auto layout icon do not change any settings except, if necessary, the Graphviz path note that map orientation says "left to right" click on "finish" auto layout is done "top down"
default preference hardcoded string had typo in it.

bug.short_desc: "Show Bound Intentional Elements" does not work

long_desc.thetext: This command is invoked on an Actor. Yet, I have seen a case where an element is bound to the actor in another diagram but is not added to a non-empty actor in a diagram (that does not already include that element).

bug.short_desc: decomposition type is not updated correctly in view

long_desc.thetext: try the following: create a grl graph with one softgoal decomposed (AND) into two other softgoals. create a second grl graph with the same softgoals. on the second graph, change the decomposition type to OR. it is not updated. switch to the first graph. the decomposition type is updated. switch back to the second graph: still not updated. save and close file. open. both graphs are now updated.
looks like I fixed it but forgot to close this bug.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: timers/waiting places

long_desc.thetext:
implement the implicit variable creation for timers (timeouts) may have impact on waiting places as well
(need to read up on this / look at UCMNav)

Timer Variables: Every time I sit down to do this problem, I am convinced it is a bad idea. However, I might have forgotten key elements from my initial discussions with Daniel so let me present you the situation so we can get this cleared out.
I have been asked to add timer variables inside jUCMNav. From what I remember, the usefulness of such a variable would be:
Give you the possibility to define a timer for which even if the connected path arrives, it arrives too late as a timeout has occurred. In a sense, the variable defines if a forced timeout should occur. This helps you clearly indicate the behavior with race conditions.
I think the discussions I had with Daniel a few weeks ago was not able to support such a scenario. However, looking at my implementation today:
- you can create conditions on the continuation path and the timeout path.
- when the traversal arrives, it tries the continuation path expression. If false, tries the timeout path condition. If false, it waits for the connect. If it never arrives and weÂre blocked, take the timeout path.
- therefore to unblock a timer, one of its paths must become true or the connect must arrive.
Therefore, I see this scenario as being implementable as so:
- You create a new Boolean variable.
- this variable is the timeout path condition.
- initialize this variable in all your scenarios as false for the ones in which you donÂt want to force a timeout.
- you make sure the continuation path condition is false (it is by default) or some expression that evaluates to false because the continuation path has priority.
- voilÃ
Another scenario Daniel mentioned was knowing if the timer had done a timeout or not. Can be explicitly represented by a responsibility on both paths that write to a variable that is read elsewhere.
Side-note: I say the continuation path has priority. I may be mistaken and it might depend on the deterministic preference, just like an or-fork. I would have to check.
Therefore, I think we can represent the same behaviour, although it takes a few more steps and an understanding of how the timer works. The main step that bugs me is initializing the variable in all scenarios. This is where you hope that you are using included scenarios J. I think my solution even gives us more flexibility than before, from what I remember Daniel saying. The only problem is the usability is reduced, as you must do more steps to be able to attain your goals.
I would now like to illustrate why I think timeout variables would greatly decrease maintainability. I could possibly also argument how it decreases usability in other scenarios, but IÂll keep that for another time.
To implement timeout variables:
- we need to create a variable for each timer
- to be usable, it needs to use the timer name. (ex: timerInput_Timeout)
- timers donÂt have unique names, only unique ids.
- One solution would be to use both the id and name: cumbersome
- Another would allow timers to share the same name: that is what I would go for
- Anyways, you need to create this variable (if it doesn`t already exist):
o On load of old models
o On creation of a timer
- You need to rename it (if it is not used by another timer)
o When you change its name via the direct edit (using our regular commands)
o When you change its name via the properties (using EclipseÂs undoable propertysheet that doesnÂt use our commands)
- You must prevent the UI from renaming the variable (properties view) or simply not display it in the treeview (but then people wouldnÂt know it existed until they edited code)
- What if someone wants to create a new variable and use timerInput_Timeout as a variable name and the timer doesnÂt exist? Do you allow it? If you create the timer afterwards, does it take control of the variable so that if you rename your timer, it in fact steals the variable (by renaming it?).
- Do you want to create a special folder under scenarios for Âforced timeouts?Â
I think you get where I am going with this. Coding this feature is a maintenance NIGHTMARE. There are TONS of places that need to be updated (thinking of aspects?) and everywhere that we add it, weÂre adding some quick-hack special case code.
I strongly recommend not to go ahead with this feature and use the generic implementation that is already there. Now, if there is something that we canÂt represent, we can see if the general solution could be adapted in a better way than the timer variable.
I think this illustrates that our codebase is not as maintainable as it should be (properties editing vs regular editing) but I still feel that we donÂt need the timer variable.
Let me know what you think,

bug.short_desc: path tool quick click bug
sub-menu icon problem

long_desc.thetext:
often, the icons in the sub-menus of the right-click menu disappear when moving the mouse over the menu item. when this happens, clicking on the menu item does not result in an action.
sometimes, saving the file corrects this problem and the icons don't disappear and the action is performed. sometimes, the file needs to be closed. sometimes, eclipse needs to be closed.

In the past, I've spent 8+ hours on this bug without being able to resolve it. Seemed like a bug deep within the framework for which I couldn't do much. (This is from memory - I did this over a year ago).

Etienne could not replicate this bug on the most recent build of Eclipse 3.7.1. Can anyone else attempt to replicate in Eclipse 3.7.1? Has the platform bug been solved?
(I haven't upgraded my copy of Eclipse yet to test, but did see this issue 50%+ of the time on 3.5 when setting a background color on a component.)

I have tried this on my own computer, with the newest version of Eclipse, and am unable to replicate.
Daniel: How about you?
Thanks, Jason

Haven't been able to replicate on 3.7.1 either...
Smells like magic...
We shall keep this bug open during development in case we see it again, but fingers crossed that the platform bug was solved!
Closing bug - we all confirm it is a platform bug which has since been solved.
*** Bug 789 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: move map when dragging from outline.

long_desc.thetext: When dragging element onto map from outline pane, map does not scroll (if an element should be placed at a path that is not visible when the element is clicked on, cannot do it without shrinking the map).

bug.short_desc: Bilingual feature

long_desc.thetext: The modeler needs to be able to use French langauge in modeling the URN.

I believe this is already doable, but you need to run Eclipse in French.
(I forget the command line option, but a quick google search reveals this page: http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Speak-The-Local-Language/article.html
try this: eclipse.exe -nl fr
(I vaguely recollect that there might be another option to add, not sure)
I don't know the current state of the translation, though.

I believe the real requirement here to support the creation of multi-lingual models. This means, that one could use the same model and present it in multiple languages (e.g., the same GRL graph, but the intentional elements shown in English, and then in French).
This is different from having a GUI in French or English (or other languages), which is already supported.
I see! That is indeed a completely different issue - please ignore my previous comment.
Yes, the requirement is to be able to generate a URN model in two langauges. So if you generate a model using English langauge, you should be able to convert the model into the French and vice versa.

Let's have a simple mechanism to switch back and forth between 2 languages (I don't 3 and more languages will be needed).
I suggest the following:
1. Have a new jUCMNav menu: "Switch model language"
2. Use 2 metadata on model elements: AltName and AltDescription
3. When we switch language, we swap name with the value of AltName, and description with the value of AltDescription. If AltName/altDescription do not exist for the element, create them and copy name/description to them.
4. The following model elements should be handled (*** is essential):
GRLspec GRLGraph *** IntentionalElement (including Indicator) *** Belief *** Actor StrategiesGroup EvaluationStrategy
UCMspec UCMmap *** PathNode (will RespRef create issues?) *** Component *** Responsibility GeneralResource ScenarioGroup ScenarioDef
We will not change variables, conditions, labels, etc.
5. Let's make sure that references to actors, components, etc. are properly displayed as well.
Potential issues: - Importing strategies in one language when the model is in the other language will not work. - Tons of metadata were were are not used to have them (will likely stress test deletion and undo/redo!) - Noise in metadata to display. We might need to change what we show in the tip when hoovering over an element (so AltName and AltDescription are not considered).
We may need a feature to clean the alternate language (so only one remains), requiring confirmation. This would remove all the AltName/AltDescription metadata (in case someone switched language without needing a second language).
We might need another feature to populate the second language automagically (e.g., by sending queries to Google Translate)!
Comments?

My two main comments are: 1 - Keep it future proof. Although I feel this strategy respects the KISS philosophy, I am uncertain how one could transform this (at a later date) to properly support more than two locales within the same model. My guess is probably a 'migration wizard' that would ask you what languages are already in the file (example: fr-CA and en-CA) and copy over the metadata to properties named "(en-CA)AltName" and "(fr-CA)AltName", for example. Not ideal, but should to work fine, so no extra changes are required to your proposal.
2 - As with all translations, I always see the need for a tabular display showing each translated item and what remains to be translated. Otherwise, maintaining the translation becomes finding a needle in a haystack. Future work, but keep that in the back of your mind. Also, if translators are involved, they will expect some kind of file they can modify outside of jUCMNav. (Excel or maybe *.properties files for example).

Good points, thanks Jason.
The automatic translation could be attempted eventually by generating a text file (some sort of .properties file) with element ids and names/descriptions, sending this to Google Translate, and reparsing the result as input. Could be a fun thing to do eventually :-)

The development version looks cool so far! One more issue (don't know if it's worth fixing):
- Switch to French - Translate element - Switch back to English - Undo - Redo
the English version will contain an element in French. Not too bad (as we can undo again), but may be counter-intuitive.

From what I saw, looks cool!
PS: Heh; I'm simultaneously finding similar issues w/ undo-redo in the contribution overrides with the "contribution context" changes. State is becoming increasingly challenging to manage.
We might have to flush the undo stack(s) more often for certain types of operations...
Completed Bilingual feature

bug.short_desc: support aspect notational elements

long_desc.thetext:
Support notation for aspect local start/end points Support notation for aspect replacement stub Support notation for aspect anything pointcut element (Some of the above may require a new palette group for aspects)
the aspect markers should also be added. they are just another kind of stub, but require a change to plug-in bindings since in/out-paths may now be connected to other elements than start/end points. with support for aspect markers, composed AoUCM models can be faked even without a proper automatic composition mechanism :-)
jkealey's question: should everything aspect oriented be conditionally enabled in the preferences to avoid overwhelming new users?

bug.short_desc: bug with problems view clicking

long_desc.thetext:
The scenario traversal algorithm generates errors in the problems view. Previously, clicking on such an error would focus on the element in the editor. This is no longer working, for some cases.
At a high level, it still works for all errors which imply the use of the "QuickFixer" - that is all code/condition editors are opened properly. However, in other cases, such as the Stub or others, the element is no longer selected in the GUI.
The root cause of this issue can be found in UCMNavMultiPageEditor.gotoMarker(IMarker marker).
EditPart part = (EditPart) outline.getViewer().getEditPartRegistry().get(element);
part is null.
This is odd, as we're asking for the edit part in the outline treeview. This worked previously. The edit part registry no longer contains ANY edit parts.
This same bug must affect EditURNLink.navigateLink which uses the same code to navigate to the element.

We were looking at the UrnOutlinePage for the individual editor instead of the global editor, when multiple pages where available. We must have optimized something a while back so that all pages now share the same UrnOutlinePage.

bug.short_desc: Undesirable path crossing in forks/joins

long_desc.thetext:
> When drawing an and fork and join with a number of paths in between > (in this case 4), it is almost impossible to have them line up right, > see the attached. No matter how I drag things around, the paths always > end up crossing. I tried deleting paths, and then adding them back in, > but the and path is always added on the top, and when one deletes the > empty point, it falls back to the drawing as shown....
Mhhh. This is an interesting one. jUCMNav tries to avoid path crossing, at least in theory. I replicated your UCM and somehow the issue seems to be related with the orientation of the and-join. I added an empty point after this and-join and, by moving it up or down (hence changing the orientation), I was able to get the lines not to overlap. Moving the stubs horizontally also seems to have an impact on path crossing.
There must be a way to avoid playing with positions like this.
File attached.

Created attachment 12 And-fork and And-join with 4 paths in between
By playing with the stub horizontal positions or with the vertical position of the empty point that follows the And-join, the 4 paths start crossing each other in undesirable ways.

attachment.desc: And-fork and And-join with 4 paths in between

bug.short_desc: wrong direction for automatically added dependency links

long_desc.thetext: try the following: create a grl graph with two softgoals (A and B). add a dependency link from A to B. now add a third softgoal. change the third softgoal to B. the automatically created dependency link is from the second B to A and not from A to the second B.

bug.short_desc: EObjectPropertySource needs to be refactored

long_desc.thetext:
EObjectPropertySource should be broken down on some sub-class because the code there is too "class dependant". We use too much the instanceof operator. This class should be put back to it's initial general state. All the class specific operations should be in sub-class or should be defined in a general way so that it's not specifically programmed for a class.
I think there's good example of this in the flow editor or in the shape editor. They define their property descriptor directly in the model (wich is not what we want), but could maybe help us...

bug.short_desc: ctrl-z / ctrl-y do not work in outline

long_desc.thetext: although undo redo in the contextual menu does.

bug.short_desc: refactoring into stub problem

long_desc.thetext:
see attached jucm file - select everything to the right of the direction arrow that follows stub S1 - refactor into stub - in addition to the three expected out-paths, there is a fourth with a number of empty points. the fourth out-path should not be there. - furthermore, the tool asks whether responsibility definitions should be deleted. this dialogue should be disabled during stub refactoring.
- undo all changes - remove responsibilities r4, r5, r6, and r7 - again select everything to the right of the direction arrow that follows stub S1 - refactor into stub - now it works!
Created attachment 32 contains problem case

bug.short_desc: Finish button after removing metadata

long_desc.thetext: After removing metadata, finish button doesn't close the metadata editor window. Cancel does close the window but usually cancel implies the recent changes won't be applied. (In this case removing the metadata is correctly applied)

bug.short_desc: Differentiating between capital and small letters

long_desc.thetext: The tool does not differentiate between the capital letter and small letter. As an example, when the modeler want to change the name of an Intentional Element from ÂappleÂ to ÂAppleÂ, it stays ÂappleÂ

True; This can be annoying, even though this is a side effect of not having the user to type in the exact same capitalization as is already in place.
Current workaround: rename to something else then rename it back with a different capitalization.
Proposed solution: a) when adding an element for which a definition already exists, ignore the new capitalization as we're potentially lazy (typing everything in lowercase for an existing element) b) when renaming a reference to the same name but with different case, always rename the definition to the new name. This changes all instances.

I know that in order to solve the problem by just simply rename the element with any new name, then rename it back with your original name with the capital letter. I thought It is not professional doing this.

This is decomposed in two issues: 1) The auto-complete kicks in whenever you press enter. The current behaviour can be worked around by clicking in the background first (closing the autocomplete) and then again in the text field. The behaviour should be changed so that the auto complete must be activated using either tab or the down arrow (or chosen with a mouse). This way, the use of the autocomplete will use the existing capitalization whereas typing it in directly should rename all existing instances to the new name, as entered.
2) One cannot rename a model element in the properties view to the same name with a different capitalization. This gives an error message popup. The behaviour should be to allow this change (thus renaming the definition to the way it was entered in the properties view).
*** Bug 771 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Agreed!

Fixed. Testing appreciated, as there are many weird fringe cases that can be found. I think I've covered them all, but you never know!
1) the auto-complete is now less intrusive - the first option which is suggested is the text you've typed in. enter thus confirms your selection - you need to use the mouse or arrow keys to use the auto-complete. 2) you can now rename an element to another variant of its capitalization in the editor, properties and advanced properties. this change does not affect the existing behaviour when renaming to the name of an existing element.
Looks good, many thanks!

When I insert a node, the palette tool changes to the end point, thus extending the path on next click.

bug.short_desc: ucm illegal infinite loop bug.

long_desc.thetext:
Found by Daniel.
create a path, put a stub on it. create another path. drag & drop start point on the stub. take the end point of this new path and drag it on itself, after the stub.
bingo: illegal infinite loop.

bug.short_desc: grl drag & drop from outline problem

long_desc.thetext: when we drag an intentional element into a graph from the outline, its links are not automatically created but they are when you change the definition from the properties view.

bug.short_desc: Figures should be able to calculate their orientation

long_desc.thetext: We should find a generic way to set the orientation of a figure from the data calculated from the connection router. Figures should not be able to know the connection router to avoid unnecessary dependances.
Maybe we should handle this in the editpart of the concerned figures.

I think I have an idea how to fix this. If we could have a reference to the EditPartViewer of our editor in our BSplineConnectionRouter we could know with the edit part registry wich editpart correspond to a model object. So each time a connection would be routed, we could find the model objets connected to this connection and then find the edit part for this particular object. Then with the edit part with can access the figure and set an orientation on it. So this way only the connection router is affected and the figures will receive there orientations automagically and the end point could be perpendicular to the connection.... :P
Jord you can implement this if you want... I would be good practice. Let me know if you want to check this out or if I should do it or if you need help!!
*** Bug 256 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

rotate: end points, responsibilities and others (will have to define) should all have this capability. we should move the code from the end point editpart to the path node editpart (in a method like getEntryRay()). Change the connection router to refreshVisuals() on all pathnodes instead of only emptypoints. Any editpart wanting to be rotated would only need to call getEntryRay(). Of course, because of elements with multiple entry rays, we should have a method like getEntryRay(int i).
should no longer be rotated: stub. should be rotated: and fork, and join.
done by jmcmanus

bug.short_desc: Scenarios and Strategies View: the GRL Evaluation Strategies folder keeps collapsing when switching models

long_desc.thetext:
When I switch from a model where I have a Strategy selected to another model, when I switch back, the Evaluation Strategies folder in the Scenarios and Strategies View is collapsed, and hence I need a couple of clicks to select the strategy again. This happens in design mode and in execution mode.
Somehow, the behaviour of the UCM Scenarios folder is different (and correct) as it does not collapse.

bug.short_desc: Metrics/Rules preferences on Linux: details take too much vertical space

On Linux, the rule query and constraints expressions in the Metrics/Rules preferences are entirely shown, so they take much vertical space (and only a couple of rules are visible at once).
Solution: for these preferences, show only the Name, Context, and Description fields.
Removed 3 columns.

bug.short_desc: Strategy/Scenario View becomes empty after looking at a Java file

- Edit a URN model - Switch to a Java file in Eclipse - Go back to the URN model

However, if I go to a second URN model, then the Strategy/Scenario View reappears... weird!

bug.short_desc: scenarios: problem with inherited inclusion

long_desc.thetext:
add scenario a,b,c. make a include c. make b include c. make a include b.
no recursion, but scenario c is included twice: - result: UI explodes, deletions don't work properly, etc.
duplicating such a scenario also causes issues.

I seem to have fixed the problem. Issue: - Given this situation, imagine a ScenarioStartPoint point in scenario c. - alternative a: include it twice, as the recursive descent dictates - alternative b: include it once
We took alternative a but that brought up some issues with the treeview. Simply put, it seems it didn't like the fact that a node had multiple direct children that represented the same model element. (Inherited from both other situations).
Doing changes to ScenarioUtils.getDefinedStartPoints() to prevent duplicates solved the problem.
Closing the bug because I don't think it is a big loss not to duplicate the inherited entries. I doesn't make sense to me to do such a thing... but maybe I am imposing a limitation that will one day have to be changed. If this day occurs (when we want to allow a scenario to be included multiple times) then we will have to chagne this, but hopefully I will be long gone :)

bug.short_desc: metadata is not duplicated by duplicatecommand

long_desc.thetext: if you add metadata to a scenario for example and duplicate it, the meta-data is lost.
Added code to duplicate metadata on duplicatecommands (strategies, strategy groups, scenarios and scenario groups).

bug.short_desc: Metrics editor should not have a context String or a warning checkbox

long_desc.thetext: These are necessary for semantic rules, but not for metrics.
Context is now set to urn::URNspec (uneditable), and the warning checkbox is not displayed.

bug.short_desc: Extract translatable strings from HTMLReport

long_desc.thetext:
The HTML report currently includes some 200+ strings. A good 80%+ of them are just plain HTML which can be ignored. However, a few others should have the text extracted from the strings so that it can be easily translated to other languages. (instead of things like "

Components

", we should have either: "

" + "Components" + "

" or, even better, something like "

{0}

" where {0} is replaced in code with "Components". (I forget the Java equivalent to C# String.Format)
Also investigate the other elements in the report package - similar issues exist - maybe a generic solution should be used to avoid duplicated translation in all export plugins.

All strings in the importexport.reports and importexport.html packages have been externalized (i.e., all strings have been added to the the English and the French properties files instead of being hard-coded). Reports are now generated in the language in which jUCMNav is being executed.

bug.short_desc: The property descriptor for a boolean is a combobox

long_desc.thetext: This should be a checkbox.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: syntax checker button

long_desc.thetext: should have a button that would verify the syntax of all responsibilities and conditions, everywhere, and produce warnings in the problems view for these.

bug.short_desc: mac bug: perspective not reset

long_desc.thetext:
- Default jUCMNav view was not used (reset) the first time the tool was used (outline + Navigator missing)
this might be a bug not only with macos

bug.short_desc: drag&drop issue

long_desc.thetext: should allow any drag & drop of pathnode on its pred/succ nodeconnections -> move it. right now, you have to move it by clicking elsewhere than on the node connection.

bug.short_desc: ASD must be optional in jUCMNav's metamodel

long_desc.thetext: The association between URNspec and ASDspec should be 1 - 0..1, not 1 - 1.
Fixed in v0.29

bug.short_desc: Strategies export to csv files do not handle commas in descriptions

long_desc.thetext: If a description of an intentional element contains a comma, this creates problems when exporting GRL strategy results to .csv files. Commas should be replaced by commas before exporting.
The problem was in the description of the strategies, not of the intentional elements. Now changes commas to semi-colons on the fly.

bug.short_desc: splitlinkcommand on empty point.

long_desc.thetext:
- Support placing a path node (responsibility, timer, wait, etc.) on an existing empty point (and replace the later with the path node).
make sure not connected to anything else (Connect)
the opposite (downgrade a pathnode) was in our requirements as well.
can do it from palette now.
can do it on direction arrows as well.

bug.short_desc: palette broken for certain layouts

long_desc.thetext:
error when layout set to: - columns - icons only
also: use large icons makes it fail

Fixed bug 208. Palette crashed because of null image descriptors for large images.
Large images still missing (creating new bug); added large spacer (spacer24.gif) temporarily.

bug.short_desc: Belief descriptions not duplicated properly when duplicating a GRL diagram

long_desc.thetext: When duplicating GRL diagrams, the belief description (which is its most important attribute) is not copied.

bug.short_desc: ReqComp - Cannot delete.

long_desc.thetext: (Forgot about this one)
done. approx time for implementation: 30 min (tests not included.)

bug.short_desc: In the Stub Bindings window, plug-in condition expressions' && are replaced with &

long_desc.thetext: This affects only the visualization of the boolean expression, and its definition remains OK.
Created attachment 11 Note && visualized as &
Fixed by replacing all && with &&&& in the expression shown on screen (StubsBindingDialog.java)

bug.short_desc: grl strategy

long_desc.thetext: a default group/strategy should be created with the file.

bug.short_desc: extract all strings + translate

long_desc.thetext:
When feature complete, we need to extract all the strings that we have not extracted yet and translate them to French.
Inaldo Costa offered to translate them to Portuguese. (inaldo_costa@yahoo.com.br) Maybe Gunter can translate them to German?
Translation doesn't take much time, but reviewing/testing the translation might be a problem.

bug.short_desc: MacOS user interface bugs

long_desc.thetext:
Reported by Jason:
1 - labels have same problems as components (assuming everything does) 2 - color picker isn't initialized until you select a color (is fully black when the color is null) 3 - when selecting multiple elements, no outline is visible 4 - scenario variable initializations only appear to work if you move to the next item 5 - the edit button in the properties view (the ...) doesn't show in its entirety (can only see the top half of it) 6 - ** cannot create enumerations. line breaks are not interpreted properly. 7 - Properties view in execution perspective is hard to use (name column takes all the space)
some of these are listed in bug 635

bug.short_desc: scenarios: grayed out elements from included scenarios

long_desc.thetext:
The scenario treeview should show elements from included scenarios: - start points - end points - pre/post conditions - variable initializations
They should be in the order that the traversal algorithm will test them.

bug.short_desc: import wizard: overwrite doesn't work if file is open

long_desc.thetext:
if a file is currently opened when importing, it will not be overwritten (or at least not refreshed in the UI)
tested with import from UCEd
actually, the autolayout is performed on the old file, but the new content isn't loaded.
fixed.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: reached end points

long_desc.thetext: scenario traversal algorithm should check that the scenarioendpoints are reached.

bug.short_desc: path tool missing id on new element bug

long_desc.thetext: when creating an empty point on a path using the path tool, the new empty point does not have an id and therefore must not be created using th emodelcreationfactory.

the start point doesn't have an id either.
are you calling modelcreationfactory without a URNspec?
jkealey-fixed

bug.short_desc: Label bounding box doesn't show up when you move it.

long_desc.thetext: There's no feedback anymore when you move a label.
fixed.

bug.short_desc: Plug-in name should be used instead of stub' in MSC export

long_desc.thetext: At the moment, if a plug-in bound to a stub has no label, the stub name is used as a condition in the corresponding MSC exported from jUCMNav. It would be more useful to have the name of the plug-in selected (especially in dynamic stubs) to improve traceability.

bug.short_desc: Select All does not allow moving the bend points of GRL links.

long_desc.thetext: The bend points stay at their previous location when moving GRL elements. Same issue when moving just the actor (bend points are not contained?).

Tried to use RelativeBendpoints instead of AbsoluteBendpoints. This failed because the model use absolute coordinates for bendpoints. Instead I simulate the behavior of relativebendpoints with AbsoluteBendpoints. Each time a GRL node is moved, I generate move commands for bendpoints that behave move them like a relativebendpoint would.

Looks good when moving groups of intentional element!
There is still one issue I think. When I move an Actor that contains intentional elements with links that have bendpoints, the bendpoints are still not moved.
Fixed this last problem, refactored a bunch of code in commands. Also behave more like relative bendpoints when we move multiple elements together depending on what is selected.

The problem where we move an actor with IEs and links with bendpoints is not solved (the bendpoints are not moved).
Jason also just fixed a bug where belief links were not handled properly (error). This needs verification.
Seems all good now.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: jucmnav execution perspective

long_desc.thetext:
Should offer a perspective that would replace the navigator / outline with a large vertical column for scenarios, and split properties/problems on the bottom. (Possibly hide palette as well).
One would hot swap between these using the scenario design/execute buttons.

bug.short_desc: UI refresh problems

long_desc.thetext: when we change the color of a reference, the other references are not updated until they are moved. name is updated properly.
I guess we fixed this along the way.

bug.short_desc: Merge start/end point tools into one generic path tool.

long_desc.thetext: When you add a start point, it enters a minimal path and the palette defaults to the end point tool. However, what remains selected is the start point instead of the end point. This will have to be changed in order to help bug 148.
*** Bug 165 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Renamed from: After creation of new path, should select end point, not start.
assigned to ET.
done by et.

bug.short_desc: Improve feedback on "Verify Pseudo-Syntax" menu and others

long_desc.thetext:
From Ali: What does this action really do ? It is always there. Do I really need it when I am in a GRL model ? When I click on it, I donÂt see any feedback. I donÂt see any change in any of the eclipse views, I donÂt see any dialog, I donÂt see any message etc. Am I doing something wrong ? Do I have to select something then click on this guy ? Is this a context based action or checks the whole model ? How can get this to work anyway? Based on the current UI and the feedback that I get (nothing) I cannot answer any of those questions so the feature is completely useless for me.
Note: Presence is fine in my opinion (this applies to the entire model).
Note: Current feedback when no issue is that the Problems view is cleaned up...
Lack of feedback might be the case for many menus from the initial jUCMNav, when it was a UCM-only editor.

bug.short_desc: file -> new should prompt for overwrite

long_desc.thetext: right now, it automatically uses another filename.

bug.short_desc: palette: add dynamic stub

long_desc.thetext: instead of using the typical method in the modelcreationfactory, use the one with the type parameter. say 0 for static, 1 for dynamic.
done by et; see bug 266

bug.short_desc: strategies/scenarios view: changed properties don't affect isDirty flag

long_desc.thetext:
when changing a property via the properties view when an element in the strategy/scenario view is open, the editor is not flagged as dirty and can be closed without saving.
found by gunter: try this out: 1) load SimplePhoneSystem.jucm 2) go to the Variables list in the Scenarios and Strategies view 3) select variable OnOCSList 4) in the Properties view, change decription "oarty" to "party" 5) close the file by clicking on the x in the tab 6) load the file again 7) the change was not saved (description still says "oarty")

bug.short_desc: creation wizard bug

long_desc.thetext: the wizard allows you to create a file without the .jucm extension. if the extension is other than .jucm, it doesn't let you, but if there is no extension, you'll create a file which will be opened by the text editor.

bug.short_desc: property sheet + other pages

long_desc.thetext: when moving a pathnode in any map except the first one, the property sheet is not updated automatically.

bug.short_desc: import/export should be accessible from any URN element's contextual menu

long_desc.thetext: Right now, it only works if you have selected a diagram... not a reference or definition.

This is illogical. It would make the user think that he can import into a startpoint, for example.
I originally filed this bug because I was too lazy when doing repetitive imports while coding UCEd->jUCMnav.
Closing as wontfix.

bug.short_desc: export threading problem

long_desc.thetext:
If exporting to c:\temp in the SITE labs, we get an error (probably don't have write access). This error bubbles up to the UI and is displayed as a threading access error instead of the real problem.
Show the real error.

bug.short_desc: node connections should be selectable

long_desc.thetext: we will have condition labels later on. change their color when selected.

bug.short_desc: add branch (in/out) on stub's contextual menu

long_desc.thetext:
Daniel's wife points out that newbies don't know that you can drag & drop a start/end point on a stub.
Add a contextual menu item to make this happen.

bug.short_desc: NewUcmFileWizard does not name elements according to ModelCreationFactory naming conventions
timeout symbol problem with zoom

long_desc.thetext: - Timout symbol on a timeout path is not well located at zooms other than 100%

bug.short_desc: rename + change caps

long_desc.thetext: when you rename a component, responsibility or anything with a unique name, and you change its capitalization, the new name will not take effect.

bug.short_desc: The router package should be moved out of the figure package

long_desc.thetext: The router package contains the only class in the figure package that holds references to the model. All the other class in the figure package doesn't have any references to the model. Maybe it would be better to move it outside of the figure package, but I'm not 100% sure...
not of capital importance. would lose CVS history.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: warning when no start points

long_desc.thetext: scenarios should warn when no start points are in the active scenario.

bug.short_desc: palette text uniformity

long_desc.thetext: - Tool palette: some of the decriptions use Create while other use Creates (should use Create). They also use fork/join instead of Fork Join. "an other component" should be another component'

bug.short_desc: grl element naming issues

long_desc.thetext:
Instead of intentional element, wouldn't it be nicer to have names that fit the node type such as softgoal, task, etc?
Why don't beliefs have a default description which would be the name of the belief instead of a blank field?

Intentional Element have names that correspond to their type when they are created. However, if the type change, the name will not be change.
For beliefs, they are used as comments in GRL graph. I think it is better to keep the default description empty instead of having a description such as "Belief24".

bug.short_desc: metamodel update: need new field in URNspec to preserve the largest ID ever used in the file.

long_desc.thetext: currently using modified.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: non-deterministic choice

long_desc.thetext:
When there is a non-deterministic choice between multiple true conditions (fork, dynamic stub...), I think we should warn about non-determinism (and mention which branch/plug-in has been taken, if any)
Also, default scenario traversal algorithm should have a parameter indicating how to resolve this issue: a) First true b) Any true (non-deterministic) c) Block
