bug.short_desc: Layout gets corrupted in StubBindingsDialog

long_desc.thetext: The layout is corrupted after a number of expand/unexpand sections in StubBindingsDialog.
fixed

bug.short_desc: label font color

long_desc.thetext: - Labels for conditions and IN/OUT and outline: not dark enough, especially on a laptop or on a printout. Maybe use a different color?

> What do you want, color or lower brightness?
Darker for the outline.
Cndition labels and IN/OUT: not sure yet. The Java editor uses purple for keywords, which may be nice.
User-defined?
Daniel
---
May be our chance to install a preference page.
Jason

bug.short_desc: no command should depend on draw2d.

long_desc.thetext: remove depency to org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Point from SetConstraintCommand and any other commands which use draw2d
fixed all commands except those concerning labels. reassigning to Jordan.

bug.short_desc: key binding: escape -> revert palette to default tool

long_desc.thetext: - Need to support the Esc key (to unselect everything and go to Selection mode, especially useful with PathTool). This was a nice feature of UCMNav and I really got used to it!

bug.short_desc: GRL: can't move labels causes problems

long_desc.thetext:
if we try to select all items in a file, we can't move them without deselecting the label.
a) don't let the actor label be selectable. bad because thats how the direct edit works. b) change the check that verifies that all selected editparts can move to ignore actor labels c) allow labels to behave like UCM ones. allow the user to move them elsewhere.

bug.short_desc: Support for KPI overrides in strategy inclusion

long_desc.thetext:
We need to support the KPINewEvalValue object in strategy evaluations. In essence, this is used when a strategy includes another one. The including strategy's behaviour is the following:
If an evaluation object for an indicator has a KPINewEvalValue object, then the values for Target, Threshold, and Worst are inherited (recursively) from the included strategy, and the evaluation value to be used is the one in KPINewEvalValue.
If an evaluation object for an indicator does not have a KPINewEvalValue object, then the Target, Threshold, Worst and Evaluation values of the including strategy are used (as is the case now).
Note: KPINewEvalValue is ONLY for evaluations of indicators, in including strategies.
A new pop-up menu might be needed to handle this at the GUI level (not sure)

I have committed the first draft of this code. It was very hard to execute, given the gap between the metamodel and how we internally use Evaluations.
In the current implementation, there might be some oddities depending on the order you edit KPIEvalValueSets (child or parent strategy first). In general, I try to keep only one instance (at the child), but if you create it at the parent first, then modify it at the child level, you will see some anomalies (until you modify the child again).
Please review and report specific anomalies here.
Will mark as fixed, with specific flaws (if any) to be listed as new bugs.

bug.short_desc: A pop up menu for selecting class type for GRL IEs and Strategies

long_desc.thetext: In the legal profile for URN, by right clicking on an intentional element or strategy a pop up menu appears that shows stereotype as one item in the menu. Then by hovering on stereotype another sub-menu appears that has CLASS1, CLASS2, and OTHER as stereotype values each appears as independent menu item. Users shall be able to both add and remove stereotypes for intentional elements and strategies. For each single stereotype a new METADATA is added to the intentional element or strategy. The stereotype name for Intentional element should be ST_CLASSTYPE and the values are CLASS1, CLASS2, OTHER. The stereotype name for strategy should be acceptStereotype and the values are CLASS1, CLASS2, OTHER.

Scenario select a goal right-click, select "Compliance Tag" sub-menu shows "Add CLASS1", "Add CLASS2", "Add OTHER" select "Add CLASS1" result: a new metadata element is added to the goal: name="ST_CLASSTYPE", value="CLASS1"
select the same goal right-click, select "Tag" sub-menu shows "Remove CLASS1", "Add CLASS2", "Add OTHER" select "Add CLASS2" result: a new (second) metadata element is added to the goal: name="ST_CLASSTYPE", value="CLASS2"
select the same goal right-click, select "Tag" sub-menu shows "Remove CLASS1", "Remove CLASS2", "Add OTHER" select "Remove CLASS1" result: the first metadata element (name="ST_CLASSTYPE", value="CLASS1") is removed
Similarly, this scenario should be applicable to Strategy elements (in the appropriate view), but the name of the metadata is different: "acceptStereotype" instead of "ST_CLASSTYPE". The values are the same.
Ideally, the mechanism should be generic for a specific list of metadata attributes (name, value, model element (including subtypes)), stored in the model for now. We'll handle the GUI for managing stereotype lists later. The metadata here would be (attached to URNspec):
name="StereotypeDef", value="ST_CLASSTYPE,CLASS1,IntentionalElement" name="StereotypeDef", value="ST_CLASSTYPE,CLASS2,IntentionalElement" name="StereotypeDef", value="ST_CLASSTYPE,OTHER,IntentionalElement" name="StereotypeDef", value="ST_CLASSTYPE,CLASS1,EvaluationStrategy" name="StereotypeDef", value="ST_CLASSTYPE,CLASS2,EvaluationStrategy" name="StereotypeDef", value="ST_CLASSTYPE,OTHER,EvaluationStrategy"

bug.short_desc: Simplify input of evaluations for intentional elements in a strategy

long_desc.thetext:
In the execution view, for a given strategy, the modeller has to use the Properties view to set the evaluationLevel (100 to -100), qualitativeEvaluation, importance, and/or importanceQuantitative. This should be doable via pop-up menus while right-clicking on the intentional element (in section for strategy stuff, including Delete User Evaluation).
Could have something like (with 2nd level popups for the 4 options):
---------------- Set Qualitative Evaluation Satisfied Weakly Satisfied None Weakly Denied Denied Conflict Unknown Set Numerical Evaluation 100 75 50 25 0 -25 -50 -75 -100 Other... Set Quantitative Importance High Medium Low None Set Numerical Importance 100 75 50 25 0 Other... Delete User Evaluation ----------------
Other... could bring a small window where the current numerical value could be reported and changed.
(actually, the two importance values are independent from having a strategy selected or not, so they could always be available even in the Design view)
This looks similar to bug 436

bug.short_desc: Moving by Arrows

long_desc.thetext: It would be nice if one can use arrow keys to move the selected items on diagram (similar to visio/powerpoint)

This is already implemented using Eclipse standards.
With an element selected, use the arrow keys to change your selection. Hold the Ctrl or select key while using the arrow keys to expand your selection. With elements selected, hit the . (period) key. Your arrow keys will now allow you to move the selected elements. Hit enter to confirm the new location. Using the . (period) key, you can cycle between move and resize different bounds. For example, select a component, hit period twice and you can resize its right bound using the arrow keys and confirm the new size using enter.
PS: I had forgotten the specifics, but the online help refreshed my memory: http://jucmnav.softwareengineering.ca/ucm/bin/view/ProjetSEG/HelpOnLine

bug.short_desc: GRL intentional elements should be resizable

long_desc.thetext: It should be possible to change the size of GRL intentional elements. Auto-size is useful when editing the name, but it is not perfect. Auto-sizing might be desirable only when increasing the size of the element (if not sufficient).

bug.short_desc: Evolve metamodel to support new qualitative KPIs

long_desc.thetext:
There is a need to greatly improve how KPIs are defined, stored, and used. The RE'2012 paper explains the new metamodel (see figure attached).
One big question is what to do with current KPIs... Phase them out? Deprecate them (to preserve backward compatibility)?
This is a MAJOR change.
Created attachment 41 Draft metamodel
Done. Simpler and different from the Requirements Engineering paper, but this solution has the advantage of being backward compatible.

bug.short_desc: Colour feedback for intentional elements initialized in GRL strategies

long_desc.thetext:
When a GRL strategy is active, initialized intentional elements (IE) are indicated by "(*)" next to their satisfaction label, which is hard to see. The proposal is to have: - If the initialized IE does not have any link input (i.e. it is a leaf), then highlight the line border in blue - If the initialized IE is the target of some link (i.e. the value is overriden, which might indicate a conflict resolution), then highlight the line border in pink
The (*) should still be kept.
Changing the line color also changes the text color. Resolution, initialized GRL IEs have a dashed outline, and those that also override potential computed values are highlighted in dark red.

bug.short_desc: Sensitivity analysis

long_desc.thetext:
Adding a new feature:
Provide a range of values instead of an absolute value each time. Provide granularity and visualization as well

This is for GRL analysis. This requirement will need to be refined as it may imply to provide ranges for contributions, for satisfaction levels, or for both (perhaps with steps too, e.g., from -25 to +25, by steps of 5).
One related issue is the visualization/navigation of the results (as there are more than one results), and perhaps the report of some specific issues (e.g., the results are insensitive to some changes in the range provided, etc.)

From Daniel:
Assumption for now in the analysis: only one ranged element will be considered (and a sequence of values will be generated for the other GRL elements).
GUI proposals: 1) Right click on element and say "Edit evaluation/contribution range". 2) Opens dialog. 3) Enter min/max/step. 4) Apply closes dialog and inserts this range in the model. 5) Set the default value to the min entered in the dialog. You can override it like any other evaluation/contribution (set specific value, context menus, etc.). The default value isn't impacted by our selection. 6) Figures with ranges are visualized differently somehow (stars? color? outline? TBD) 7) Right click on ranged element and say "Evaluate all possibilities in range". This changes the style of the element to be even more obvious. This may be in the strategies view if not in the GUI. TBD 8) Runs each strategy in the range. The GUI shows the range of values observed. 9) If easy, allow right clicking on an element and select "Show the specific values in the range which minimize/maximize this element". Refreshes the editor to show only one of the options & all associated values. 10) If you run any other strategy, the range gets overridden using the normal algorithms. You need to specifically "Run" a range for the GUI to show it.
This use case allows us to: a) support multiple ranges in the base model without deleting the previously entered ones when setting a new one b) when not using ranges, nothing changes (GUI+algos) c) Algos don't need to support ranges. We just run all the possibilities in a loop, track all the results in parallel and allow easy filtering in the GUI.
Thoughts?

Committed some partial work. EvaluationRanges work, ContributionRanges not touched yet.
1) Activate/select a strategy. 2) Set an evaluation value to an intentional element. (Must have value set for following to work) 3) Right click - edit the range. 4) Change the range value. Clicking finish will automatically run that range. 5) Note the [X-Y] values listed next to the evaluation. This shows the range of values. 6) A metadata entry was added to show all the runtime values.
Similar behaviour added for ContributionRanges.

bug.short_desc: GUI for managing model tags

long_desc.thetext: We need a GUI to manage the list of predefined tags (stereotype and other metadata) that can be attached to model elements. This probably implies a new preference page (at the tool level, to populate new models), and maybe a GUI at the model level (to update tag definitions).
See Bug 807 for a sample usage and storage mechanism (as metadata for URNspec)
Fixed by Etienne in 5.4.

bug.short_desc: Simplify input of contribution values for contributions/correlations in a model

long_desc.thetext:
The modeller has to use the Properties view to set the contribution (100 to -100), qualitativeContribution, and/or correlation flag. This should be doable via pop-up menus while right-clicking on the contribution link.
Could have something like (with 2nd level popups for the 2 first options):
---------------- Set Qualitative Contribution Make Some Positive Help Unknown Hurt Some Negative Break Set Numerical Contribution 100 75 50 25 0 -25 -50 -75 -100 Other... X Correlation (some checkbox here, or a way to switch between contribution and correlation) ----------------
Other... could bring a small window where the current numerical value could be reported and changed.

Added contextual menus for numerical/qualitative setting of contribution levels (also supports multiple contributions, and refresh of strategy).
What remains: - Way to switch between contribution and correlation - Key bindings
Added key bindings and menu option to toggle between contribution and correlation

bug.short_desc: Improve usability of auto-layout wizard (dot)

long_desc.thetext: See attached screenshot
Created attachment 19 Comments from Ali

bug.short_desc: Selecting Items on a large graph at low view scale

long_desc.thetext: when a large GRL graph is being seen at a low view scale(e.g. 10%) it is very difficult to select and move an item. It rather selects a point on the selected item and resize it.

bug.short_desc: Comment boxes should be supported

long_desc.thetext: Comment boxes should be supported for UCM and GRL as described in section 7.6.13 of Z.151.

bug.short_desc: Refactor code for GRL strategies

long_desc.thetext:
The GRL strategy algorithms MUCH overlap, and are becoming a maintenance nightmare. We need to refactor them into some sort of family (and likely use inheritance), e.g.:
Quantitative (should include new KPI support) Formula-based uses Quantitative (KPI aggregation) Mixed uses Formula-based (and overrides some of the functions with transformations) Conditional uses Formula-based (plus a few constraints/features) Qualitative (should we even support KPIs there?) Constraint-oriented (experimental)
Roy2006: removed (gone!)

Refactored based on these specifications. Mixed & Conditional now inherit from the KPI aggregation features provided in Formula.
Legal stereotypes are now included everywhere.
Lots of the metadata fields are now case-insensitive.

bug.short_desc: URN links should be created Ã la Telelogic DOORS

long_desc.thetext:
The UI for creating URN links is currently limited to just a few types of source and target model elements. However, more types of links are needed.
Suggestion: A simple UI would be sinmilar to what DOORS does:
1- Select an element (from GRL or UCM), popup menu: URN Link -> New Link Source
2- Select another element (from GRL or UCM), popup menu: URN Link -> New Link Target (this is available only is a New Link Source has been used and specifies an element)
3- Ask for link type (String)
4- Create URN link
To view/navigate links:
1- Select element 2a- Pop up: URN Link -> Incoming -> (list of link type with element name) 2b- Pop up: URN Link -> Outgoing -> (list of link type with element name)
To delete a link: 1- Select element 2- Pop up: URN Link -> Delete -> (list of link type with element name with incoming/outgoing icon of some sort)
There might also be a view or a wizard to manage links for the entire model (not sure).

bug.short_desc: GRL scale: option to have it fro 0 to 100 instead of from -100 to 100

long_desc.thetext: Change the range from 0 to 100 instead of -100 to 100. So, the red represents a 0 value, and the green represents a 100 value.. Can we customize the gauge of the color for each model? (customized feature instead of fixed one)
This also probably includes revisiting the range of contributions?

Again, there are lots of impact beyond the simple preference.
All the quantitative/hybrid propagation algorithms need to take this into consideration, or another algorithm needs to be used. The propagation functions need to be changed, not simply the display (to be done by Azalia or someone else). Similarly, strategies will expect 0-100 values a well when this is selected.
A few things need to be clarified with Edna, Rasha, and Azalia before concluding this feature.

Algorithms can elect to read the values from the [0,100] range via the right call, work on the values in that range and persist them back in the [-100,100] range using the right call. The model will just store it under the wider ranger for compatibility purposes.
Algorithms can also elect to only work if one range is selected in the preferences or can behave differently in both contexts. I could improve the algorithm API to better handle all of this, but I didn't change anything to the existing algorithms as I was not in a position to decide the desired behaviour. If I can get some specs on the changes required to one algorithm, I can produce the template for others. In the meantime, everything works out of the box.
I'll wait for your comments.

In discussion with Daniel, I now see I misunderstood the issue and overdid a few elements.
Here are changes to be done:
1 - Revert contributions back to using -100,100 even if this preference is set. 2 - When this preference is set, the algos will be responsible to produce values in this range. Therefore, when showing the color, we should convert the [0,100] model value to the [-100,100] range, then determine the color based on the previous scale. 3 - Explore setting this preference inside the model (metadata on urnspec). The preference should be for new models only. Existing models have the -100,100 range. An action should be added to toggle between the two interpretations for the given model. That way, models shared with others will know which preference to use. 4 - GUI should limit from 0 to 100 when setting IE evaluations, but actually use those values in the model, not convert them back to the [-100,100] range.
Changes performed as specified. May have missed things, so feel free to review.

bug.short_desc: Add more default rules/metrics

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNav needs a more comprehensive set of default metrics and semantic rules. This requires major improvements to the OCL library or utilities/queries for URN.

- Fairly large OCL library now available. - Different groups of constraints and metrics now available (74 default constraints and 29 default metrics) - Many improvements to the rule management GUI.
More useful metrics are still needed, especially for aspects (simple size metrics for GRL and UCM are included to demonstrate feasibility).

bug.short_desc: Image export in MSC Viewer

long_desc.thetext:
The image export in the MSC Viewer - requires one to select the path explicitly (don't know where the images are stored otherwise) - does not take into consideration the zoom factor (uses 100%) - can only be invoked on the .jucmscenarios file - can only export one image at a time
All of these points require further usability enhancements.

bug.short_desc: GRL catalogues should also include actors

long_desc.thetext: Only IEs and links are currently exported/imported. Actor definitions and IE-to-Actor bindings should be there as well.
Support for actors and containment links between actors and their intentional elements was added.

bug.short_desc: UCM ComponentType should be supported

long_desc.thetext: UCM ComponentType should be supported as defined in section 8.4.2 od Z.151. They exist in the metamodel, but there is no GUI.

long_desc.thetext: should be able to set frequent values via contextual menu valuation, contribution level, and/or decomposition, correlation, priority, criticality

long_desc.thetext: Support basic creation of And Joins.

bug.short_desc: GRL quantitative algorithms (family) should support "exceeds" and new KPI conversions

bug.short_desc: Support for external hyperlink

long_desc.thetext: There should be some sort of support for the creation/navigation/deletion of hyperlinks (URL) from any URN model element. Maybe via a metadata tag. Would start a browser window or appropriate application.

Use metadata as a data store.
Right click on URL model element and you have: - Create Hyperlink. - Pop up window to enter URL.
If exists: - Modify hyperlink. - Delete hyperlink. - Navigate to hyperlink. (launches internal web browser)
Implemented, with commands, icons, tests, and French support.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: traversal using double-click issues

long_desc.thetext: when double-clicking on an end point in a scenario that opens a dialog of multiple alternatives, it should show the stub name in addition to the map name. would be nice to actually select the stub in the parent map as well.

bug.short_desc: Import GRL models from CSV files (base case)

long_desc.thetext:
This bug describes the enhancement to support importing a CSV file (excel sheet) to create a GRL model. Documented here is the base case that describes the specifications of the imported CSV files and the expected GRL model. Additional enhancements may be needed to provide for some flexibility in the specifications of the imported CSV file or the resulting GRL model.
The imported CSV file must conform to the following specifications.
LEGISLATION_ID: This is a unique ID.
LEGISLATION_SECTION: This describes the structure of the legislation. This field is important because the import process deducts the structure of the goal model based on this field. In the base case, this field is structured as follows:
PART SUPPART.SECTION (RULE) (STATEMENT) (CONSTRAINTS)
PART: Is a two character string, such as AA. SUBPART.SECTION: Is an integer, such as 4.71 (RULE): Is an integer between brackets, such as (2) (STATEMENT): Is a single character between brackets, such as (g) (CONSTRAINTS): Is a small caps Latin number such as (i), (ii) and (iii).
The following are examples of LEGISTLATION_SECTION values: AA 4.71 (1) AA 4.71 (2)(a) AA 4.71 (2)(b) AA 4.71 (2)(c) AA 4.71 (2)(d) AA 4.71 (2)(e) AA 4.71 (2)(f)(i)(ii) AA 4.71 (2)(g)(i)
ENGLISH_DESCRIPTION: A string describing the legislation. No restriction on the legnth or content of this field.
FRENCH_DESCRIPTION: An alternative description of the legislation. No restriction on the legnth or content of this field.
URL: A URL related to the legislation. This field is parsed as a string. This URL typically points to the full text of the legistlation. No restriction on the legnth or content of this field.
IMPORTANCE: an integer value of the importance of the legislation.
COMPOSITION: This field is a value of "AND" or "OR".
Constraints on the input CSV file ================================= Constraints 1: Legislation must have either an IMPORTANCE value or COMPOSITION value, but not both. A CSV that has both values results in an error. Similarly, a legislation that has neither value results in an error.
Constraint 2: IMPORTANCE is a value between 1 and 100.
Constraint 3: The value of the COMPOSITION is either "AND" or "OR". This field is case INSENSITIVE. So, AND, and, And are all accepted values.
Constraint 4: A regulation may have more than one constraints associated with it. For example, the follwoing is a regulation with three constraints: AA 4.71 (2)(g)(i)(ii)(iii)
Constraint 5: The following fields are mandatory: PART, SUBPART.SECTION The remaining fileds are optional.
Error reporting =============== When the CSV file can not be imported successfully due to one or more of the constraints being violated, jUCMNav will report an error specifying the following at minimum: - Description of the error (i.e, the legistlation ID is missing). - The CSV file line causing the error.

Created attachment 42 A sample test CSV file
Attached is a sample CSV file for testing purposes.

Warning messages ================ It is normal for some CSV files to include lines that are not supposed to be imported and should be ignored by the import process. All lines that have been ignored should be displayed in a single warning message at the end of the import process. The warning message should give a list of ignored lines in the CSV file.

The structure of the CSV file must be in such way that the father node of rules must have only English_Description and French_Description filled (i.e the LEGISTLATION_SECTION and LEGISTLATION_ID must be empty). These fields must be filled with the legislation section number of the father. This number can be inferred from the legislation section numbers of the children. All the other fields of the father node must remain empty.
For example, the father of the following LEGISLATION values
AA 4.71 (2)(a) AA 4.71 (2)(b) AA 4.71 (2)(c) AA 4.71 (2)(d) AA 4.71 (2)(e) AA 4.71 (2)(f)
will have a father of this value: AA 4.71 (2)

bug.short_desc: GRL input of strategy definitions from tables / CSV

long_desc.thetext:
Adding a new feature:
Ability to load or import a defined data from a spreadsheet to the designed URN model. Automate the process of data entry through a user-friendly format (e.g. spreadsheets)

Export - Change the CSV export: use # to indicate computed values, and nothing to indicate strategy values
Import - Create a new group "Imported-" suffixed with the name of the imported file (or something like that) (hence, all strategies imported will be new). Make sure the group name is unique (add _1, _2...)
- If IE does not exist: output a useful warning
- If value for existing IE has # suffix: ignore.
- If value for existing IE does not have a # suffix: create new evaluation for current strategy. Also invoke method to make sure the quantitative representation of the qualitative value imported is in sync.
Initial implementation of GRL Strategy import from CSV files completed.

bug.short_desc: MSC Viewer should export images to PNG format

long_desc.thetext: MSCs currently can be exported to BMP (large files) and JPG (lower quality for printing). PNG is a better format for both aspect, with smaller files.
Fixed. Can now export to PNG (default). This requires Eclipse 3.3 however.

bug.short_desc: GRL and UCM: need to access run-time evaluation/hits values from GRL

long_desc.thetext:
After evaluating a GRL model, there is currently no way for OCL rules/metrics to access: - the current satisfaction values (quantitative and qualitative) of GRL intentional elements and actors - the current hit counts of UCM connections and path nodes
This prevents the definition of important rules regarding the coverage of UCM models by scenarios (coverage analysis) and the detection of unexpected low satisfaction levels in GRL models (e.g., for compliance analysis).
One potential solution would be to augment the jUCMNav metamodel with classes for storing this run-time information. One would need to make sure it is not saved to files however.

Fixed for GRL evaluations. _numEval and _qualEval metadata added to intentional elements and actors when a strategy is evaluated (and removed when we go back to the design view).
The values can be saved to a file when the model is saved in execution mode.
No changes to the metamodel required.

Access to path node hit count now available.
Saving in execution mode will save the extra metadata. Not a major issue (will disappear as soon as we go to the execution mode and exit it).

bug.short_desc: Support (or prevent) the 0..100 scale in the Qualitative GRL algorithm

long_desc.thetext: The new 0..100 scale currently does not make much sense in the qualitative algo.

bug.short_desc: Access to Report generation not consistent

long_desc.thetext: Report generation should probably be in jUCMNav menu and/or combined to the export wizard

bug.short_desc: Visual clue for being bound to a container

long_desc.thetext: Considering that it is not easy to make sure if an actor (or any container) is bound to its elements, a temporary visual clue would help. It can be something temporary like elements blink or become bold when the container is selected. (or it can be something more permanent like highlighting bound elements by a visual clue (e.g. different color).

This feature will not be added. We could eventually have a visual clue that an element within the area of a container is actually *not* bound to it. However, we already have this capability through predefined OCL rules (see http://jucmnav.softwareengineering.ca/ucm/bin/view/ProjetSEG/PredefinedSemanticsRulesOverview#URN_Layout_and_Overlaps): - rule GRLintentionElemInsideButUnbound - rule UCMcomponentInsideButUnbound - rule UCMpathNodeInsideButUnbound
There are also rules for overlapping components, actors, and intentional elements.

bug.short_desc: UCM synchronizing and blocking stubs should be supported

long_desc.thetext:
UCM synchronizing and blicking stubs should be supported as defined in section 8.3.1 of Z.151
This will affect the GUI slightly and the traversal algorithm substantially.

bug.short_desc: stub plugin bindings - add key bindings

long_desc.thetext: delete key should delete in/out binding.

bug.short_desc: ReqElemOrJoin creation

long_desc.thetext: Support basic creation of Or Join elements.

bug.short_desc: GRL: import/export of models in a tabular format

long_desc.thetext:
Adding a new feature:
Ability to generate or export a spreadsheet from the designed URN model Automate the process of collecting data from the model and present it in a user-friendly format (e.g. spreadsheets)
Should be done for input as well.

Created attachment 38 Original intended output of existing .csv export
I corrected two csv formatting errors and an Eclipse threading error to produce the output the original export function intended.

I changed the format of the CSV spreadsheet output to a multi-column format so the width would fit on screen. I have added a user preference for the number of columns in the output. It is currently adjustable from 5 to 12 with a default width of 7 columns not including the strategy name.

Created attachment 39 Example of new multi-column CSV export format
This is an example of the new multi-column format of the CSV export. The column width is 9 not including the strategy name.

For export to .csv, 12 columns is way too limitative. Imagine a model with 120 elements and 1000 strategies. The way this is currently implemented, the 1000 strategies would be reexecuted 10 times each (for 10 groups of 12 elements!).
I just had a model like that.
There should be an upper bound for export.
Maximum for cvs export raised to 10000

long_desc.thetext: There should be an optional indicator that shows (next to a label) whether there is metadata associated with it.

In addition, the content of this metadata (name = value) is now shown in a tool tip when hovering over a model element (together with descriptions and URN link information).

Currently, the access to the elements that can be dragged and dropped to a new diagram (definitions) are at the bottom and are hard to access, especially as clicking on a diagram element brings the focus to a diagram in the outline.

Often, one wants to see whether one GRL strategy is superior to another. There is a need to see the evaluations of two strategies at once. We could split the area of each intentional into two: left for the first strategy, and right for the second. This would allow for colours (and hopefully icons/numbers) to show how the strategies compare on the same diagram!
I'm biased, but I think this is a cool idea...

bug.short_desc: Adding and removing stub plugins

long_desc.thetext:
Hey,
Adding and removing stub plugins can be frustating if you have lots of INs and OUTs. Everytime you add or remove a connection, the graphical tree on the left is collapsed.
The current status of the tree should be preserved, and after adding or removing a plugin, the tree should be refreshed to reflect the changes, keeping the current cascade.
Also, after deleting a link, the parent node on the tree should be selected, to allow further editing of plugins without the need to select the parent node again on the graphical tree.
Best regards,
Pedro Torres

bug.short_desc: Search feature

long_desc.thetext: There should be a search feature that allows us to search for model elements based on a name provided. Could provide options to narrow the scope based on types of elements, of diagrams, etc.
I think this can be done using the UrnElementFinder class, and IMarkers (like the problems view). Probably the same kind of interface for the search results view.
Searching entire workspace via name is now supported. Filters can be added at a later date by editing UrnSearchPage and UrnSearchQuery.

Good start. Would be good to: - Indicate whether this is for the current model only or the entire workspace - Whether this is for UCM, GRL, or both types of elements - Whether this is in the name, name + description, or all properties of the element

bug.short_desc: Outline: should allow filtering, searching, and sorting

long_desc.thetext: Outline should allow filtering, searching (with auto-completion), and sorting. Also, a better default mechanism for expanding/collapsing trees might help deal with large models.

Looks good. A couple of small bugs: - The filter icon does not seem to have been included (tried on a fresh new install of Eclipse 3.5). I see a red square in 2 places (see snapshot) - In the Preference page, the last item should say "start and end points", not "start and empty points". A couple of items should specify UCM too. Hence, I would suggest the following order and fixes in the preferences:
- Show element ID numbers in outline. For instance: name (1234). - Show GRL-related elements in outline. - Show UCM-related elements in outline. - Show UCM empty points and direction arrows in outline. - Show UCM forks and joins in outline. - Show UCM start and end points in outline. - Show URN concerns in outline.
Finally, the "Default" order is not clear. You might want to expand...

Created attachment 24 See red squares and problems with the preference page
See red squares and problems with the preference page
Our code was looking for Filter16.gif when the filesystem contained filter16.gif. Must work on some systems but not others. Also did the other changes.

bug.short_desc: Strategy View: Double click on intentional elements

long_desc.thetext: When a strategy is selected, double click on an intentional element should edit the evaluation value

bug.short_desc: It's not possible to manually resize dimensions

long_desc.thetext: It would be nice if dimensions would behave similar to soft-goals when one want to resize them. Right now the sizes of dimensions are being set automatically.

bug.short_desc: GRL visualization of trends

long_desc.thetext:
Often, one wants to see whether multiple GRL strategies capturing snapshots of indicators over time lead to some visible trends. There is a need to visualize such trend, at the intentional element level. When selecting a sequence of strategies, trends for each intentional element (including KPIs) could be visualized with a trend widget: - green up arrow for positive trend - red down arrow for negative trend - yellow diamond for neutral trend
Trends could be defined on a per IE basis (predefined types, including how many data element required, etc.).
The KPI view could be augmented with a trend graph, or a table with the data points, or this information could be displayed as tooltip (e.g., in the metadata).
I'm biased, but again I think this is a cool idea...

When generating reports, it is now possible to include information on strategy evaluation trends (this information is shown in the Strategy Evaluations table included in those reports). When choosing the "Show GRL Strategy Trends" preference in jUCMNav, GRL Strategies are sorted by name and a trend is calculated based on a predefined number of evaluations.
Implemented in 5.3 for reports (thanks to Alexandre and Jean-FranÃ§ois), and in 5.4 for the GUI (thanks to Etienne).

bug.short_desc: Contribution override

long_desc.thetext: The ability to play with the contribution value and change it by override each time we run a specific strategy with different initial satisfaction level
Might be a special case of sensitivity analysis, Bug#790

Please confirm this is what you want implemented:
1) StrategiesView contains new top-level folder "Contribution overrides". 2) This top level folder contains the ContributionContextGroups (folders akin to scenario groups). The label is the name of the group. 3) These folders contain ContributionContexts (akin to Scenarios). The label is the name of the context. 4) These contexts have two children: Changes & Included Contexts. 5) Included contexts includes an ordered list of ContributionContexts (akin to included scenarios). No recursion. GUI to add contexts. Actions to re-order contexts. Actions to delete included contexts. 6) Changes includes a list of ContributionChanges. Label is something like 'Src ({0}/{1}) Dst' where {0}/{1} are contribution type name with specific value. Included ContributionChanges are shown in gray. They are ordered based on the order of the included scenarios, with local contribution changes overriding any included ones. 7) TBD: One must somehow activate a ContributionContext. Select the context in the treeview (how does one unselect?) versus a contextual menu action? Contextual menu is probably best. Somehow write the active context somewhere. 8) Override the values in all algorithms to use the last contribution change applicable (there can be many due to included contributions). (Instead of reading the contribution value directly on the link, first refer to the EvaluationStrategyManager's active context.) 9) TBD: When a context is active, changes made to the contributions (via the GUI) don't actually impact the contributions themselves, they create ContributionChanges in the active context. (Or do we want to force changes to be created within the treeview?) 10) The GUI will identify changed contributions with a *. I assume we'll find a way to remove these overrides as well - via the contextual menu or the editor and from within the treeview. 11) Deleting a contribution will delete any associated changes.
Am I missing anything?

Requirements 1 to 6 are correct.
7: we can have a partial solution at this point similar to what is done with scenarios and strategies (choose one of each).
8: Indeed, there could be an intermediate layer used by propagation algorithms that query the contribution level (instead of reading it in from the model value)
9: Good question... If a context is active, I would change the contribution level of the contribution change in the context, not the model.
10-11: Ok.
Looks good!

7) Short term, I guess I could deselect everything if you switch back to design view instead of the execution view. That solves my only remaining question for this issue. 8) Seems like the same layer used for the [-100,100] vs [0,100] ranges. I'll clean up the API for this so that algos can easily pick between the raw model value versus the overridden one, for example.
Sounds good, I am ready to start this bug.
The first iteration of this feature is ready to be evaluated. This feature is very widespread in the system; minor (unexpected) features may be missing so feel free to play around with it!

Excellent! I like the representation. 2 comments
- Contribution Overrides, with uppercase O (in the strategy view)
- How do we unselect overrides? (related to req. 10?)
- Sometimes there is one *, sometimes there are two (**). Is this for distinguishing between included overrides and regular overrides?
No crash so far. I can even switch languages while a strategy with included overrides is applied. Cool!
Might conflict with Azalia's new conditional algorithm though (where she recalculates some of the contributions at run-time). She will need to check this.

- Will fix the O.
- Unselect: switch back to design to deactivate all selections. Also did this for scenarios & strategies.
- Delete it via the strategies view. (Select it and delete)
- You are correct. ** is a local change override and * is an inherited one, for lack of a better scheme.
- I didn't test the logic of the algos, just forced them to go through an intermediate layer that gets/sets the contribution properly, abstracting it out.
- Oh; a note: I did not force the import/export to go through this intermediate layer - not sure if they were to export the overrides separately.
Finally, I just noticed I am missing a few little things in copy-paste which I will commit shortly.

bug.short_desc: report when transforming a non-well-nested UCM

long_desc.thetext: when exporting an MSC and we encounter a non-well-nested UCM, we should warn the user in the problems view because we are changing the meaning of the UCM.
Warning now displayed in Properties view.

bug.short_desc: URN needs Agents,Roles and Positions in GRL

long_desc.thetext:
Might as well get ahead of the game.
Out of my Dissertation, an aside rather than I will challenge URN community to put Agents, Roles and Positions into GRL (much like other i* tools). I think it is needed to support System Engineering at the level of Enterprise Architecture.
In fact, the observation I have made is that the GRL community has begun a Aspect Oriented discussion.
I am wondering whether someone has noted that Roles are to Agents what Aspects are to Architectures/Components?
Roles need not sit on any one Agent, they can actually flit across Agents, much like Aspects sit across components. They allow decomposing Agents also. Roles assigned to Positions allows one to model organisations naturally, and Roles can similarly flit across positions.
Is the current discussion really just avoiding the issue that GRL needs to match the UCM which (at least) still notes the difference between Agent and Actor? In GRL we seem to unintuitively apply cognition to the event based actor. The subtle difference between the task on a actor and then a task on an agent is lost. While you can place goals on an actor, one really wants to treat it as a machine without cognition.

bug.short_desc: Verify compliance of jUCMNav's data model with Z.151's

long_desc.thetext: Verify compliance of jUCMNav's data model with Z.151's, section 9. I believe there were minor modifications when we completed the standard, and a few discrepancies might exist.

removed all but one eContainer which was used for a good reason.
code now much more readable.

bug.short_desc: GRL in Tabular format

long_desc.thetext: The ability to automatically generate the GRL model to an understandable tabular format.

bug.short_desc: highlighting of URN link endpoints in Outline view involving URN definition objects

long_desc.thetext: There should be an ability to highlight ActorRef, IntentionalElementRef, RespRef, and ComponentRef objects in the GRL Definitions and UCM Definitions sections of the Outline view when they are the endpoints of URN Links. The "Show Target" and "Show Source" methods of the URN links popup menu should highlight these URN definition objects in the Outline view.
Added ability to highlight elements of the Scenarios and Strategies View EvaluationStrategy, StrategiesGroup, ScenarioDef, ScenarioGroup

bug.short_desc: Reports: Add actor evaluation and refactor

long_desc.thetext:
Reports currently only include the evaluation of intentional elements in the table output. Actors should also be included.
Looking at the code, I also realized that a strategy is evaluated for each cell in the table! Not very efficient... All strategies should first be evaluated once to an in-memory table and then this structure could be used to format the result.

bug.short_desc: It would be nice to have the URN Ecore packages registered in the Eclipse EMF package registry.

long_desc.thetext:
We have a model that we want to use to trace URN elements. For this, it would be nice (this is actually a standard practice) to be able to refer to URN meta-model elements from the Eclipse EMF package registry. This is easily done by using the org.eclipse.emf.ecore.generated_package extension point; add the folowing snippet to the plugin.xml file that contains the ecore files: <extension point="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.generated_package"> <package class="urn.UrnPackage" genModel="src/seg/jUCMNav/emf/URN.genmodel" uri="http:///urn.ecore"> </package> </extension> <extension point="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.generated_package"> <package class="urncore.UrncorePackage" genModel="src/seg/jUCMNav/emf/URN.genmodel" uri="http:///urncore.ecore"> </package> </extension> <extension point="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.generated_package"> <package class="grl.GrlPackage" genModel="src/seg/jUCMNav/emf/URN.genmodel" uri="http:///grl.ecore"> </package> </extension> <extension point="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.generated_package"> <package class="ucm.UcmPackage" genModel="src/seg/jUCMNav/emf/URN.genmodel" uri="http:///ucm.ecore"> </package> </extension> <extension point="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.generated_package"> <package class="ucmscenarios.UcmscenariosPackage" genModel="src/seg/jUCMNav/emf/UCMscenarios.genmodel" uri="http:///ucmscenarios.ecore"> </package> </extension>
Incidentally, the package ucmscenarios.ecore does not validate. The problem is that the class SequenceElement is contained in several classes (Sequence and ScenarioDef for example) and has a mandatory opposite reference to the parent class of type Sequence. This of course cannot be valid when SequenceElement is contained in ScenarioDef. This Ecore validation rule was not implemented in earlier versions of ecore, so this is probably why it shows up in the latest release.
Makes sense. We'll give it a shot.
Fixed. I also updated the Scenario metamodel along the way (to make the 3 aggregations 0..1)

There was a mistake in the way the genmodel files are specified in the generated packages extension. Following the way jUCMNav is released, the ecore files are located in a jar and this scheme (archive:platform:/plugin/seg.jUCMNav/jUCMNav.jar!) must be used to specify the genmodel location.

bug.short_desc: Navigate to (other) references of a definition/reference

long_desc.thetext:
Here is a useful navigation feature that is missing to handle large models. Often, we want to see the references of a definition (for GRL IEs, GRL actors, GRL links, UCM responsibilities, and UCM components), or the other references of a reference, if any.
If a definition is selected (e.g., in the Outline view) via right-click If references exist Add a popup menu "References..." with a sub-menu that lists the diagram name and reference ID. For example: in: Diagram X (id: 43) in: Diagram X (id: 55) in: Diagram Y (id: 41) (note: there can be many references on a same diagram)
If a reference is selected (e.g., in the Outline view) via right-click If *other* references exist (beside the selected one) Add a popup menu "References..." with a sub-menu that lists the diagram name and reference ID of the *other* references. For example (if ref#55 is selected): in: Diagram X (id: 43) in: Diagram Y (id: 41) (note: there can be many references on a same diagram)

A Responsibility Reference as a repetition count attribute (an integer). This value, if different from 1, shall be shown between curly brackets as part of the label of the responsibility reference. Note that different references to a same responsibility definition may have different repetition counts.
For example, a responsibility "R" whose repetition count is 3 should be shown as "R {3}"

bug.short_desc: Support for KPI values in CSV import (and likely export)

long_desc.thetext:
We need to find a way to make sure we can initialize KPI current *evaluation* values (and not just satisfaction values, as we have now).
I guess one option is to suffix these values (for import) with another symbol (say, "!"). This would fill the new KPINewEvalValue object of the evaluation (currently in the metamodel, but unused).
For export, we need to decide if we only export satisfaction values (so, no change) for KPIs, or give the choice (at export time?) between using evaluation values and satisfaction values, for all KPIs.

I performed some work on this bug, however we do have a problem.
Here's what I did on the import (export was not touched): 1 - If the value has a ! suffix, I currently import it as the KPIEvalValueSet.evaluationValue instead of the Evaluation.evaluation. 2 - I am not using the KPINewEvalValue at this point. 3 - The current import always creates a new group, and a new strategy (unless I am doing something wrong). It therefore imports the value, but not target/worst/threshold values.
It thus appears that this import is partially useless until we implement the included strategy import. If the imported strategies included another one, the KPINewEvalValue would thus make sense, because it wouldn't have to load the target/worst/threshold/unit values.
Leaving this bug open until we implement bug 855.

Enhanced the import code to use KPINewEvalValue when appropriate (included strategies). Otherwise, just sets the regular evaluation value.
Closing bug. If an export is required, I would propose a global preference "CSV Export: Export KPI evaluation values when applicable)" rather than prompting on every import. Create another bug if this is required.

bug.short_desc: Support included strategies in the CSV export/import format

long_desc.thetext:
At the moment, the CSV format ignores included strategies. We need to consider strategy inclusion to enable the separation of KPI definition (target, threshold, worst; not supported in the CSV format) and KPI evaluations (which will include the definition and override the definition's evaluation with the one from the including strategy's KPINewEvalValue).
We can assume that a strategy can include only one other strategy (like single inheritance). However, the included strategy does not have to be defined in the CSV file (but must already exist in the model).
Do we need to state the group? Unlikely.

bug.short_desc: Deleting an EmptyPoint before a Stub with an InBinding

long_desc.thetext:
Deleting an EmptyPoint before a Stub with an InBinding will make the model corrupted (you won't be able to save). I think what happen is that the DeleteNodeCommand will delete the empty point then it'll have one of the two connections to delete. I think it deletes the connection after and take the connection before the empty point to continue the Path. This causes the connection referenced in the InBinding to be unconnected from the model, wich cause saving error.
This affects TrimEmptyPointCommand.
Bug depends on uniform way to delete bindings. We should not have to implement this code in all commands; should use a compound command with one instance of the code.

highlighted scenarios/strategies would be cool too.
Removed meaningless metadata.

Added pages in the html export for UCM and GRL global definitions. For UCM added output for variables, enumerations, scenarios. For GRL added strategy evaluation tables with legends.
The two new non-diagram html files are UCM_Definitions.html and GRL_Definitions.html in the pages/ directory. They are not linked to the main menu as the menu parser needs to be rewritten to allow adding non-diagram files. Currently only IURN diagrams can be added to the menus.

Good. However, I noticed that the actor evaluations in the reports (HTML, PDF and RTF) do not work; their satisfaction values are never change (they are always equal to the ones computed for the first strategy)!
Issue with non-changing Actor evaluations has been fixed.

bug.short_desc: dropdown should respond faster

long_desc.thetext: Drop down for reference definition in property pane should respond immediately to keyboard rather than requiring first mouse click on arrow
There is an action in the outline view to show the element ids. We need to create an icon for this action.
Wrong bug number!!!

1) Was already implemented. Press enter to select the property element; the keyboard arrows will then work without having to click. 2) Will not be needed thanks to the new auto-complete inside the GEF editor.

bug.short_desc: Insert an EmptyPoint before a Stub then delete the InBinding

long_desc.thetext:
To reproduce this bug, insert a Stub in a path that contains an empty point before the first input of the stub, then make a new InBinding in the Stub with the first input. Then insert a new node just before the input of the stub. Now go back in the StuBindingDialog and try to delete the InBinding.
I think it's a problem related to the fact that the CutPathCommand doesn't handle the fact that if the connection behing cut leads to an InBinding, then it has to change the order in wich it reorder the connections.
Try this with an OutBinding, the bug doesn't happen because the order of CutPath reorganisation of the connection is Ok for the out bindings.
Bug depends on uniform way to delete bindings. We should not have to implement this code in all commands; should use a compound command with one instance of the code.
(SplitLinkCommand)

bug.short_desc: Invalid thread access when exporting a URN model without scenario definitions

long_desc.thetext: During a scenario export (to .jucm or .jucmscenarios), there is an Invalid thread access exception generated when there are no scenario definitions in the URN model.
Fixed, but needs a better war to warn users.

bug.short_desc: element view problems

long_desc.thetext: Tested under Eclipse 3.1 - labels wrap only on last entry, but if it is very very long, still doesn't fit. basically, cells don't grow with content. - when selecting a responsibility, it is selected in the editor, but the properties view is not updated.

renamed summary because view changed name.
also, when first loaded, the element icons are grayed out. once selected, these go away.
when editing a soft goal (may be the case for other nodes too), only the first three lines are displayed. the figure does not expand to accommodate the text.

- label wrap works with 3.2 - properties view updated - added some code to deregister when errors would occur. - gray out problemf ixed with new bg color onload - wrapping changes when model changes now via list.pack(), which automatically resizes everything to the correct size.

bug.short_desc: Invalid default value for Preferences under Linux

long_desc.thetext:
In the jUCMNav Preferences tab, as soon as "AutoLayout Preferences" is selected, further browsing/editing of the preferences is no longer possible because the default value for "Path to dot" is not valid under Linux:
"Could not accept changes The currently displayed page contains invalid values"
User's choice seem to consist in clearing the field altogether or setting a valid one (e.g. /usr/bin/dot, if graphviz is available).

bug.short_desc: Static Semantics Checking Preferences contains invalid values

long_desc.thetext:
Under Linux, when entering the tab "Static Semantics Checking Preferences", the following error pops up:
"Could not accept changes The currently displayed page contains invalid values"
After going back and fro a few times, the tab eventually opens. If Cancel is hit, a java.lang.NullPointerException occurs. If the Cancel is hit while the selected page is the "Static Semantics Checking Preferences" tab, the next time Window -> Preferences is opened with start with the error above. If OK is hit, an error message pops up.
"Error An error has occurred. See error log for more details"

bug.short_desc: RTF export has small images

long_desc.thetext: The RTF report sometimes contains images that are not zoomed properly (too small).
At this time, the RTF export no longer works, at all. I don't think it really gets invoked, and nothing gets generated.

Diagrams were scaled and translated twice, which caused the distortion of the images once they were inserted into the RTF report. They are now scaled and translated once, using the same logic as in the PDF reports.

bug.short_desc: Revisited stub without any selectable plug-in does not generate error

long_desc.thetext: If a stub is traversed by a scenario once without problem and is then traversed again only this time no plug-in condition is true, the scenario stops and no error is reported in the Problems view. See the scenarios in the TCS group of the attached .jucm file.
Created attachment 6 Bug shows up in the TCS scenarios
looks fixed now.

did some work on this. labels are moved after a zoom if you move an element. (we need to call refreshVisuals when changing zoom.... haven't had time to figure out how to hook this up yet)
also, they still need to be scaled. (labels are small when diagram is at 400%. they stay the same size).

When a strategy is active: - the satisfaction symbol and value for each intentional element are not located and sized properly. - in addition, if an actor is used in the model, the actor satisfaction symbol (stickman) and its numerical value are not located and sized properly.

long_desc.thetext: When a group of scenarios is executed for execution (right-click on a group or on the UCM Scenarios item in the Strategy/Scenario view), if there are problems they may or may not be reported in the Problems View. Actually, sometimes they are, but sometimes they are not (nothing is reported at all). See attached .jucm file for an example.
Created attachment 8 Sample UCM file with scenario problems
What exactly is not being reported in this example? Looks fine to me.
Seems to be working here as well, can no longer reproduce. The refresh button does not refresh the execution of a group of scenarios, but this is fine.

Priority is not as high as other data types.

long_desc.thetext:
should be able to right click on a model element such as a start point and say "add to currently activated scenario", for example.
more alternatives need to be defined.
won't do this because there is a distinction between the design mode (where this would be useful) and the execution mode (where this would be possible).

bug.short_desc: Add ability to generate reports using all standard paper sizes

long_desc.thetext: Add the ability to generate PDF and RTF reports using all standard paper sizes (http://www.dpandi.com/paper/index.html). Even though the page dimension is configurable in the report generator's preferences, the title page as well as the strategy evaluations table won't display some elements properly.
The jUCMNav icon on the title page is now scaled down depending on the size of the report's pages, and the title page's table is also resized depending on the width of these pages.

bug.short_desc: Invalid thread access error

long_desc.thetext:
When multiple .jucm files are part of a Java project and an export is being performed on a model that is not currently opened, the following scenario will cause jUCMNav to throw an exception (more precisely an "Invalid thread access" error): - Right-click on the .jucm file to export (i.e. the file not currently opened in an editor); - Select Export... and select "Generate a report" in the Export Wizard. You will see that the URN model will change to the model you want to export. - Make sure to assign an existing file name in the report prefix. - When the Finish button is clicked, an information message will ask you if you wish to overwrite the file. Click Cancel. The URN model will change back to the model that was opened before executing the Export Wizard. - Assign a different value in the Report prefix section and then click Finish again.
The URN model displayed in the editor should change back only when the Wizard is closed.
This error also occurs when multiple .jucm files are opened in the same Java project.

bug.short_desc: GRL strategies: initialization problems when included strategies are expanded

long_desc.thetext: Suppose a strategy definition X that included another strategy Y. In X is expanded in the Scenarios and Strategies view, then further modifications to initialize elements for X result in modifications to Y. If X is not expanded in the view, then X is (correctly) modified and Y is (correctly) not modified.

bug.short_desc: responsibility figures should be rotated to follow path.

long_desc.thetext:
oops (just woke up)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 224 ***

bug.short_desc: selection not updated in other views when map tab is clicked in editor.
scenarios: plugin selection window refinement

long_desc.thetext:
jason,
i've come across another issue when using scenarios. in our lab, we have to deal with TeenLine and OCS being activated at the same time. the solution requires a loop which executes OCS in the first pass and TeenLine in the second (i.e. a different plug-in for the Screening stub is chosen in each pass).
when navigating the scenario, the Screening stub is clicked to continue the scenario on the plug-in map. after clicking the stub, jUCMNav shows a dialog box with both plug-ins (OCS and Teenline). would it be possible to somehow indicate which one came first? i am thinking of possibly displaying a "1" next to OCS and a "2" next to Teenline. currently, the user does not know which plug-in map to choose when the dialog box is shown.
ciao, gunter.

if you reduce the palette width until a certain point, you will reach a state where you cannot increase its size anymore.

bug.short_desc: HTML report displays all of the report folder's content in Explorer

long_desc.thetext: When clicking on a directory of the HTML report in Explorer, the whole content of the directory will be displayed in the main frame. Only the html pages should be displayed. The issue doesn't seem to happen in Firefox.

bug.short_desc: bug rename/save

long_desc.thetext: Create a new file. When it is opened, rename it in the navigator. Edit the file and save it. The file will be saved to the old name instead of the new one.

bug.short_desc: problem with automatically adding links between nodes

long_desc.thetext:
while the feature to automatically add decomposition links which were already entered previously is useful, the feature to automatically enter dependency links has some undesired side effects.
consider the case where there are four actors and more than one pair of actors are connected by a "response time" or "accuracy" dependency.
e.g. ActorA depends on ActorB in terms of response time ActorC depends on ActorD in terms of response time the response time soft goal has to be shown twice on the GRL graph
adding the dependency link between ActorA and first response time causes an automatic add of the dependency link between ActorA and the second response time. this should not should happen.
work around: use different names for the two response time soft goals. then, the link is not automatically created. the disadvantage is that then there are two soft goals with different names which however should reference the same thing.
What do you suggest to "fix" this issue in jUCMNav?
Partial fix implemented: there is a new preference to disable the automatic replication of GRL links. This could be extended to cover this situation.

bug.short_desc: UI enhancement when renaming element

long_desc.thetext: When renaming a reference with a unique name (actually the definition is renamed) and a naming conflict occurs, instead of ignoring the change, prompt the user to see if he wants to switch the definition of this current referece?

bug.short_desc: GRL strategies in reports should be ordered alphabetically

long_desc.thetext: The GRL strategies in the GRL section of the reports should be ordered alphabetically. They are currently ordered by their creation date.

bug.short_desc: Error generated when preference text box is left empty

long_desc.thetext: The application does not handle empty text boxes in report preferences, it currently generates an invalid thread exception.

bug.short_desc: Stub selection window: Use Esc key to exit from the window

long_desc.thetext: In the stub list dialog, we should be able to exit the window using the Esc key
maybe it was added in eclipse 3.2

bug.short_desc: Display strategy description in the GRL strategy legend

long_desc.thetext: The report currently only displays the strategy name, it should also display the strategy's description when it is available.

bug.short_desc: SplitLinkCommand should insert blank nodes if necessary

long_desc.thetext: as defined previously.
no longer true; see change requests.

bug.short_desc: Warn user before overwriting a file

long_desc.thetext: The application should warn a user when the file name and directory chosen for a report already exists. Currently, it overwrites the file without any warning.

bug.short_desc: UCM Scenario execution summary

long_desc.thetext: A section in the reports should display an execution summary for each UCM scenarios indicating whether the scenario passed or failed, and displaying any warning messages.

Thanks JF!

long_desc.thetext:
maximum hit count for infinite loop should be configuration property
we should define a property page for this algorithm's config settings.

bug.short_desc: jUCMNav editor icon is not found

long_desc.thetext: Workbench does not load the jUCMNav icon because its path in plugin.xml is invalid.

bug.short_desc: 3.1: remove extra items from contextual menus

ugly fix.

timers/waiting places that are queried multiple times should not increase the hit count that is displayed.

bug.short_desc: palette preferences

long_desc.thetext: when we change the palette preferences in one map, the changes are not reflected in the others until we reopen the file.

bug.short_desc: add close button to plugin selection dialog

long_desc.thetext:
the plugin-selection dialog should have a close button for those who don't know how to close using escape.
also if possible, make it modal so we don't end up opening multiple ones.

bug.short_desc: ExportDXL: CompRefs have no descriptions, while they should include that of their respective definitions

long_desc.thetext:
ExportDXL: CompRefs have no descriptions, while they should include that of their respective references
This request comes from Daniel. It initially also noted that resprefs didn't behave properly. I fixed that. However, I don't think that the DXL export script allows for exporting the description of a CompRef. I think that the DOORS side must be updated to change the script format.

that's correct. the dxl script does not allow exporting of the description of a component reference. it allows exporting of the description of a component. the only component data that's repeated for the component ref is the name.

Gunter,
can you specify what you would like to see printed ? Then re-assign it to me and I will fix it.
Alain

the current format of the DXL script for component references is:
compRef(<ID>, <Fx>, <Fy>, <Width>, <Height>, <Anchored>, <DefinitionID>, <Name>, <ComponentRole>, <ParentComponent>)
this should be extended to include the description:
compRef(<ID>, <Fx>, <Fy>, <Width>, <Height>, <Anchored>, <DefinitionID>, <Name>, <ComponentRole>, <ParentComponent>, <ComponentDescription>)

bug.short_desc: stub bindings: delete/undo/redo should have tooltips, enabled/disabled states.
