bug.short_desc: multi-drag&drop from outline

long_desc.thetext:
do not select an element added by drag&drop (this becomes an issue when using drag&drop to add several existing elements to a new diagram
because for each element one has to again scroll down to the definitions in outline)
with bug 566, this would automatically work because no element would be selected in the treeview after insertion.
Is now fixed. From the regular outline, it still does the old behaviour, but from the new definitions outline, it works as intended.

Does not work for me. I try to drag&drop multiple components from the new Definition view in the Outline to a new map (or an old one), but nothing happens. Works only for one component. Same issue with responsibilities and with GRL elements.

This bug isn`t about drag & drop of multiple elements at the same time. It is about the auto-selection of the reference in the outline makes it hard to perform another drag&drop of a definition. If you have the definitions view open, the selection doesn't change.
Ok, sorry for the misunderstanding.

bug.short_desc: Remove unnecessary subsections in Scenario Documentation section

long_desc.thetext: Since a URN model may contain a large amount of scenarios, the Scenario Documentation section of reports may become unnecessarily large. Therefore we should remove any subsection (i.e. Start points, Initializations, etc.) that does not contain any useful information, and fit multiple scenarios on one page (if possible).

bug.short_desc: User should be able to set the default contribution level as a preference

long_desc.thetext:
User should be able to set the default contribution level as a preference
Currently the default contribution level is Help for all algorithms. Help is a good default for qualitative and quantitative algorithm but it not be the best default for formula based algorithm. Even for While doing modeling using formula based algorithm, I noticed I had to change the contribution level every time I add a new contribution link.
I believe Help is a good default but we should allow user to change this via preferences dialog. Users may want to have different defaults based on their modeling activity.

bug.short_desc: for 3.0.2+: change appearance of dynamic stub

long_desc.thetext: - start point should be larger - end point should be a longer line - dynamic stub should have thicker dotted lines (might do for static as well)
also, the fill color of a filled stub overflows the outline.

Seems to have been fixed in november 2004. https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=4853
We are using: Release Build: 3.0.1 September 16, 2004. These downloads are provided under the Eclipse.org Software User Agreement.
Should be able to change dynamic stub figure with version 3.0.2
only dyn stub remains. renaming bug and downgrading priority.
We only support 3.1 now.

bug.short_desc: ReqCompPathBind && ReqCompPathUnbind

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNav SHALL support the (containment) binding of a path element to a component. jUCMNav SHALL support the unbinding of path elements contained in (bound to) a component.
had forgotten to assign this when started working on it. see bug 134.

bug.short_desc: Need to refactor access to Problems view

long_desc.thetext: At the moment, the Properties view is updated locally from the scenario traversal, the CSM export, and the OCL verification. This needs to be refactored into a mode central utility.
This is the Problems view, not the Properties view.

bug.short_desc: ReqElemAndJoin && ReqElemOrJoin

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNav SHALL support the creation, naming, editing, and moving of UCM and joins. jUCMNav SHALL support the creation, naming, editing, and moving of UCM orjoins.

See Bug 250, Bug 251, Bug 252
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 250 ***

bug.short_desc: GRL export

long_desc.thetext:
Should be very easy to extend the export extension point to allow exporting GRL graphs.
Most useful for exporting GRL as images.
Wizard should not ask to distinguish between both types in first step, it should however have buttons to automatically set all UCMs, all GRLs or all graphs on the second page.
Support for exporting GRL graph added in revision 715.

bug.short_desc: GRL should support including strategies in another strategy.

long_desc.thetext: GUI changes done. Am unsure what the tool will do with this so I didn't implement MoveUp/Down Actions/Commands. If necessary, reopen this bug. Rest behaves pretty similarly to scenarios.

The logic of using this needs to be in the propagation algorithms (or in some intermediate layer).
I don't expect more that one strategy to be included in another in the short term, so let's start with this and see later if move up/down will be needed.

Re-opening:
Please identify which algorithm(s) you want me to update to use this new behaviour. I didn't assume any, but you seem to want all?
What logic should I be using? I haven't played with the algos themselves, so am not 100% sure of what is required.
Here's what I have in mind: 1) If you're running a strategy which has a defined Evaluation, use it in the algorithms. 2) If not, then look at the list of included Strategies and see if any have it. Pick the value of the last included strategy. 3) Assign these values as starting values for the GRL algorithm, and compute all the other nodes. Correct?
(Therefore, included strategies only impact the initial evaluations)

I've added move up/down while implementing contribution overrides. (To be committed with contribution overrides)
I re-opened this issue, but am unsure if I should re-close it since the algorithms themselves are outside of my mandate for this iteration?
It was discussed that all the algorithms should be tweaked to use the included evaluations to be able to close this bug.

I think there are issues with this feature. From looking at the XML file, it seems the parent-included relationship is inverted.
This might explain why, if SratX incldes StratY, when I select StratX and set an initial value to a goal, the initial value becomes stored in StratY (and hence, StratX and StratY always remain equivalent).
This is weird, because often when I create a GRL model, the strategy inclusion works fine. Then somehow this weird behaviour starts, and inclusions don't work anymore...
Please email me a copy of the problematic file and indicate where it is inversed and I will investigate.
My mistake. I had 5.2.0 installed, but I have just installed the latest version and this seems to work well now. Sorry Jason!

bug.short_desc: ReqSaveAs

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNav SHALL support saving the document (in XMI) to a file selected by the user.
currently the progress monitor or something like that breaks the code in doSaveAs() (exception is caught)
fixed. 6h

bug.short_desc: Add URN Model Name to Reports

long_desc.thetext: The URN Model Name should be included at least on the title page of reports, in addition to the report title. This is applicable to all report types.

bug.short_desc: ReqElemAndFork / ReqElemOrFork editing
start/end should have a display pre/post condition contextual menu item

long_desc.thetext: if the label is empty, should pre fill the label

bug.short_desc: Add Diagram Options in Report Preferences

long_desc.thetext: The report generator should give users the option to generate reports only for a particular type of diagram (UCM or GRL). Moreover, the report generator should detect whether a particular type of diagram exists in the model, so that the report generator does not print any information on this type of diagram in the report.

The Report Generation Preferences page now shows groups of preferences, one for each component of a URN model. Two of these preference groups contain UCM-related and GRL-related preferences. When the first preference in one of these two groups ("Show UCM diagrams and descriptions" or "Show GRL diagrams and descriptions") is unchecked, jUCMNav will ignore all elements related to UCM and/or GRL diagrams when generating a report.

bug.short_desc: Responsibility binding

long_desc.thetext:
Allow for an "abstract" responsibility in a plug-in map to be bound to a concrete responsibility provided by the stub on the parent map. This would improve the reusability of maps in a model and accross models (customizable patterns).
This enhancement would impact the metamodel, the GUI and the traversal mechanism.
Metamodel and GUI are changed. Traversal needs an update (for recursive substitution of responsibilities).

bug.short_desc: allow deleting unused component definitions in outline view.

long_desc.thetext:
All components shown on screen are ComponentRefs. Each of them links to one ComponentElement. We want to be able to choose, in the properties view, an existing component or a new one.
if we select a componentref right now and change its id/name/description, it will change the componentelement's.
how should we manage changing the componentref's componentelement? This is what I have in mind but the UI manager will have to define exactly what is to be done.
alternative one: change id/name text field(not sure which one is supposed to be unique): if new id/name corresponds to that of an existing componentelement: change the componentref to point to this existing componentelement; user might not know he is changing the reference else prompt "do you want to rename this component reference or create a new component?"
alternative two: make id/name readonly. add a Component property which opens a dialog window. you see a dropdownlist (?) of different components and a "new component" option and three fields id/name/description. when you select an item in the dropdown, the fields are updated with the content of the selected component.
(the UI might be prettier with a multiline combobox on the left with all components listed and the fields on the right. form contains three buttons: add new component, select (updates reference according to selected item in list), close (doesn't update reference).
will have to discuss how to handle componentelement deletions (imply deleting all componentrefs?)

Created attachment 4 Screenshot: current ucmnav component attributes
Adding screenshot of current UCMNav dlg

properties view allows the user to change the component definition of a certain component reference. renaming the component in the properties view renames the component definition.
remaining to be done: allow deleting unused component definitions in outline view. renaming bug.
done by jkealey

bug.short_desc: New actions to delete references and definitions

long_desc.thetext: An action should be available in the menu to delete both reference and definitions of GRL Nodes, container and responsibilities.

Comment from Ali:
There are two problems here. First: the context menu action does not specify if we delete from this view or the whole model. Second: if you actually try it, we are inconsistent in GRL and UCM. In UCM we always delete from this view while in GRL it depends. If you have the model element in another view we only delete the element from this view otherwise from the whole model. Solution : have two context menu options 1- delete from this view and 2 delete from the model. To me this is really high priority and very confusing specially the GRL part that you donÂt really know what it does unless you have memorized all your views.

Added preferences for definitions and references (in a new preferences page). By default, when the user is deleting the last reference in any diagram, the user is prompt if he wants to also delete the definition. This preference can be change to always or never delete the definition (instead of prompt).
Also, the command to delete definition have been changed to support deleting any definition. If a definition is still referenced, by default, the user is prompt if he really wants to delete the definition and all the references. This preference can also be set to always or never.

bug.short_desc: Improve selection of visibility of some GRL/UCM elements

long_desc.thetext:
Need to provide a way to see/hide: - UCM empty points - UCM stub IN/OUT - GRL contributions: text or icons or both (need to see at least one) - GRL satisfaction levels: text or icons or both (need to see at least one)
To avoid a combinatorial explosion, a new property sheet might be required. Might remove pull-down menu and add a View submenu to jUCMNav's menu.

GRL contribution visibility issue fixed temporarily via the preferences page. The refresh is not automatic; one needs to close the file and reopen it for the moment.
Still need a more generic solution for visibility of elements, but this one was urgent...

Can you clarify what/where are 'satisfaction levels'? Not sure what to hide.
PS: are these actor evaluations? are these even computed right now? I always seem to get zero everywhere.
I've made the change - what remains is satisfaction levels, which I am unsure of.
Satisfaction levels are the evaluation values on GRL intentional elements.
Thanks for the clarification. Implementation is now done.

bug.short_desc: Refactoring of Outline

long_desc.thetext: Factor out the URN/GRL definitions from the Outline and offer them in a separate Eclipse view. At the moment, one often has to scroll down to access them for drag&drop, and clicking on anything else on the map brings the Outline back to diagram elements (references), which is annoying.
*** Bug 652 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
concensus: simply create another view like concerns.
Done. Type of definitions is context sensitive.

bug.short_desc: Enable/disable preferences depending on the preferences checked

long_desc.thetext:
When the "Show UCM diagrams and descriptions" preference is not checked in the jUCMNav preferences, all "UCM only" preferences should be disabled, since these preferences won't be taken into account during report generation (similarly for the "GRL only" preferences).
If disabling preferences is not possible, the user should at least be aware that some preferences won't be used, via a label for example.
Added a warning message on the preference page whenever the user is unchecks the "Show UCM diagrams and descriptions" and/or the "Show GRL diagrams and descriptions" preference(s).

bug.short_desc: Req Comp Color : can't change default fill color.

long_desc.thetext:
create a component; it is not filled. try to fill it with its default color; you must select another color and then come back. Reason is that in order to have the color selector shown, we need to pass it a valid RGB color (null isn't valid). Null is the default value and means non-filled. For the property chooser, selecting the default color tells it the value hasn't changed so it doesn't update the model.
easy solution would be modify the model to have a field to specify if we should fill the component or not.
harder solution would be to extend the control so that it behaves properly with nulls. seems like a bad idea.
requirement is optional / low.
metamodel version 6: "filled" Boolean attribute to Component Element
updated code.

bug.short_desc: Add path cut

long_desc.thetext:
From T. Weigert:
If I want to insert a "endpoint/startpoint" combo into an existing path (say I want to add a possible scenario start into an existing long path) I need to: i. insert some symbol (say a stub), ii. delete that symbol which breaks the path into two, and iii. connect the resultant start and end points. A simple "cut path" operation would be good to avoid having to do the trick with the stub.
Could be limited to empty points or to path segments first.
We can now cut a path on any node connection on empty point (except an empty point with a connect) and on a direction arrow.

bug.short_desc: ReqLabels - ComponentsRefs

long_desc.thetext: Allow ComponentRefs to have labels. Probably the same code as you have now but with UCMmodelElement

bug.short_desc: scenarios: create extension point(s) for scenario traversal

long_desc.thetext:
We want to allow various traversal mechanisms to be defined.
1) Define which ScenarioTraversalAlgorithm to use. - Have people implement IScenarioTraversalAlgorithm - Extension point to say which IScenarioTraversalAlgorithm to pick in ScenarioUtils.traverse(EObject scenario, Vector listeners)
2) assume default is used. Have a configuration page for the default traversal mechanism. Define which instance of AbstractScenarioTraversal is used in GraphExplorer.
3) assume default is used. Have a configuration page for the default traversal data structure. Define which instance of AbstractScenarioTraversalDataStructure is used in AbstractScenarioTraversal.runImpl(QueryRequest q)
With these variation points, it should be easy enough to extend the scenario traversal mechanism.

In retrospect, look into creating new traversal algorithms as new instances of AbstractQueryProcessor that are loaded before the default algorithm in GraphExplorer. This new algorithm would override sendToChain and either always handle instances of ScenarioTraversalQuery or possibly only handle them when certain conditions are met (metadata, for example) - this allows one to install a new scenario traversal algorithm that is activated on a per-model basis instead of a global setting.
The preference page would probably define in which order the installed query processors should be chained in the graph explorer.

bug.short_desc: ReqElemDelete

long_desc.thetext:
Should be able to delete easy things such as: * empty nodes * responsibilities * components
etc.

bug.short_desc: properties view: tabbed properties view

long_desc.thetext:
http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Tabbed-Properties/tabbed_properties_view.html
use the new tabbed properties view to enhance the usability of the editor and provide a richer editing experience.
Now supported. Can be improved later on a case-by-case basis.

bug.short_desc: ReqHelpAbout

long_desc.thetext: jUCMNav SHALL have an About menu item that displays the tool version, contributors, acknowledgements, and copyright notices.
infrastructure put in place. remains to be filled in properly.
This is pretty much done...

bug.short_desc: GRL: Default contribution value should be Help

long_desc.thetext: When adding a contribution, the default value should be Help/25 (as this is the most common value).
Fixed at the EMF level. Will also be the default of the next metamodel version (0.21)

bug.short_desc: Option to delete unused definitions (components, responsabilities, actors, intentional elements)

long_desc.thetext: User should have the option to delete unused component and responsability definitions (show in the Outline).
Three years later, this comes back again! Should be part of the jUCMNav Preferences.
An action to delete the unused definition is available through the Outline, when the URNSpec is selected.

bug.short_desc: and/or decomposition context menu item

long_desc.thetext: the contextual menu of an intentional element should offer an item that allows changing from and-decomposition to or-decomposition
Added contextual menu, action, command, and command test.

bug.short_desc: Clicking on a label should edit it even when a palette item is selected

long_desc.thetext: Worth considering: When a UCM/GRL palette item is selected, we probably do not want to insert it in a diagram if we drop it on a label (we likely want to edit the label, without having to press Escape first).

bug.short_desc: Display variable initializations in tabular format

long_desc.thetext: Since a scenario may contain multiple variable initializations, the information related to initializations should be displayed in a table (in the Scenario Documentation of the reports).

bug.short_desc: refactor & improve: CutPathCommand

long_desc.thetext:
Should be able to cut any path, not only those surrounded by empty points. The method is currently complicated because we reference lots of surrounding elements. We should try to localize the change as much as possible.
Furthermore, it might be easier to create a compound command to handle cutting paths on an empty point, where it would first be removed and then the node connection cut.
This command should also allow cutting a path on a DirectionArrow.
It may be simpler to cut node connection by taking its (inferred, not obtained from the figure) middle point and moving one end above it and the other below (Instead of staying on the actual path itself)

bug.short_desc: Should be able to drag-and-drop a direction arrow on an empty point.

long_desc.thetext:
From Jason:
Can't drag & drop a direction arrow onto an empty point from the palette. responsibilities work, however.
this problem is on all versions of jUCMNav
Fixed. Added special case in org.eclipse.gef.editpolicies.LayoutEditPolicy#getCreateCommand(org.eclipse.gef.requests.CreateRequest)

bug.short_desc: Undoing the deletion of a GRL diagram while evaluating strategies cause an NPE

long_desc.thetext:
If we are evaluating a strategy and if we undo the deletion of a GRL diagram, then this causes a null-pointer exception.
This is not an issue when we are not evaluating a strategy.
java.lang.NullPointerException at seg.jUCMNav.strategies.QualitativeGRLStrategyAlgorithm.init(QualitativeGRLStrategyAlgorithm.java:111) at seg.jUCMNav.strategies.EvaluationStrategyManager.calculateEvaluation(EvaluationStrategyManager.java:85) at seg.jUCMNav.editparts.LinkRefEditPart$ElementLinkAdapter.notifyChanged(LinkRefEditPart.java:90) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.BasicNotifierImpl.eNotify(BasicNotifierImpl.java:280) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationImpl.dispatch(NotificationImpl.java:1033) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationImpl.dispatch(NotificationImpl.java:1038) at grl.impl.ElementLinkImpl.setSrc(ElementLinkImpl.java:202) at seg.jUCMNav.model.commands.delete.internal.RemoveElementLinkCommand.undo(RemoveElementLinkCommand.java:102) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CompoundCommand.undo(CompoundCommand.java:169) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CompoundCommand.undo(CompoundCommand.java:169) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CompoundCommand.undo(CompoundCommand.java:169) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CompoundCommand.undo(CompoundCommand.java:169) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CompoundCommand.undo(CompoundCommand.java:169) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CompoundCommand.undo(CompoundCommand.java:169) at org.eclipse.gef.commands.CommandStack.undo(CommandStack.java:345) at seg.jUCMNav.editors.DelegatingCommandStack.undo(DelegatingCommandStack.java:404) at org.eclipse.gef.ui.actions.UndoAction.run(UndoAction.java:93) ...
Was actually fixed in bug 694.

bug.short_desc: Images of Diagrams are replaced without question (Export)

long_desc.thetext: when exporting diagrams as .png. the diagrams they replace currently availble diagrams without any notice. in particular when different diagrams based on different strategies are needed, it will be easier to have an option to change the name while exporting the diagram.

A warning dialog has been implemented which warns the user about graphics files about to be overwritten and offers users a choice to either generate unique filenames with -v2, -v3, ... -vn extensions or to overwrite files. It is automatically invoked by the Export Wizard in the event that existing graphics files are about to be overwritten.

bug.short_desc: UI: Path Elements should be over path.

long_desc.thetext: Currently hard to select; intuitive: click on element but the path is over it.
The connection layer is now the bottom layer.

bug.short_desc: UI: Path elements doesn't behave as InteractionScenarios

long_desc.thetext: http://jkealey.shade.ca:82/twiki/bin/view/ProjetSEG/InteractionScenarios
path tool should extend path in other direction when start point is selected.

bug.short_desc: Delete NodeConnection between two Stubs

long_desc.thetext: Make a path. insert two consecutive stubs. Then delete the connection between them. The result is two stub with only one in or one out and little path of one start point and one end point.

bug.short_desc: scenarios: limitation with triggering paths

long_desc.thetext:
context: - scenario start point1: parent map drills down into a stub into a plug-in map where a timer blocks. - scenario start point2: from the plug-in map, a triggering path is launched to unblock the timer. - the parent stub is in a component ref. (A) - scenario start point 2 is bound to a component ref (B) - the timer, connect and triggering end point are not bound to a component ref.
given the above context, the MSC export algorithm will generate an MSC where a message is sent from B to the environment instead of B to A.
reason: scenario start point 2 is launched directly in the stub. therefore, this path does not have any context information enabling it to find the parent map.
the parent component ref of a triggering end point, the connect, and the blocked element (waiting place or timer) should be the same. currently, the context information is merged after unblocking the waiting place or timer. it would have to be done while traversing the end point so that the message goes to the appropriate instance.

bug.short_desc: 3.1: new editor option

long_desc.thetext: in 3.1, one file can have multiple editors. when doing so, our editors are not synchronized.

bug.short_desc: export wizard + multi-map select

long_desc.thetext: the export wizard builds a list of available maps from the selection. by default, it should add all maps and only select the currently opened one if we export from the editor.
Seems to be working well enough.

bug.short_desc: MSC viewer can't open files that are linked in an Eclipse folder

long_desc.thetext: When I drag&drop a .jucmnavscenarios file to a folder in Eclipse, I am given the choice between copying the file in the folder, or creating in the folder a link to the file. If I copy, the MSC viewer opens the file without any trouble. If the file is linked, then what I get is an empty model in the viewer, and no warning/error whatsoever.

bug.short_desc: Invalid Thread Access error when generating reports

long_desc.thetext:
An Invalid Thread Access exception is thrown when trying to generate any report from certain jucm files.
Issue is in the method writeStrategies(...) in ReportStrategies.java, at line evalGroup.sortStrategies();
The sortStrategies() method sorts the GRL strategies (contained in an EList in a StrategyGroup object) alphabetically by using the java method ECollection.sort(...). The error seems to happen in the sort method. Could be an invalid item in the list.
Temporary solution: Excluding the GRL Strategies section from the reports by unchecking Show GRL Strategy Evaluation Information in the preferences should allow report generation.
The call to the sort() method of the strategy list is now made in a distinct thread, which is synchronized with the UI thread (J-F & Alex H.).

bug.short_desc: UI: Drag & Drop creation appears to work but does nothing

long_desc.thetext: try to drag & drop an empty node for example. visual feedback says it will work, but you fail.

Normal behaviour on this platform (Eclipse).
Correct workflow: user clicks palette item, then clicks in diagram to create element.
Not worth investigating further.

I see. Indeed, this setting should apply to all the maps at once (I don't see the benefit of having this on a per map basis).

bug.short_desc: The selectedItem variable is not always set properly.

long_desc.thetext:
To reproduce:
Choose a dynamic stub with bindings -> Edit Stub Plugins Expand the Stub (click on RIGHT arrown into DOWN arrow) Expand the OutBindings (click on RIGHT arrown into DOWN arrow) Select OutBindings (click *ON* the OutBindings item)
The execution ends up in handleTreeBindingsSelected() with (data == null) hence selectedItem not properly set
** Checked against version 1099 of StubBindingsDialog

This appears to be by design. Clicking on a label such as In Bindings or Out Bindings purposefully doesn't change selectedItem (although the view is updated to reflect the selection).
we're selecting the list of in/out bindings. if we did set it to one particular inbinding, hitting delete would delete that particular one and not the list. if we selected the pluginbinding, hitting delete would delete the whole plug-in binding, undesirable given the circumstances. Should it be reset to null?
The bug report does not discuss the issue this brings up.

bug.short_desc: GRL contributions should use movable labels

long_desc.thetext: I think we should implement movable labels for contributions type soon. Edition of large GRL diagrams is hard to do without this feature.

Etienne has done most of the work; at a glance it seems to work nicely, but I think all that remains is to tweak the initial position of the labels when reloading existing models.
In my models, they appear extremely far from the elements; I thought it simply did not exist. Furthermore, if multiple dependencies point to the same element, they all overlap.

I have made minor changes to the positions and it should now be "good enough". Impossible to replicate the previous position because we're adding the label when loading the model, before the GEF editor is loaded. We also want to avoid replicating all the code that was there before to automatically position it.

GRL contribution labels are now positioned perpendicularly to the last segment of the contribution connection. This enables the same behaviour as the previous contribution labels positions through connection decorations which were not moveable. Also changed default positions for new labels.

When moving labels by dragging them, they are now moved to a location other than the one where we dropped the label (especially if the contribution link is horizontal; for some reason if the link is vertical this is less of a problem).
Math.abs was not a good idea to calculate my coordinates...

new solution implemented by etremblay. feedback on start/end/resp/direction arrow implemented by jkealey
postponing fork/joins
Joins now have some feedback, but forks... will be... tricky :)
I mean for AND-* it works, OR-* are tricky because it's not clear what feedback should be there.
stick with no feedback on orfork/orjoin.

bug.short_desc: Model Diff

long_desc.thetext: There should be a way to report on (and ideally visualize) the differences (additions, deletions, modifications) between two models.

I have just tried EMF compare. http://wiki.eclipse.org/EMF_Compare
It works and is very thorough, as it operates the the serialization.
Does this bug want something more specific? What are the use cases this bug tries to solve?
I get the feeling people don't care too much about things that were moved or internal changes (URNspec version, etc.). However, I have difficulty seeing how simplified questions such "what responsibilities were added" would be used in real life. Is EMF Compare "good enough", since we don't have specific scenarios?
Thoughts?
See attachment for EMF Compare.
Note: You must add *.jucm to one of the content-types for the "compare with" feature to work. I think we could do this for the users by extending a particular extension point within jUCMNav so that it works out of the box. (Saw something earlier but cannot find the link).
Created attachment 40 emf compare
Here is the link that I was looking for: http://wiki.eclipse.org/EMF_Compare/FAQ#How_can_I_programmatically_add_my_model_file_extension_in_EMF_Compare_so_that_it_is_called_automatically_.3F
It was discussed that adding the content type was sufficient but that a new view, using EMF compare internally, would be explored.

With my most recent commit, you may now use the Eclipse Marketplace to find "EMF Compare" and, as soon as it is installed, you may do 'compare with each other' on two models in Eclipse.
Note: Might be nice to get jUCMNav added to the Eclipse Marketplace.

bug.short_desc: Automatic creation of GRL diagrams from model

long_desc.thetext:
GRL models created by importing an Excel/CSV table (for legal/regulation models) come with one diagram that covers an entire model. This diagram is too big. We need an undoable command (or many) that can create as many diagram as there are non-leaf GRL intentional elements in the model (i.e., elements that are not decomposed or not not the target of contributions).
Maybe have a command that works on a selected intentional element (IE): - Create a new diagram - Add a new reference to IE - Expand one level down (based on Rouzbahan Rashidi-Tabrizi's thesis) - Auto-layout (if not already done) This command could be accessible from the Show Linked Elements pop-up menu
Another command could iterate through each non-leaf element of the model and (if the diagram does not already exist), invoke the first command to create a sub-tree view. Not sure where to invoke this command (from URNSpec? from Show Linked Elements pop-up menu).
Automated tests should be created for the above.
Not sure how to handle dependency links or name/annotate the diagrams (so we know they already have been created). This needs to be discussed. There might be a need to have a 3rd command to clean up diagrams whose initial IE was deleted.
There might be a need to split this bug into several ones!

Added two new commands :

and
/seg.jUCMNav/src/seg/jUCMNav/model/commands/create/ShowNonLeafElementsInSeparateDiagramsCommand.java
Both accessible from the contextual menu.

bug.short_desc: Create a DetachBranchCommand

long_desc.thetext:
During my work I often found myself needing a DetachBranchCommand.
It should act like the DeleteNodeConnection command, except that it should not delete the resulting path if it is a simple path (Start - NC - End).
Furthermore, there should be an construction option that lets us decide if we want the fork/join/stub to be deleted if it no longer the appropriate number of in/out paths. The DeleteNodeConnection command replaces it with an empty point (or just deletes it, I don't remember) automatically but sometimes when building models, one would like the fork to remain there because we're planning on re-attaching new branches.
A move branch command would also be useful to move a branch from one fork to another, one join to another, etc. You could even say move this set of branches to a node connection, creating the fork/join along the way.
I implemented the partial logic for all this in the MakeWellFormedCommand, but cheated along the way. For example, I deleted the source fork/join and attached the remaining branches to existing fork/joins under the preconditions that no branches would get automatically deleted (true in my context).

bug.short_desc: Guard Conditions

bug.short_desc: ReqElemTimer

bug.short_desc: copy-paste support

long_desc.thetext: jucmnav should support copy & paste: a) from jucmnav to jucmnav: duplication b) from jucmnav to other program: copy screenshot

Copy-paste of UCM/GRL models within the same map is the most requested user feature. A prototype should be created that would allow copy-pasting partial models while ensuring the validity of the pasted data. Once this prototype is created, other features may be considered: - Cut portions of model (Cut & paste) - Copy-paste from one model to another - Copy-paste from jUCMNav into another application (Graphical capture)
implemented as per specification

bug.short_desc: scenarios: enumeration value naming conflicts with variables

long_desc.thetext:
if a variable has the same name as an enumeration value, it has precedence in the evaluation algorithm. the engine doesn't discover that the value exists and causes type checkers when the enumeration value is used.
to resolve this problem, we have to enhance UcmEnvironment / jUCMNavType to infer types as a list of possible types. this is already done to allow the values of enumerations to be usable in different enumerations, but not with the other base types (integer/boolean).
I don't know how I closed this bug. probably didn't open the right one. Reopening.

Still does not work. If I use the jUCMNavDemo_v5.jucm file: - I can run all scenarios without any problem. - If I rename the AccountabilityType enumeration to Accountability123, I can still run the scenarios. - If I rename the Accountability123 enumeration to Accountability (the same name as one of the variables), then running the scenarios makes this Eclipse instance freeze, without any error message.

The problem disappears if I take the normal quantitative algorithm. The issue seems to be with the new conditional GRL algorithm, and especially with how it handles metadata (seems to loop infinitely in MetadataHelper methods).

The problem is definitely in the new GRL algo, when there are actors. I just cannot see why. There seems to be a problem when we are deleting metadata in cleanRunTimeMetadata(URNspec model) , which invokes removeMetaData(URNmodelElement elem, String name)
I thought this was the issue of removing an item from a list we iterate over (in a synchronized environment), but I just can't find the solution. At some point, there seems to be an endless loop.

1 - In your description, you mentioned renaming an Enumeration Type to the same name as a Variable. However, the bug is to support renaming an Enumeration Value (example: TRUST or AGREEMENT in your model) to the name of a variable.
2 - I will look at this other bug (and see if I can replicate it), but it is probably completely unrelated (given that the GRL algos don't have anything to do with my change).
3 - In my instance of the model, most scenarios fail because there are no In Bindings for the Review stub. I've added that binding myself for future testing purposes.

bug.short_desc: BSplineConnectionRouter is refreshing ALL splines anytime.

long_desc.thetext: BSplineConnectionRouter should refresh only the spline where the node moved or where the node was created etc...

bug.short_desc: Move/Rename jucm file does not delete old copy of the file

long_desc.thetext: When moving or renaming a file from the Navigator, if some changes have been done and have not been saved before, the application move or rename the file. Then, a "Save Ressource" window prompt to save change in the old file. If we click yes, there is 2 copies of the file.

this is a bug/intended behaviour in the eclipse framework
the move is performed and then the editor is informed via the ResourceTracker

bug.short_desc: Properties: Description property should be a multiline textbox

long_desc.thetext: In the properties view, the definition property should be used a textbox that is on multiple lines (using scrollbar if necessary).
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=25356
(description, not definition)

I created a TextAreaCellEditor for the comments feature. I have hooked it up with the properties page and it works fine except visually it doesn't take up more vertical space (it is hard to figure out if there are multiple lines). I am guessing we need to build a custom property tab to be able to have it take more space.
With bug 639 commited (tabbed properties), this bug is fixed.

bug.short_desc: ParentFinder getPossibleParents bug

long_desc.thetext:
getPossibleParents gets the plausible parent and recursively gets the list of parents of this plausible parent. however, possible parents also include components that partially overlap each other at the given location.
example: a |----| | | b | |---- | x | | |----| | | | |--------|
the possible parents of x are a and b, not just a.
this is very low priority because components that partially overlap might not even be legal; they have no meaning.

bug.short_desc: Double click on start and end points in a stub

long_desc.thetext: A double-click on a start or end point from a map in a stub should return to the parent map (such as UCMNav).

bug.short_desc: refactor: seg.jUCMNav.editors.actionContributors

long_desc.thetext:
ActionRegistryManager and UcmContextMenuProvider have been modified many times. Each time, it is to add a new action that was added in the actions package.
* Use setText() in the actual action, not the ActionRegistryManager * Make the action registry manager look at the seg.jUCMNav.actions package and using reflection, build the action registry. Maybe automatically add all UCMSelectionActions or add a method to UCMSelectionActions that is queried to see if it should be automatically added. * In the context menu provider, go through the action registry manager and try to add all UCMSelectionActions (maybe add another method to see if should add in contextual menus). * Not a big performance problem; finding all actions is done once per multipageeditor (because action registry is loaded once). Action registry is relatively small and we're adding almost all actions in it to the contextual menu. * Would help prevent many bugs that happen when someone new adds a new action and doesn't know where to register it. Would decrease useless modifications of files.
For example of using reflection (quick google search reveals): http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/javatips/jw-javatip113.html

bug.short_desc: refactor: seg.jUCMNav.figures.util

The package contains two locators that were simply ripped from the framework and had a few lines of code changed to add some refreshing or prevent the application from crashing given illegal circumstances usually found only when deleting multiple elements.
We should try to get rid of these classes and simply depend on the framework classes instead of massive copy-pastes of the 3.0 version.
Deletion code refactored; do this after unit tests are implemented for deletion code.

bug.short_desc: refactor: query infrastructure

long_desc.thetext:
Hopefully this will be covered in DevDocQueryInfrastructure.
* Basically, our mechanism is to send requests to a singleton pattern that returns responses. * the single pattern uses a linked list of query processors to determine who should run the query and obtain the response. * right now, all our QueryRequests/QueryResponses are inner classes of the query processors, meaning we need to know who will process the request before sending it to a generic structure that will run it indirectly. * I propose creating convenience methods in GraphExplorer that will encapsulate this complicated structure. Basically, for most purposes, a simple: public static Vector GraphExplorer.getReachableEndPoints(PathNode pn) is sufficient. * More complex queries/responses will justify creating/manipulating these objects directly. Their real purpose is to retain preprocess queries and cache results. * Working with inner classes is terrible. Forces the user to know exactly what query processor he will use. Extending them is even worse. * Maybe we can create a nice (non-inner) class hierarchy for queries/responses. * We would simply have to create a new instance of a query/response using a constant of RequestObject to determine the work to be done. * Without such methods, the GraphExplorer is pretty useless as we can run our queries much faster by creating the processors ourselves. * Can't we make GraphExplorer's run() static, using its only instance to run? Avoid calls to getInstance().

bug.short_desc: refactor: attempt alternate solution in DevDocConnectionOnBottom

long_desc.thetext:
We could we have done instead now that we know GEF better? At the beginning of the project, we made a bad decision that made our life harder for the rest of the project for the kind of things we talk in this page. We put the Map and the PathGraph in the same EditPart. This was an error because they are two distinct model elements and they contains different things.
What should have we done? Make an EditPart for the Map and another for the PathGraph. Both Map and PathGraph EditParts figure would have been a FreeformLayer. Then since the Map is higher in the hiearchy than PathGraph, the Map layer would have been under the path nodes and since Maps contains components, the components would have been drawned under path nodes. But then a problem remain, how do we draw the connections under path nodes but not under components?
The answer I think is that we could have done a new layer in our RootEditpart like mentionned in the solution section and then say to the Map layer figure to draw in the component layer now. Now since Map and PathGraph are now separated, we don't have anymore problems of having to update two separate layers for the same EditPart. We just have to update the component layer.
I think this could be done just by separating the MapAndPathGraphEditPart into two class, MapEditPart and PathGraphEditPart. This would require a LOT of testing though.
jkealey: I'm 100% for trying to implement this solution as it would reduce our reimplementation of framework code tremendously and because many bugs were caused by our implementation. What I would worry about is which one of these editparts would receive create requests (by palette). Having two edit parts that take up all the visible space and overlap each other might be problematic. However, it might not be as we can still select components even though they are behind the MapAndPathGraphEditPart. Therefore, the framework might query the underlying layer with the CreateRequest if the top layer says it can't handle it.

bug.short_desc: PathTool: improvements

long_desc.thetext:
During an experiment, I found that it was easy to simplify the existing code by removing the palette listener and simply coding our tools properly and using the setFlag() command to decide if the default tool should be selected after use. This would help simplify the current code which changes the default tool to the currently used tool because we didn't want it to be deselected after use.
Doing this, it is easy to change the behaviour of the path tool to be able to select pathnodes when clicked on.
I think what would be nice (and easy to do) is this: path tool + fork/stub/join : add branch (in or out for stubs?) path tool + empty point: create fork/join (depending if start/end was selected) else select. path tool + timer without timeout path: add branch path tool + other pathnode : select
We should add a keybinding for space to remove revert any tool back to the selection tool.
Same should occur with right-click.
coded selection when click on pathnode, remove tool with right/middle click.
downgrading priority; rest is out of scope for version 1.0.0

bug.short_desc: bind/unbind context menu item behaviour could be enhanced.

long_desc.thetext:
right now, the cheap solution has been taken. if all the selected elements can perform the context menu item, it appears in the context menu.
what would be preferable is as long as all of the selected items are valid in context, if at least one of them could allow the action, allow it.
for example, imagine component A inside component B, A bound to B.
if we select A and try to unbind from parent, it will be allowed. if we select A and try to unbind from parent, it will not be allowed (no parent).
right now: if we select A and B and try to unbind from parent, it will not be allowed (they won't all behave the same)
preferable: allow the command but only execute it on the valid ones.
closing bug because relatively unimportant and because all actions built since then only work if one item is selected.

Some don't have pre/post conditions implemented and command tests. Wait until this bug is done before implementing them.
I forgot to mention JoinStartToStubJoinCommand as well.

bug.short_desc: multipage editor / outline: should be able to open only a subset of all maps.

long_desc.thetext:
would be nice to be able to open an editor for a map (tab) only if we select it in the outline.
we should be able to close it using ... ? ... a contextual menu on the actual tab or at least a contextual menu in the outline...
Etienne would like to see a close button inside the editor itself; I would find that horribly ugly.
I think we might be able to do something nice if we overwrote the style of our bottom tabs.

I would put a header at the top of our editor with the title of the map and a close button at the right of this header. The network editor has something similar (but without any button).
From a UI point of view I personnaly think that the users won't try to close a tab using a context menu first... They'll try to find a close button somewhere (maybe on the tab or at the top of the editor). Powerusers will then try to use context menu on the tabs... Maybe our UI expert should give his opinion here. ;)
I want to push this out of scope for our project.
No problem with that, be we should provide at least one way to close a tab...
As of 2.4.0, Outline is collapsed by default. Multipage editor still shows all diagrams.

Created attachment 22 Very long list of diagrams in a model
There is also a scalability issue with complex models, see screenshot.

attachment.desc: Very long list of diagrams in a model
